p.blogspot.com/-BF6SkMOjtB0/WvAfh5FGkAI/AAAAAAABMPM/CRSrZcBNsMk88s8PBOw_m3QZNUUibB-ZwCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn25@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-39-595_00f7af3bf7bbfc3e.webp","http://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/b9e61398e92be104bb7c696f18e9948073a6668d/images/search/350.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn38@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-42-466_7ef71eb4167fd5c2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228321},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Baking Cart Organization","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/07/baking-cart-organization.html","description":"Every once in awhile this blog venture of mine brings me some really wonderful opportunities. This is one of those stories.\n<br />\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--uRo9jxQVh4/XT-vS3lnu5I/AAAAAAABOeM/ZJi22n1uVq8rNhcil8hdiQty6Pi1kedUwCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_Header.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--uRo9jxQVh4/XT-vS3lnu5I/AAAAAAABOeM/ZJi22n1uVq8rNhcil8hdiQty6Pi1kedUwCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_Header.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n My niece has had a passion for baking as long as I can remember. And that passion was slowly taking over their home. They have a modest size kitchen sans pantry and it could no longer accommodate all of her baking trays, decorating tools, toppings, mixes, powders, utensils, trays, etc...\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <a name=\"more\"></a>\n <br />\n <br />So, they turned a spare room into a bit of a makeshift storage pantry that she could call all hers. It was a blank slate room with two stacking shelves, a fridge, and a large bookcase to corral it all.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FzqzsgD3QHM/XT-vLr9yX6I/AAAAAAABOeU/flsRQ5Xvluwv9-Qxl26ZdwajdLMuYU8UQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Baking_Supplies_Before.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"897\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FzqzsgD3QHM/XT-vLr9yX6I/AAAAAAABOeU/flsRQ5Xvluwv9-Qxl26ZdwajdLMuYU8UQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Baking_Supplies_Before.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Because she bakes almost daily, she takes multiple trips into the room to haul everything back and forth, including her heavy stand mixer.&nbsp;\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n A few weeks ago I received an email from Michaels Stores and they asked if I would be interested in sharing my experience organizing one of their rolling craft carts on my social media. I knew instantly who would benefit from one of these versatile storage stations (my niece), and quickly asked her mom to text me a photo of their current setup (above).&nbsp;\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Let's chat about a few ways that rolling cart can be functional organization around the home and why they are truly and organizers dream:\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <ul>\n  <li>Craft Supplies (for kids or adults)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>For Guests (towels/linens, water, snacks, toiletries, flowers, candle/matches, etc...)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Garage/Outdoors as a Portable Grilling Station</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Outdoor Toys/Activities</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Nursery Supplies (small toys, diapers/wipes, swaddle blankets, onesies, toiletries/lotions)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Laundry Supplies (detergent, stain remover, dryer balls/sheets, steamer/iron, trash bags, cleaners)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Sewing Supplies (sewing machine, fabrics, patterns, threads/yarn, tools)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Bathroom (towels, toiletries, makeup, hair tools, nail supplies, spa favorites, paper products)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Cleaning Supplies (mop bucket, trash bags, dusting tools, scrubbing tools, paper products, spray bottles, vinegar, oils...)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Portable Office (laptop, writing utensils, paper, envelopes, files, planner/calendar)</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Small Appliances</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Tools</li>\n </ul>\n <ul>\n  <li>Baking (Mixer, baking powders, decorating tools/ingredients, pans, cooling racks)</li>\n </ul>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n BAKING! This was the ideal solution for my sweet-as-pie niece. A rolling cart would help her to transport all of her belongings out to the kitchen each day. And I know that this situation is probably unique but if you have a pantry, or even just some extra room in your kitchen, this cart could be your best baking buddy. There were \n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2M00SnR\" target=\"_blank\">a few options for me to select from</a>, but I decided \n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/330aTrm\" target=\"_blank\">the Essex Rolling Cart</a> was the best due to the drawers and expandable work surface. After it was easily assembled, I was honestly shocked by just how much I was able to store in this small but mighty cart (definitely emptied an entire shelving unit in her room).\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-t09T6wR9ZTI/XUBhXgkdhUI/AAAAAAABOes/bI5KcXX8d0k6BM6i2fW789PfMRkPuVmWgCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-t09T6wR9ZTI/XUBhXgkdhUI/AAAAAAABOes/bI5KcXX8d0k6BM6i2fW789PfMRkPuVmWgCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_1.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n You might think I am exaggerating, so I will show you how I organized each drawer. But first, I added a wide basket to the open shelf so that she could easily load it up with any bulkier items like her cake decorating turntable, drying racks, baking sheets/muffin tins, etc... based on what she is working on for the day. The basket prevents the items from sliding off of the edges while she is carting things to the nearby kitchen.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GxWY0sBIKXo/XUBha0k8R0I/AAAAAAABOfQ/S1MYlKkgSVM_0R7UrxpTJHiYjSkbVuVSgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_7.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GxWY0sBIKXo/XUBha0k8R0I/AAAAAAABOfQ/S1MYlKkgSVM_0R7UrxpTJHiYjSkbVuVSgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_7.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n OK, now, onto the drawers, which are always stocked, loaded, and ready when she is.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-yMGSBUKyMMc/XUBhX5XAhsI/AAAAAAABOe0/oBce0AcsldE1JpGx1MoMF_YuDj3kS9jugCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_11.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-yMGSBUKyMMc/XUBhX5XAhsI/AAAAAAABOe0/oBce0AcsldE1JpGx1MoMF_YuDj3kS9jugCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_11.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Drawer number one is full of colorful goodies: cupcake liners, food/icing coloring, food-safe dusting powders, and sprinkles!\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iUD60OnzrO8/XUBhXpqrQ-I/AAAAAAABOew/SGnMltQHSp0Klr5Di2eV3IHfARE5ZLkqwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_10.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iUD60OnzrO8/XUBhXpqrQ-I/AAAAAAABOew/SGnMltQHSp0Klr5Di2eV3IHfARE5ZLkqwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_10.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n The next drawer is so intimidating to me because I have no idea what to do with all of those icing tips, but I have watched my niece decorate her creations and she definitely puts these to use and appreciates all of the options she has collected over the years. All of the tips and couplers are organized in divided craft boxes or drawer organizers so she can quickly find exactly what she is looking for.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4VAvS4UnNY8/XUBhuYJKSAI/AAAAAAABOfo/mjFwXyjPYuY9Q7F0W-kN_5VISMMTXprkgCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_9.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4VAvS4UnNY8/XUBhuYJKSAI/AAAAAAABOfo/mjFwXyjPYuY9Q7F0W-kN_5VISMMTXprkgCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_9.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Drawer number three is an extension of drawer number two and holds all of the piping bags of various sizes.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nIXNqvq1JE4/XUBhbj1xZVI/AAAAAAABOfk/HPm2OKnvGsQUX142b_E46Mm6pFSjQQJOwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nIXNqvq1JE4/XUBhbj1xZVI/AAAAAAABOfk/HPm2OKnvGsQUX142b_E46Mm6pFSjQQJOwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_8.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n The bottom drawer is sized just right for spatulas and measuring utensils.\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n There are two rows of drawers; four shallow and two deep options.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xq_Zjeb1ABA/XUBhZtyegFI/AAAAAAABOfg/we5Hk1au74IXSb6eltZUWi7JWjXI4PORQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_13.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xq_Zjeb1ABA/XUBhZtyegFI/AAAAAAABOfg/we5Hk1au74IXSb6eltZUWi7JWjXI4PORQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_13.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Mixer attachments can be bulkier, so the deeper drawer was ideal for those. But there was enough room to add a fondant roller and a variety of scrapers.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KYMvbGYHNjg/XUBhY-CE4bI/AAAAAAABOfk/6eav7RHC6fEK0KtJbnFBeL-qv-P8jnflACEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_12.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KYMvbGYHNjg/XUBhY-CE4bI/AAAAAAABOfk/6eav7RHC6fEK0KtJbnFBeL-qv-P8jnflACEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_12.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Finally, the bottom drawer is divided out in a plethora of fondant molds and tools, as well as more icing scraper attachments.&nbsp;\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n My eyes have been in heart shapes since I filled this cart with her goodies, and I think she would tell you the same. She was so excited and grateful and got right to work baking me a thank you cake. We both won.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Xv7LaFQP-_I/XUBhZ8z2pVI/AAAAAAABOfg/pMJd6rNE6UcYJJielU4Txe1k1gdfyI4bwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Xv7LaFQP-_I/XUBhZ8z2pVI/AAAAAAABOfg/pMJd6rNE6UcYJJielU4Txe1k1gdfyI4bwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_3.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n After she loads up the cart with any supplies for her project and takes it all out to the kitchen, she can flip up a small shelf to expand her overall prep/working surface.\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NK-zWYXd2Qk/XT-vTCgqYQI/AAAAAAABOeg/HFGp4Rt4JxQmPkaJzouSIEfpF4hAwRwVQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Webp.net-gifmaker%2B%25285%2529.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NK-zWYXd2Qk/XT-vTCgqYQI/AAAAAAABOeg/HFGp4Rt4JxQmPkaJzouSIEfpF4hAwRwVQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Webp.net-gifmaker%2B%25285%2529.gif\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n This cart will remain her baking bff for years to come, and should her needs ever change, I love knowing there are 101 other useful ways she can make it work for her.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iIno0qdKl6k/XUBhatuFjgI/AAAAAAABOfc/di0sI5lKI0sKMbylQ2g4EB9S7wQFx40_QCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_5.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iIno0qdKl6k/XUBhatuFjgI/AAAAAAABOfc/di0sI5lKI0sKMbylQ2g4EB9S7wQFx40_QCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_5.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n In full transparency, Michaels provided me with the cart, but only sponsored my social media content. I really wanted to also share the story here because it was just a feel-good day to be able to pass this small gift of organization on to my niece, and I 100% stand behind the functionality. \n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/330aTrm\" target=\"_blank\">The cart</a> was a really good value (especially when you use a coupon or watch for sales), rolls smoothly, and has more storage than I was expecting. Even if you don't bake, hopefully, you are now able to visualize alternative ways that rolling carts can be handy household helpers.\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n That said, I would love to know if you have a rolling cart in your home, and how you make it work for you. Did I miss any other helpful examples?&nbsp;\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 30 Jul 2019 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":5474,"bgimg":"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--uRo9jxQVh4/XT-vS3lnu5I/AAAAAAABOeM/ZJi22n1uVq8rNhcil8hdiQty6Pi1kedUwCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_Header.png","linkMd5":"1eb62bb202fadd52c9cae3a42998f9dc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn34@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-28-893_7623248184472aa7.webp","destWidth":550,"destHeight":825,"sourceBytes":661090,"destBytes":54566,"author":"IHeart Organizing","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--uRo9jxQVh4/XT-vS3lnu5I/AAAAAAABOeM/ZJi22n1uVq8rNhcil8hdiQty6Pi1kedUwCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_Header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn34@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-28-893_7623248184472aa7.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FzqzsgD3QHM/XT-vLr9yX6I/AAAAAAABOeU/flsRQ5Xvluwv9-Qxl26ZdwajdLMuYU8UQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Baking_Supplies_Before.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn37@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-47-891_ee2fa29196a9cdb1.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-t09T6wR9ZTI/XUBhXgkdhUI/AAAAAAABOes/bI5KcXX8d0k6BM6i2fW789PfMRkPuVmWgCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn57@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-43-898_3793d8f3e1fb7d77.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GxWY0sBIKXo/XUBha0k8R0I/AAAAAAABOfQ/S1MYlKkgSVM_0R7UrxpTJHiYjSkbVuVSgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn86@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-34-174_eb384b2106115081.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-yMGSBUKyMMc/XUBhX5XAhsI/AAAAAAABOe0/oBce0AcsldE1JpGx1MoMF_YuDj3kS9jugCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_11.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn33@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-48-372_9effdd1e58ee41fd.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iUD60OnzrO8/XUBhXpqrQ-I/AAAAAAABOew/SGnMltQHSp0Klr5Di2eV3IHfARE5ZLkqwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_10.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn62@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-32-108_74c1698b3686bbf3.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4VAvS4UnNY8/XUBhuYJKSAI/AAAAAAABOfo/mjFwXyjPYuY9Q7F0W-kN_5VISMMTXprkgCLcBGAs/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_9.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn81@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-31-741_feca81050823dc56.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nIXNqvq1JE4/XUBhbj1xZVI/AAAAAAABOfk/HPm2OKnvGsQUX142b_E46Mm6pFSjQQJOwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_8.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn70@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-47-704_d85cdf6adecf0e2a.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xq_Zjeb1ABA/XUBhZtyegFI/AAAAAAABOfg/we5Hk1au74IXSb6eltZUWi7JWjXI4PORQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_13.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn21@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-31-911_90db5e0025935394.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KYMvbGYHNjg/XUBhY-CE4bI/AAAAAAABOfk/6eav7RHC6fEK0KtJbnFBeL-qv-P8jnflACEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_12.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn17@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-42-758_020d5436f6c69119.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Xv7LaFQP-_I/XUBhZ8z2pVI/AAAAAAABOfg/pMJd6rNE6UcYJJielU4Txe1k1gdfyI4bwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn14@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-44-304_6bb4e24219a33f5c.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NK-zWYXd2Qk/XT-vTCgqYQI/AAAAAAABOeg/HFGp4Rt4JxQmPkaJzouSIEfpF4hAwRwVQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Webp.net-gifmaker%2B%25285%2529.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn18@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-49-791_677da25ade98b8a7.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iIno0qdKl6k/XUBhatuFjgI/AAAAAAABOfc/di0sI5lKI0sKMbylQ2g4EB9S7wQFx40_QCEwYBhgL/s1600/Michaels_Essex_Baking_Cart_Organized_IHeart_Organizing_5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn77@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-43-505_2b251c2f4682a30f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228318},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"DIY Sliding Closet Door","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2020/01/diy-sliding-closet-door.html","description":"A while back we did a lot of work on \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/06/an-organized-teen-boy-closet.html\" target=\"_blank\">our teen boy's bedroom closet</a> which included widening the doorway to allow for a large, built-in storage unit. His room isn't all that large or \"roomy\", so maximizing his closet to allow for both drawer and hanging storage was extremely important and has proven to be a great way to give him more space for reading, working on projects, having sleepovers, and doing his homework.\n<br />\n<br />We knew there were so many benefits to widening the doorway to his closet, but then the problem solving began in terms of how to cover it all back up.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AplXUNxxkCY/Xh-Al1bfoTI/AAAAAAABPw4/SDx1TayZiTQoDNy0O9He-aWMRWtkErjmgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Header.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"767\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AplXUNxxkCY/Xh-Al1bfoTI/AAAAAAABPw4/SDx1TayZiTQoDNy0O9He-aWMRWtkErjmgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Header.2.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />There was a bit of planning and troubleshooting and decision making that went on with this project. Here are a few of the things we had to work through:\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />To keep the trim or not? That was the question. I decided that if we kept the trim around the door, that it ultimately should be completely covered by the door when it was pulled closed. But that would also increase the size of the door by about 4-5 inches in width, and the door was already measuring pretty large. The alternative was to remove the trim, but that would require more drywall work and some fussy refinishing.\n<br />\n<br />Before making a quick decision, we thought we would install the rail to get a good idea of how far away from the wall the door would hang, and if the trim would interfere with it at all. Bryan easily had the rail installed in less than an hour and didn't even call me in to help (using the included installation instructions). Yay Bryan! Except I was instantly confused by the placement of the rail. He used the large bolts that came with the rail kit and installed them directly into the wall studs. Which made complete sense. But, this meant that the rail didn't go all the way to the corner of the room (it was just an inch or two short). If you want to be extremely specific about the rail placement, then you actually need to install a ledger board into the studs first, and then the rail can be installed anywhere into the ledger. Bryan knew I didn't want to use a ledger board if I could help it, so he just assumed going into the studs was the answer. But then I wasn't sure if I loved that the hardware didn't land exactly into the corner. And that led to another decision to make.\n<br />\n<br />We now knew that the door would hang out enough to clear the trim, so the trim was going to stay. But before making any more decisions regarding the rail placement/ledger board, I wanted to construct the door and see it on the rail. The advantage of a ledger board is that it gives you the flexibility to install the rail hardware wherever you would like. It also allows the door to hang even further away from the wall/trim. The disadvantage is that it is another distracting element that adds to the entire setup (although painting the board the color of the wall would minimize that).\n<br />\n<br />When coming up with the design for the door, I had a couple of inspiration pictures saved that I continuously referenced. \n<a href=\"http://www.rachelhalvorson.com/franklin-farmhouse/bbfvitlwi0bo7ls5iuwz5y0ean9sq5\" target=\"_blank\">This one</a> and \n<a href=\"https://www.decorpad.com/photo.htm?photoId=154228\" target=\"_blank\">this one</a> were my top two favorites. They both had a diagonal design that was trimmed out in a classic style. My son also really liked the design and gave me the thumbs up. With the hardware installed, we now knew how the rail system worked, where we wanted the wheel hardware to attach to the door, and the maximum thickness the door should be.\n<br />\n<br />\n<i><b>Quick Tip:</b> We taped a couple of pieces of paper together that were scaled to the exact width of the door that we had planned to build. Then we drew the top trim boards based on our measurements and \"installed\" the paper on the rail with the hardware. This was a GREAT way to visualize how the door would cover the closet door casing and also allowed us to confirm that the boards we were planning on using to trim the face of the door would line up nicely with the hanging hardware. I like to visualize things before completely committing whenever possible.</i>\n<br />\n<br />Finally, my last but largest concern that I had was that the large door would be too overwhelming due to the smaller size of his room. The door was going to be just over 4' x 7' and I just didn't know of any other options in terms of closing off that wonderful opening we created. I told myself that sometimes larger things work best in small rooms to create more visual interest and to help balance some of the smaller accessories and knick-knacks. I also figured I could paint the door a similar color to the walls so that the pattern could be the focus, and the color would more or less fade away.\n<br />\n<br />Now that we had worked through all of those points, it was finally time to start building that dang door!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uQXO0HeCXio/Xh4n2wpmHvI/AAAAAAABPuQ/VOw-m-mEdJAkESbI_tMTUYq6K-M-WdonACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_7.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uQXO0HeCXio/Xh4n2wpmHvI/AAAAAAABPuQ/VOw-m-mEdJAkESbI_tMTUYq6K-M-WdonACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_7.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9dI7fUcg4Zw/Xh4hh86IVJI/AAAAAAABPsU/nD9d7nB6HxQjtKkd0emH35mljr3tsG2-wCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Material_List.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"62\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9dI7fUcg4Zw/Xh4hh86IVJI/AAAAAAABPsU/nD9d7nB6HxQjtKkd0emH35mljr3tsG2-wCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Material_List.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/370cG1m\" target=\"_blank\">4' x 8' x 1/2\" mdf board</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2FVkzZH\" target=\"_blank\">1\" x 2\" x 8' primed boards</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2thHjk3\" target=\"_blank\">1\" x 4\" x 8' primed boards</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/3a60pKJ\" target=\"_blank\">5/16\" x 5 1/2\" pine lattice boards</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2FOunor\" target=\"_blank\">large paint sticks</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2uGIlq3\" target=\"_blank\">miter saw</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/3aa6S7q\" target=\"_blank\">circular saw</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2RlFv1k\" target=\"_blank\">wood glue</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/35SGaN1\" target=\"_blank\">brad nailer</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/36VgctA\" target=\"_blank\">paintbrush</a> | \n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2Rkc5k6\" target=\"_blank\">paint roller</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/35Mm7jq\" target=\"_blank\">barn door hardware</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2Ru7AUz\" target=\"_blank\">door pull</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2Q39XOI\" target=\"_blank\">cordless drill</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2tWZg7u\" target=\"_blank\">speed square</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2RfPNjM\" target=\"_blank\">wood putty</a> | \n <a href=\"http://bit.ly/3adfgCT\" target=\"_blank\">sanding block</a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<br />Because our opening plus trim was over four feet, we talked through a few ways to achieve that width with as little wood as possible (to keep the door from getting too heavy). We began with a 4' x 8' piece of 1/2\" thick MDF because the actual dimensions are 49\" x 97\". If we were to trim out the edges with 1\" x 2\" boards, then we would be exactly where we needed to be. With that in mind, we thought we would construct something similar to our son's \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2015/10/diy-herringbone-pattern-headboard.html\" target=\"_blank\">DIY headboard project.</a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nH7pguNEH_A/Xh4n4SiInSI/AAAAAAABPuA/exsPN6pCwOAPWh1AAVGX96Xj-Bym0I4lQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"767\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nH7pguNEH_A/Xh4n4SiInSI/AAAAAAABPuA/exsPN6pCwOAPWh1AAVGX96Xj-Bym0I4lQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_1.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The rail was already installed so we had the exact measurements we needed so we began by cutting the height of the door accordingly.\n<br />\n<br />Then I got to painting. I decided it would be easier to paint the back of the board, and the edges of the top boards, before assembly. I am telling you, doing this first was a major sanity saver later on! It made putting that final coat of paint on the finished door SO MUCH EASIER not having to get my brush down inside of every last groove.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--fUeG-Q61kU/Xh4n7QgxprI/AAAAAAABPuE/Iiq1Fb16EiIYonKrwn86E5cTqc-QCe4dQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"916\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--fUeG-Q61kU/Xh4n7QgxprI/AAAAAAABPuE/Iiq1Fb16EiIYonKrwn86E5cTqc-QCe4dQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_4.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />For the diagonal pattern we used 1\" x 4\" primed boards that we cut to length. What is hard to see is that we drew a couple of pattern lines lightly in pencil to be sure our first few pieces went in exactly where we wanted, as those pieces would set the stage for all of the remaining cuts.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lq4HfZw1iuI/Xh4n6LCzZSI/AAAAAAABPuE/FEv6FCDmcScaQZC5Dp8jIs2vuAI31_VRACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"292\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lq4HfZw1iuI/Xh4n6LCzZSI/AAAAAAABPuE/FEv6FCDmcScaQZC5Dp8jIs2vuAI31_VRACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_3.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />To affix the boards to the MDF, we covered the back of each board in wood glue and used our brad nailer and 1\" brad nails.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nbhyQ9bnX68/Xh4n6elZH-I/AAAAAAABPuQ/XX8nWYnzXAQ8p3Yptv9hqaMLC0QIg2T3wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1183\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nbhyQ9bnX68/Xh4n6elZH-I/AAAAAAABPuQ/XX8nWYnzXAQ8p3Yptv9hqaMLC0QIg2T3wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_2.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />We used a speed square along the edge to draw our cut line, everything was cut at a 45-degree angle with our miter saw.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1bLxV-yYkfc/Xh4n7b8ATcI/AAAAAAABPuU/0Phm7yVtYnkUYXLlBRiAvJpO_qnCb-1NQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_5.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"304\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1bLxV-yYkfc/Xh4n7b8ATcI/AAAAAAABPuU/0Phm7yVtYnkUYXLlBRiAvJpO_qnCb-1NQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_5.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />While purchasing material and paint, we noticed some extra-large paint stir sticks and thought that they would make for the perfect spacers. And they did!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UT7FzK89TNM/Xh4n89Cjz-I/AAAAAAABPuU/5lcKwJbUlE8jhAnGZpwNdFytRFh39wYjACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_6.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"952\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UT7FzK89TNM/Xh4n89Cjz-I/AAAAAAABPuU/5lcKwJbUlE8jhAnGZpwNdFytRFh39wYjACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_6.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />After we got going, we cut, nailed, cut, nailed, cut, and nailed... All the way until the entire door was covered in diagonal planks.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gc4Sp6JkuEk/Xh4n-vNZf-I/AAAAAAABPuM/B2FkaLmUzmYlGQU6lFfmOFSbVE8zelbhQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"882\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gc4Sp6JkuEk/Xh4n-vNZf-I/AAAAAAABPuM/B2FkaLmUzmYlGQU6lFfmOFSbVE8zelbhQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_8.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />You may notice a couple of final pieces where the spacing doesn't look right, and that is because those areas were going to be covered by the decorative trim on the face anyway, we just popped boards in for backing.\n<br />\n<br />Also above you can see how we trimmed the perimeter of the door with the 1\" x 2\" boards we purchased. Bryan ended up ripping each one to be exactly flush with the depth of the mdf board plus the diagonal pieces. Again, we added those boards to get the door just wide enough to cover both the closet opening and the closet door casing. This also added a nicely finished edge on each side of the door.\n<br />\n<br />To finish off the design, I found some light-weight pine lattice moulding at Home Depot. It was the perfect width to frame out the door and hit the rail wheel hardware juuuuust right.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-k07wmdC86e0/Xh4n-wuKlyI/AAAAAAABPuQ/vRIwL6ixde4llphq1T6tjLAId6PQmc9JQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_9.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"904\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-k07wmdC86e0/Xh4n-wuKlyI/AAAAAAABPuQ/vRIwL6ixde4llphq1T6tjLAId6PQmc9JQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_9.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I know, I know... This is that awkward middle stage where it is hard to see just how amazing it is going to look until it is all painted in the same cohesive color. But first, I had to fill every last nail hole with putty. And then I went over the entire door a second time just to be sure there were no pits. And then a lot of sanding everything nice and smooth.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-c-BGp3-ohlY/Xh4n5cgw9lI/AAAAAAABPuQ/kvbNA__YeZoDCBeHjA23w3aZPlx7fEqOwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_10.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"767\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-c-BGp3-ohlY/Xh4n5cgw9lI/AAAAAAABPuQ/kvbNA__YeZoDCBeHjA23w3aZPlx7fEqOwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_Build_10.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />This step was worth every bit of time it took to really achieve the best finish possible.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-K_mfiIi4FJE/Xh9emciMmEI/AAAAAAABPu0/xCDCNrTG4joaQXWu8rphM7yZ2OPa_2CdwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-K_mfiIi4FJE/Xh9emciMmEI/AAAAAAABPu0/xCDCNrTG4joaQXWu8rphM7yZ2OPa_2CdwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_2.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The color I went with is Benjamin Moore Wales Gray. I felt like it was just different enough from the walls (Sherwin Williams Nebulous Cloud), and complimented the ceiling (Benjamin Moore Blue Dusk).\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ycdIAop4Nk0/Xh9eqZSNeRI/AAAAAAABPv8/_yzcgf_HE_8f7uUqdP_SyqE6mQSKRjL9wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_9.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ycdIAop4Nk0/Xh9eqZSNeRI/AAAAAAABPv8/_yzcgf_HE_8f7uUqdP_SyqE6mQSKRjL9wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_9.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Once the door was up, I decided it wasn't worth it to move the rail to the corner of the wall and add a ledger board behind it. The fact the rail stops an inch short isn't all that obvious because the edge of the door goes right into the corner. Plus, the details on the door steal the show!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hT2ISNLeRSo/Xh9nowvpAcI/AAAAAAABPwc/3AdxvOBw47I0tozmF_VD-C4JYSei9L4dACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_15.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"767\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hT2ISNLeRSo/Xh9nowvpAcI/AAAAAAABPwc/3AdxvOBw47I0tozmF_VD-C4JYSei9L4dACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_15.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />The rail is able to support up to 225 pounds, and our door came in under that so we could scratch that worry off of the list, and the stoppers on each end are completely adjustable.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-F_Spz8NuYSo/Xh-AlLUF-QI/AAAAAAABPws/JELln4Ix8ToRky1ObHJSmFaJezJ23tMQACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_18.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"450\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-F_Spz8NuYSo/Xh-AlLUF-QI/AAAAAAABPws/JELln4Ix8ToRky1ObHJSmFaJezJ23tMQACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_18.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Although the door still cleared the trim without a ledger board, we ended up having to inset the bottom bolt of the door hanging hardware into the back of the door to prevent it from rubbing against the white closet door casing.\n<br />\n<br />I found \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2Ru7AUz\" target=\"_blank\">the handle hardware on Amazon here</a>.&nbsp;I like that it is substantial and coordinates with all of the other matte black hardware throughout his room.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-m5hFrsDtIBQ/Xh-GmZGWqEI/AAAAAAABPzQ/SuqEOGX0I_8j9V1huhSi3Kj4LIDgIu81gCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-m5hFrsDtIBQ/Xh-GmZGWqEI/AAAAAAABPzQ/SuqEOGX0I_8j9V1huhSi3Kj4LIDgIu81gCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_3.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I put together a little motion shot of the new door opening and closing because we are just so excited to finally have this project checked off of our list!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4EYoZWunuPE/Xh-GsFfysLI/AAAAAAABPy0/4LSuwuskh-wR4EXuUPsMu_Rdqq6KzWVJgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_DIY_Sliding_Closet_Door.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4EYoZWunuPE/Xh-GsFfysLI/AAAAAAABPy0/4LSuwuskh-wR4EXuUPsMu_Rdqq6KzWVJgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_DIY_Sliding_Closet_Door.gif\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />As far as the organization goes, you can see that it is maintaining nicely! The only change is that all of his clothes have basically doubled in size. Oh! And we actually swapped the bottom shoe tray with a drawer we took out of our pantry cabinet (hoping to share more about that soon). We like that the drawer hides the shoes (yet they can still breathe), and that it can serve a different purpose all together down the road. You can read every last detail \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/06/an-organized-teen-boy-closet.html\" target=\"_blank\">about his closet organization here</a>.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uLjaHS49T9Y/Xh-f47cKB-I/AAAAAAABPzY/noY_umxODbkzPv3lRs0EsvnHntrG8TPzACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_14.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"800\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uLjaHS49T9Y/Xh-f47cKB-I/AAAAAAABPzY/noY_umxODbkzPv3lRs0EsvnHntrG8TPzACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_14.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Here is a shot of the door closed. It does leave a blank space to the left and I haven't decided if I want to do anything there yet (we could add something up to the thickness of the door trim without any issues, but are OK just leaving it for now). The color of the door works really great with everything else he has going on, and although the door is quite large, we all love the addition and interest it has added to the room.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_6a3EfCso7g/Xh-f4w-nHMI/AAAAAAABPzk/Flo2j_4JT-AwJyffhei-yns68a-byRQtACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_13.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"800\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_6a3EfCso7g/Xh-f4w-nHMI/AAAAAAABPzk/Flo2j_4JT-AwJyffhei-yns68a-byRQtACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sliding_Barn_Door_DIY_Teen_Closet_13.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing DIY Sliding Barn Door Teen Closet\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I have one more big project I want to take on in this room (a DIY headboard), and then it will be FINISHED. Oh, what a feeling!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rbBhAQJaFEg/Xh-kJRHlDBI/AAAAAAABPzs/aruDO6sTxGsQw0SqHoed4dtlvxUBDVuaQCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Post_Sources.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"62\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rbBhAQJaFEg/Xh-kJRHlDBI/AAAAAAABPzs/aruDO6sTxGsQw0SqHoed4dtlvxUBDVuaQCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Post_Sources.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" /></a>\n</div>\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3881450\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(w,i,d,g,e,t){d.getElementById(i)||(element=d.createElement(t),element.id=i,element.src=\"https://widgets.rewardstyle.com\"+e,d.body.appendChild(element)),w.hasOwnProperty(g)===!0&amp;&amp;\"complete\"===d.readyState&amp;&amp;w[g].init()}(window,\"shopthepost-script\",document,\"__stp\",\"/js/shopthepost.js\",\"script\")</script>\n  <br />\n  <div class=\"rs-adblock\">\n   <img onerror=\"this.parentNode.innerHTML=&quot;Disable your ad blocking software to view this content.&quot;\" src=\"https://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/af909fecff7696adfea54324d1dfcebb63744f31/images/search/350.gif\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" />\n   <noscript>\n    JavaScript is currently disabled in this browser. 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Happy New Year: Free Goal Setting Printable!","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2020/01/happy-new-year-free-goal-setting.html","description":"Happy New Year everyone! I sincerely hope that your holidays were full of warmth and love and happiness!\n<br />\n<br />A new year means different things to different people, and although all of the highs and lows of years prior don't just disappear when the clock strikes midnight, January 1st does seem to signify a fresh start. I am here to say \"cheers\" to that!\n<br />\n<br />Some years I set goals, and some I don't. There are times I worry about setting resolutions because of the fear of failure, or because I figure that they will all be forgotten by February. I also tend to over-analyze everything and can take goal setting too far. If goals become overly complicated, or out of touch, then I find I am less likely to feel motivated and encouraged. What I have found to work best for me is to:\n<br />\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Select 2-5 large scale goals for three areas of my life: Personal, Business, and Health. This is for the entire year!&nbsp;</li>\n <li>Use those goals to set smaller, bite-sized targets each week that ultimately correlate with my overall vision.</li>\n</ul>\n<br />\n<br />All of that said, I really want to give goal setting a real shot this year! Without specific goals, it can be easy to end up on a hamster wheel or to feel lost at sea. Using the method I find works best, I set out to create some printables to help organize my ideas. I am heading into this process with a mindset of \n<i>why</i> these goals are important to ME! It can be easy to select goals to fit a specific mold, or generic resolutions that have been set by society, but doing so doesn't ultimately aid in personal growth. I am also keeping in mind that I am not trying to give myself a total makeover, or change who I am at my core. The entire point of goal setting is to look at opportunities for improvement and to drive myself to succeed.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vqsRfOy0Rxc/XhTeM-7gFjI/AAAAAAABPpc/BgZnaV_lHq4VoHi-OiHkkvpr9e0YJTs0ACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Goal_Setting_Free_Printable_2020_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"434\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vqsRfOy0Rxc/XhTeM-7gFjI/AAAAAAABPpc/BgZnaV_lHq4VoHi-OiHkkvpr9e0YJTs0ACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Goal_Setting_Free_Printable_2020_2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />So while \"getting more organized\" and \"go to the gym\" and \"budget\" are all completely fine resolutions, I am going to challenge myself to think outside of the box, get specific about exactly what goals I am selecting (and why), and jotting down simple action plans to help me get there.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />The printables I designed are intended to get us thinking and to put a pen to paper. The best part is that I left these pages free of timelines and dates, so they can be printed and reused or updated at any time of the year. I plan to clip mine to the front of \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/35st88V\" target=\"_blank\">my new planner pages</a>&nbsp;so that I can check in on them as I do my weekly scheduling/planning/to-do lists.\n<br />\n<br />\n<i>To download, click the link below the image to be directed to the PDF file. There is no need to sign up/sign-in, you should see a 'Download' button at the top of the screen to access the files for free.</i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n <tbody>\n  <tr>\n   <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rUBKfzYBTug/XhTwCCgkhCI/AAAAAAABPqo/PEIrxUJcpMg09ir2d88bZdD38hVOlVFPACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Goal_Setting_Images_Navy_Business.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n <tbody>\n  <tr>\n   <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fJ1rp0o939w/XhTwCNXHmiI/AAAAAAABPqs/w8MSM45UUOkrffAjvPtFFKbfiyeQE1hWQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Goal_Setting_Images_Navy_Education.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; My boys tested them out and were able to use them with ease, and enjoyed sharing some of their responses with all of us during dinner the other night.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\">__________</span>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />Although I didn't post nearly as much as I would have liked/hoped this past year, I had some really wonderful opportunities that gave me fresh perspective, confidence, and excitement for what I do. I am so excited to see what is in store for 2020 and I am endlessly grateful for all of you that have stuck around through this crazy roller coaster of life.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jw85kxkoBIw/XhT6cwd_ytI/AAAAAAABPq8/MKPQesxQJnMmiTiI7VBVJy7udkOcxTOogCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/08_iHeart_Organizing_Sorting_Boxes_Printable_Signs.1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"479\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jw85kxkoBIw/XhT6cwd_ytI/AAAAAAABPq8/MKPQesxQJnMmiTiI7VBVJy7udkOcxTOogCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/08_iHeart_Organizing_Sorting_Boxes_Printable_Signs.1.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />If organizing is a goal on your list this year, but you don't know where to begin, you can get a head start by collecting one item per day to discard from your home. Set up a box for donations that you can easily access and try to fill it by the end of the month. Less is always more when it comes to organization, and the small act letting things go is the best way to get started.\n<br />\n<br />I also encourage you to take on organization in bite-sized projects. Focus on one small space at a time, and select areas that you utilize and touch the most frequently first. Organizing is always a process and you can't organize your life overnight. I have a few areas around our home that could use some zhushing, and I hope to share those this month as I tackle them. My personal organizational goal for January is to organize one thing that I have been putting off, and I have a few of those projects to pick from!\n<br />\n<br />Last year I put together a super-sized series of posts with all of my favorite tips, tricks, and products. I am going to link them below as a quick refresher:\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<center>\n <table style=\"width: 600px;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr> \n    <td width=\"295\"><a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/04/the-best-of-best-my-top-organizing-tips.html\"><img src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/Sidebar/295/Organization_Sidebar_zpsjwoj2sba.png\" /></a></td> \n    <td width=\"295\"><a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/07/the-best-of-best-practical-everyday.html\"><img src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/Sidebar/295/Storage_Sidebar_zps51tp6jvl.png\" /></a></td> \n   </tr>\n   <tr> \n    <td width=\"295\"><a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/05/labeling-101-quick-easy-labeling.html\"><img src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/Sidebar/295/Labeling_Sidebar_zpsle1nb6eq.png\" /></a></td> \n    <td width=\"295\"><a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/04/gearing-up-for-your-next-organizing.html\"><img src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/Sidebar/295/Printables_Sidebar_zpsiq9trvny.png\" /></a></td> \n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n</center>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />2020 here we come! Drawer","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/08/before-after-organized-nightstand-drawer.html","description":"We all have that one drawer. The one that becomes a dumping ground with an endless pit of random items. It happens to the best of us!\n<br />\n<br />Most of the drawers around our home are set up in a way that they self maintain, but there are a couple that demand attention more often; our junk drawer in our kitchen, and apparently, my nightstand drawer both top that list.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2cxR6DAX9sI/XUsETU8TPlI/AAAAAAABOhA/Dd-B7CRNfcYz1NIahzuxi93cgHmHK2GJACLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Bedroom_Cleaning_Tips_Nightstand_3.2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2cxR6DAX9sI/XUsETU8TPlI/AAAAAAABOhA/Dd-B7CRNfcYz1NIahzuxi93cgHmHK2GJACLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Bedroom_Cleaning_Tips_Nightstand_3.2.jpg\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />I clean out the junk drawer every month or so, because even with dividers, random items that don't have an instant home, end up in that very popular drawer. Being in such a high traffic area that we all utilize, I am pretty good about tackling it frequently to keep some semblance of order.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ruR0jGIlNM0/XUsE9yfTRRI/AAAAAAABOiw/VP04F-NHyqYJg-PfDtx7DZmH60Wc-mltACLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Junk_Drawer_Organizers_Kitchen.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"862\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ruR0jGIlNM0/XUsE9yfTRRI/AAAAAAABOiw/VP04F-NHyqYJg-PfDtx7DZmH60Wc-mltACLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Junk_Drawer_Organizers_Kitchen.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />But my nightstand... that's another story. I generally only see it late at night or during a quick surface cleaning session. It was time to finally do something about it.\n<br />\n<br />Sometimes these projects are brought on last minute when I just can't take it anymore. I generally just tackle them and never think to blog about the before and after. It's just a drawer after all. But dang. Anytime I see an organized drawer, or a before and after, I am 10000% more motivated to tackle one myself. So this time I grabbed my iPhone and took a quick picture of the before and decided that I would share the process. I am encouraging all of you to do the same! It doesn't have to be a nightstand drawer, it can be ANY drawer! Just one. Let's do it!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CANYyXMrrUk/XUsKppQvRFI/AAAAAAABOi8/FcidqY2Py5MVPB8NGl0tF9O1BWzoBQDUACLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Before_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"767\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CANYyXMrrUk/XUsKppQvRFI/AAAAAAABOi8/FcidqY2Py5MVPB8NGl0tF9O1BWzoBQDUACLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Before_3.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />Wow, really Jen?\n<br />\n<br />Let's see, there were candles, linen sprays, essential oils, cold and sinus medications, drawer hardware, jewelry, prescriptions and supplements, hair accessories, lotions, cough drops... the kitchen sink is about the only thing missing from this drawer. Remember, this is a no judging zone.\n<br />\n<br />Clearly, I would use something and then just toss it inside.\n<br />\n<br />First step was to sort it all out. I found two random bins/baskets and used one for \"Keep\" and another for \"Relocate\". The keep items would stay in the drawer and the rest would go back where it truly belonged.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-l1FyY4Jp8Eo/XUsEaq2VORI/AAAAAAABOio/Te7YYEfuHeIUhhmBUlSzcu44xSc8851mgCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Sorting.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-l1FyY4Jp8Eo/XUsEaq2VORI/AAAAAAABOio/Te7YYEfuHeIUhhmBUlSzcu44xSc8851mgCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Sorting.2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Ha! Look at the difference!\n<br />\n<br />I also gave my nightstand a good cleaning and thought to myself that the old, velvet-esque drawer liner was dark and dirty.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-mcuAwEJfvZM/XUsEZE1xJEI/AAAAAAABOis/Pj_AvFCz8m48Jv1KKVB42U5Zey6afAGtQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Empty_1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-mcuAwEJfvZM/XUsEZE1xJEI/AAAAAAABOis/Pj_AvFCz8m48Jv1KKVB42U5Zey6afAGtQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Empty_1.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I had a couple of foam core boards so I cut them to the shape of the drawer and wrapped them in a scrap of light blue linen fabric. I did this for both of my drawers.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-c9UjuhosRgM/XUsSaqeJU_I/AAAAAAABOjU/OHs0p2DZV2M9SHfPE8-KjqD7SZ7oulErwCLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Empty_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-c9UjuhosRgM/XUsSaqeJU_I/AAAAAAABOjU/OHs0p2DZV2M9SHfPE8-KjqD7SZ7oulErwCLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Empty_2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />This was an added step, but I felt like it would just freshen up these old and dated nightstands without much effort for now. And I really believe these small changes make a big difference in the end result.\n<br />\n<br />I dug through my stash of organizers and pulled some dividers and a random bowl that I thought would better fit the drawer and help me maintain things better going forward.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3hH0-YG45Eo/XVGwd37eiRI/AAAAAAABOkM/aggYnl5tMWwFGQEql5-kP9tiP-jRklqIQCLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Empty_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3hH0-YG45Eo/XVGwd37eiRI/AAAAAAABOkM/aggYnl5tMWwFGQEql5-kP9tiP-jRklqIQCLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Empty_3.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The bottom drawer just holds a massage pillow, oil diffuser, and my daily journal.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ib9CVB50ziQ/XUsETqv6qyI/AAAAAAABOio/tRp3QlQTz5kCAQKNnYXXNqN8Ta1pOqHeQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_10.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ib9CVB50ziQ/XUsETqv6qyI/AAAAAAABOio/tRp3QlQTz5kCAQKNnYXXNqN8Ta1pOqHeQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_10.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />And here is the after of the top drawer:\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gcTH04_YR_4/XUsETRueKMI/AAAAAAABOio/mR7SJyz60yUP1kcWr2_uqmHOXpZIlZK0QCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gcTH04_YR_4/XUsETRueKMI/AAAAAAABOio/mR7SJyz60yUP1kcWr2_uqmHOXpZIlZK0QCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_1.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The back organizer corrals all of my morning/nightly meds and supplements. The bowl holds my sleeping mask and silk hair scrunchie.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lm5Hot9vzok/XUsEU1SYXRI/AAAAAAABOio/rwYaAdl6JrYjGoQzwW4eOvhVejv-eqnmQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lm5Hot9vzok/XUsEU1SYXRI/AAAAAAABOio/rwYaAdl6JrYjGoQzwW4eOvhVejv-eqnmQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_4.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The larger organizer holds the remote, a single sleep spray, my glasses, and hand lotion.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nCBi7QV9rHE/XUsEYlm8pNI/AAAAAAABOig/4GqyqE5znQomCsW6pU7vMLCyu2YDsJNRACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Before_After.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"450\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nCBi7QV9rHE/XUsEYlm8pNI/AAAAAAABOig/4GqyqE5znQomCsW6pU7vMLCyu2YDsJNRACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_Before_After.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Also matches, essential oils, lip treatment, earplugs, my grinding guard, and daily jewelry items.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VYiEoZs74z8/XUsEUiQHCYI/AAAAAAABOik/JkYlX9CGjhwAq7AJ9Q1Vl6sWmWeOYyT5wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VYiEoZs74z8/XUsEUiQHCYI/AAAAAAABOik/JkYlX9CGjhwAq7AJ9Q1Vl6sWmWeOYyT5wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Nightstand_Organization_After_3.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />It's like an entirely different drawer and only took me about 20 minutes to take a couple of really easy, anyone-can-do steps.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-miZHufrNAbY/XUsPFqAzdZI/AAAAAAABOjI/LD3GK0fIeaEheJxj9pZcUguKmTwscu3LACLcBGAs/s1600/Organized_Nightstand_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"389\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-miZHufrNAbY/XUsPFqAzdZI/AAAAAAABOjI/LD3GK0fIeaEheJxj9pZcUguKmTwscu3LACLcBGAs/s1600/Organized_Nightstand_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Now that I shared that, I dare you to take on a drawer too! Start small and simple! That's what it is all about. And this one little change really does make me happier at the end of the day. I have also become much more mindful of what I am tossing back into the drawer.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />Yay or nay to more of these types of posts? I think we should share these types of transformations over on the \n<b>#ihearttransformations</b> hashtag on Instagram. It will be fun to take this small challenge to that community and see some before and afters from all of you! Ready. Set. 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Items IHeart: Favorite Amazon Finds!","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/07/items-iheart-favorite-amazon-finds.html","description":"It is safe to say that July is our busiest month of the year. Our middle P turned 14 last week, we celebrated our 17th wedding anniversary this past Sunday, and our oldest turns 17 next week! Toss in baseball tournaments, graduation parties, summer activities, birthdays for parents and friends...We are lovin' all of the summer fun! And to top it all off, Amazon had to go ahead and toss in their biggest sale of the year; \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2zHY5Lu\" target=\"_blank\">PRIME DAY</a>! I am guessing many of you marked it on your calendar as a celebratory holiday too! \n<i>*wink wink</i>\n<br />\n<br />I originally considered sharing my favorite Prime Day deals like I did last year, but then when the sale is over, the post is only partially relevant. Instead, it inspired me to finally get a post out that I have had on my list for a very long time.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TCWWIZEKsiI/W02kU8tdHLI/AAAAAAABM50/6LkUhZWysRscsOQyKVZaoujoYvfgCxWFQCLcBGAs/s1600/amazon.favorites.header.550px.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"550\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TCWWIZEKsiI/W02kU8tdHLI/AAAAAAABM50/6LkUhZWysRscsOQyKVZaoujoYvfgCxWFQCLcBGAs/s1600/amazon.favorites.header.550px.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2Jrg5JT\" target=\"_blank\">Amazon</a>.\n<br />\n<br />I am pretty sure they are taking over the world.\n<br />\n<br />I want to start out by saying that I prefer to shop on Etsy and with small businesses as often as I can, especially when looking for unique and special gifts, home goods, textiles and even clothing. But did you know that a lot of small businesses are also turning to Amazon to launch and sell their&nbsp;product? Love that! And because we are a busy crew, my Amazon app is always running so that we can use the benefits of our Prime membership to the fullest. Free shipping on everyday items&nbsp;saves me so much time on running errands, which I truly appreciate. Not only that, the product selection on Amazon is generally pretty extensive, and their prices are also generally pretty competitive.\n<br />\n<br />I dislike that this sounds salesy and like an #ad, even though it is not, but the matter of the fact is that I source 60-70% of my cleaning and organizing products from Amazon for both myself and the clients that I work with. And I have always thought that I should create a space on my blog specifically for my favorite Amazon products because of how universally&nbsp;accessible&nbsp;Amazon is compared to many alternative retailers. So hopefully this list is not only a great resource for myself and my clients, but for you all as well!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n
