eartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Laundry/15_zps5gqyfu9f.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn70@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-48-680_a6626dbf60f75467.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Laundry/16_zpsgxgkmeuj.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn90@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-46-433_49c3849f4c3314f9.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Laundry/17_zpslmnufeg5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn5@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-46-588_a3512488ae8c6233.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Laundry/18_zpshn1kriwl.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn14@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-50-754_aa15f5ffa0d36ce4.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Laundry/19_zpszqeli2dm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn82@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-36-867_c9ab8fffa605f758.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Laundry/20_zpsmmspjvw7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn58@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-41-556_d861f313df55dbcc.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Laundry/21_zpsoopzmfy7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn65@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-41-729_5619c89f2a57fe14.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Headers/Cleaning_Header_1_zpsygntncuh.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn86@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-49-194_9e0a1481ef079cbb.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/01_zpstrg4mtaq.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn70@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-36-649_6461318e9a8b0812.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/02_zps4quttfuv.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn30@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-35-384_90a5e74b4cb33ca2.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/03_zpsugqghndn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-37-061_45cd22586c5eaafe.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/04_zpss9itupst.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn73@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-49-643_d6d2158243c6fd25.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/05_zpsufllsur3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn94@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-50-708_9c69b2ad77f6752c.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/06_zpsmfdiypjv.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn10@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-42-276_c5013c5977933942.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/07_zpsjqpun4x2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn29@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-43-988_d729bdfce36b8913.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/08_zpsxcyrhvv6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn94@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-34-507_8e6745eefa41a6f6.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/09_zpsvuffayww.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn90@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-49-969_3b4c50e668346673.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/10_zps79fhuzdu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn42@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-32-445_0d22369ffa021566.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/11_zpsbuyibqe0.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn46@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-43-402_5cda37ce3adab43a.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/12_zpsvnhi6bke.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-36-122_ae4f12d24362bce5.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/13_zps7wgda6tj.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn93@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-46-409_c5dc20a1a9c0f763.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/14_zpsgovoj7vr.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn93@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-32-506_8d5e560eed1ebcf7.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/15_zps9qwojlst.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn18@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-45-911_afb24d0d4b221ebd.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/16_zpsedt5eim3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn37@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-31-368_39ca74f73e31f9c9.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/17_zpsqxgjgkrr.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn85@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-35-082_c3742379a9448cee.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/18_zpshkrdnuub.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn50@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-50-500_977b0f47cba46191.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/19_zpswzirrzeg.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn29@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-48-978_3544e7c982ae34a0.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/20_zpsqsxddtgb.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn85@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-38-569_ec0993dd34ac8f08.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Amazon%20Prime/Cleaning/21_zpshxujyayr.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn82@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-32-921_bddeba7da0ac0ced.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228323},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Before & After: From Tired Cabinet to Bathroom Storage","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2020/03/before-after-from-tired-cabinet-to.html","description":"Our bathroom vanity is only 30\" wide so we have always had to get a little creative with our storage situation. Up until recently, we had been utilizing a tall bathroom cabinet to house many of our daily toiletries. Over the years, that cabinet began to slowly fall apart. First, the bottom drawer front fell off so I just put a tall basket in its place. More recently, all of the drawer fronts had completely fallen off, the sliding drawer hardware had snapped, and the cabinet wasn't even hanging on by a thread. It was time to snip that thread, cut our losses, and look for an alternative solution.\n<br />\n<br />(\n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2015/06/four-week-wait-no-more-organizing_26.html\" target=\"_blank\">You can see my previous post on our bathroom organization here.</a>)\n<br />\n<br />The bathroom itself hasn't been updated in about 15 years now and is something we would like to tackle within the next year or two. Once we were sans cabinet, I needed something ASAP to keep our limited counter space free of my clutter and to make up for the loss of three drawers and three shelves. You know where I am going with this right? I really didn't want to invest a lot of money into something knowing that we aren't too far away from making more permanent changes to the bathroom.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MuzOkHVJnQk/XmvVW-9N0MI/AAAAAAABP8g/reIOnMsVImkl87ukWwTtnMnOVHKr41zxgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_12.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MuzOkHVJnQk/XmvVW-9N0MI/AAAAAAABP8g/reIOnMsVImkl87ukWwTtnMnOVHKr41zxgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_12.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />With that in mind, I went straight to Facebook Marketplace to look for an inexpensive solution. I was looking for a piece of furniture that wasn't too deep (I didn't want it to be obtrusive in our modest-sized bathroom) and something with doors. With the germs that fly in the bathroom, I always prefer storage behind drawers and doors. Doors also cut down on the amount of surface that I have to clean and wipe down frequently. I initially thought a lawyer style bookcase would be a bit different, but with our bathroom being on the smaller side, I ultimately decided it would be nice to do something with more glass. So I started to search for curio style cabinets that were less than 14\" deep.\n<br />\n<br />I figured that it would be a quick find, but it took some weeks of checking in and trying a variety of search terms. I finally stumbled upon something within my low budget, but it would require some modifying to make it juuuuuuust right.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jUwL_s7axMc/XmX4lEo7KYI/AAAAAAABP4c/ov1RWqSF_AIxKQuYQgd74ONZDdSo4n6YgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1153\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jUwL_s7axMc/XmX4lEo7KYI/AAAAAAABP4c/ov1RWqSF_AIxKQuYQgd74ONZDdSo4n6YgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_1.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The picture above is from the original listing, and my husband raised his eyebrows when I told him I wanted to take a drive to pick up this piece of furniture for our bathroom. Although the wood wasn't in great shape, the price was low and I saw a diamond in the rough.\n<br />\n<br />What I was instantly drawn to was the top half of the cabinet. The glass portion was the perfect size and I also appreciated the decorative moulding for a more traditional look. The bottom of the cabinet wasn't at all my style and felt too bulky, but my hope was that we could construct something a bit more streamlined. As soon as we got the cabinet back into our home, we began to slowly deconstruct it to separate the top piece from the bottom.\n<br />\n<br />We built the new base from hardwood 1\" x 2\" poplar boards.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--CBd6hliHVo/XmX4poTfLmI/AAAAAAABP5A/ufHtL9bhD00y61T4GDCp-J0f-V82plemwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"767\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--CBd6hliHVo/XmX4poTfLmI/AAAAAAABP5A/ufHtL9bhD00y61T4GDCp-J0f-V82plemwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Our \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2v6IML5\" rel=\"nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">Kreg Jig</a> was our best friend for this project, as it allowed us to create a series of concealed pocket holes to assemble a clean looking finished product.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uS0PSiALrg0/XmX4p0Itb8I/AAAAAAABP5s/DR4pe-aMOE83qBTkEj4ox5kX-PAV3G0VACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"767\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uS0PSiALrg0/XmX4p0Itb8I/AAAAAAABP5s/DR4pe-aMOE83qBTkEj4ox5kX-PAV3G0VACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_3.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The base of the cabinet was going to be about 12\" deep by 24\" wide. We did two tiers of support so we would be able to add a shelf at the bottom as well. The legs were constructed of 2\" x 2\" boards.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lIj093PpdPk/XmX4qg0qekI/AAAAAAABP5s/0GtsavSWMuE2MyYAit1NtvesBgmG7QlEACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"734\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lIj093PpdPk/XmX4qg0qekI/AAAAAAABP5s/0GtsavSWMuE2MyYAit1NtvesBgmG7QlEACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_4.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />We screwed the 1\" x 2\" side pieces into the 2\" x 2\" legs (twice). Then we attached the back and front 1\" x 2\" pieces.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3MqC9ABBDus/XmX4qiYY5lI/AAAAAAABP5w/I8A9UaXJKaQ3c4A4c3yju7YisntQUKllQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_5.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"498\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3MqC9ABBDus/XmX4qiYY5lI/AAAAAAABP5w/I8A9UaXJKaQ3c4A4c3yju7YisntQUKllQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_5.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Almost there!\n<br />\n<br />We cut a 1/2\" piece of birch plywood to create the bottom shelf.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CPwOGeYHzyU/XmwoCMMMhVI/AAAAAAABP-Y/5ho5AHsiBdko5EAHeoVQX09jBbOsthsJgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_7.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1356\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CPwOGeYHzyU/XmwoCMMMhVI/AAAAAAABP-Y/5ho5AHsiBdko5EAHeoVQX09jBbOsthsJgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_7.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I always freak out a little during the middle. I was worried the clean and simple bottom wasn't going to tie into the more traditional top. But before I made any final judgment, I decided to prime and paint the entire piece a solid color.\n<br />\n<br />Prior to painting, I did a few things to prep the cabinet. We used our brad nailer to affix the shelf to the base. Then I caulked all of the cracks around the legs. I used a sanding block to sand everything down. After that, I took \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2VWXFKI\" target=\"_blank\">a liquid deglosser</a> to the top half of the cabinet because the wood had a chipping top coat and I wanted to be sure I wasn't going to have any trouble with paint adhering. Not done yet, I used some wood filler to fix any cracks, dents, holes, scratches, etc... Finally, I taped all of the glass off with painter's tape and found my oil-based primer.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b_J5_z28-3A/XmX4sHFKrLI/AAAAAAABP6A/SS1z3QxGKS8FAWLKmSfCNwa9DWPPXkkgACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"839\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b_J5_z28-3A/XmX4sHFKrLI/AAAAAAABP6A/SS1z3QxGKS8FAWLKmSfCNwa9DWPPXkkgACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_8.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Once the primer was dry, I sanded everything again and did two coats of \n<a href=\"https://www.benjaminmoore.com/en-us/color-overview/find-your-color/color/1624/westcott-navy?color=1624\" target=\"_blank\">Benjamin Moore's Westcott Navy</a>.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rnRJ6Z1YoyY/Xm2jtQbbEkI/AAAAAAABP-k/5PHL1WskI0sw8pb_sgK2I71W2LI9QwgLwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_10.3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"871\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rnRJ6Z1YoyY/Xm2jtQbbEkI/AAAAAAABP-k/5PHL1WskI0sw8pb_sgK2I71W2LI9QwgLwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_10.3.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Once painted, the cabinet turned out really lovely. The entire project came in under $75 for the cabinet, wood supplies, and paint. Considering I had been pricing out new options for between $250 - $1200, I am \n<i>very</i> happy with how this turned out.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6d59D4zxufY/XmvVYkQC_bI/AAAAAAABP9s/TVJHH4CUNT0FqBSF_DZQX645kBuDk8sHwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_16.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6d59D4zxufY/XmvVYkQC_bI/AAAAAAABP9s/TVJHH4CUNT0FqBSF_DZQX645kBuDk8sHwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_16.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I use the cabinet to hold everything I reach for on a daily basis. The top shelf holds \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2QeYVFr\" target=\"_blank\">a divided basket</a> with face cloths, washcloths, and an extra roll of toilet paper.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OrBMpkhLYvo/XmvValn9ufI/AAAAAAABP-E/oN8F7Gupjx8RZRdQtMwPslB_vKJ79bB5wCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_20.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OrBMpkhLYvo/XmvValn9ufI/AAAAAAABP-E/oN8F7Gupjx8RZRdQtMwPslB_vKJ79bB5wCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_20.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2TNgEG6\" target=\"_blank\">An acrylic tray</a> corrals all of my lotions and facial creams.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OWvhTAIyPbo/XmvVYX9kAUI/AAAAAAABP94/0ccIrNzU-pcdG54ERaD7EGQ-E1KtT52kACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_14.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OWvhTAIyPbo/XmvVYX9kAUI/AAAAAAABP94/0ccIrNzU-pcdG54ERaD7EGQ-E1KtT52kACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_14.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />While \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2w8tk1t\" target=\"_blank\">a small handled basket</a> works great to hide my makeup clutter. I also use a basic drinking glass to hold some facial cotton pads and \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/39Q6Rou\" target=\"_blank\">a clear apothecary jar</a> for cotton swabs.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KPRwl2_OUtU/XmvVbkkTEZI/AAAAAAABP90/6fv1dKRRAtIcjBZMDxDPXUJnk_w7OuvVQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_22.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KPRwl2_OUtU/XmvVbkkTEZI/AAAAAAABP90/6fv1dKRRAtIcjBZMDxDPXUJnk_w7OuvVQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_22.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The bottom shelf holds a couple extra clean towels, bath salts, and a spa brush.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gcN_NwypFp4/XmvVZjindsI/AAAAAAABP-E/vC3honqVS0oBDa334ZtPuPGmjFEbbZejACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_18.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gcN_NwypFp4/XmvVZjindsI/AAAAAAABP-E/vC3honqVS0oBDa334ZtPuPGmjFEbbZejACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_18.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Because we added a small shelf below, I was able to fit two tall baskets to conceal the less sightly toiletry clutter such as small grooming tools and a manicure kit.\n<br />\n<br />Let's take a look at a side-by-side before and after to show what a little out of the box thinking can yield.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Px3it_F53xA/XmvVeCe1gsI/AAAAAAABP-E/yoC0SM3DQRM2HD7K3xCzM-Rjkl6CvVmDACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"522\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Px3it_F53xA/XmvVeCe1gsI/AAAAAAABP-E/yoC0SM3DQRM2HD7K3xCzM-Rjkl6CvVmDACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The original base was salvageable enough to donate so hopefully someone else can put that piece to good use also.\n<br />\n<br />Don't you love a good \"one man's trash is another man's treasure\" story? The overall depth of the cabinet is only 12\" so I was able to add quite a bit of storage with a tiny footprint. And it's so pretty I hope it sticks around even after we get to updating our bathroom someday.\n<br />\n<br />I would love to see/hear about your Facebook Marketplace finds too! Or how you are getting creative with storage around your home! Share the details in the comments below or tag me on Instagram!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<i>P.S. I purchased this cabinet on Facebook Marketplace weeks prior to any news of COVID-19. I completely understand the sensitivity of the current situation and Facebook Marketplace may not be the best way to shop given current social distancing recommendations. I still wanted to share in case you have a piece of furniture that might need some new life, or if you are just looking for inexpensive and space-saving bathroom storage solutions. throom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_8.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn57@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-49-438_7a5e6d6487aad734.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rnRJ6Z1YoyY/Xm2jtQbbEkI/AAAAAAABP-k/5PHL1WskI0sw8pb_sgK2I71W2LI9QwgLwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_10.3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn97@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-48-600_e15f76feb9011b27.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6d59D4zxufY/XmvVYkQC_bI/AAAAAAABP9s/TVJHH4CUNT0FqBSF_DZQX645kBuDk8sHwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_16.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn98@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-44-466_6c50f123661823f8.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OrBMpkhLYvo/XmvValn9ufI/AAAAAAABP-E/oN8F7Gupjx8RZRdQtMwPslB_vKJ79bB5wCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_20.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn93@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-46-654_0f73b3cc3d4a0128.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OWvhTAIyPbo/XmvVYX9kAUI/AAAAAAABP94/0ccIrNzU-pcdG54ERaD7EGQ-E1KtT52kACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_14.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn93@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-36-930_62faec8a1c76ad9b.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KPRwl2_OUtU/XmvVbkkTEZI/AAAAAAABP90/6fv1dKRRAtIcjBZMDxDPXUJnk_w7OuvVQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_22.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn42@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-46-617_68a42effacf1b8cd.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gcN_NwypFp4/XmvVZjindsI/AAAAAAABP-E/vC3honqVS0oBDa334ZtPuPGmjFEbbZejACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_18.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn25@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-35-749_5452950ad2f58ddc.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Px3it_F53xA/XmvVeCe1gsI/AAAAAAABP-E/yoC0SM3DQRM2HD7K3xCzM-Rjkl6CvVmDACEwYBhgL/s1600/Bathroom_Cabinet_DIY_Hack_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn65@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-43-412_c1d5e0f91b354f13.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228318},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Doubling up on Under the Sink Storage Space","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/10/doubling-up-on-under-sink-storage-space.html","description":"A few weeks ago we were hosting a guest and I went to my son's bathroom to do some cleaning and prepping. Our guests typically stay in our son's bedroom while visiting because it has an adjoining bathroom that allows for added privacy. I realized that the area under his sink could use a better system, and with a limited timeframe, I came up with a quick solution to maximize the awkward cabinet.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BYZew_Kc6eo/XaPxTLuI6vI/AAAAAAABPJQ/AC5yuC4gHfwuOOsS-KgQ5NrAK5ElNcT4wCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_53.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BYZew_Kc6eo/XaPxTLuI6vI/AAAAAAABPJQ/AC5yuC4gHfwuOOsS-KgQ5NrAK5ElNcT4wCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_53.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I will help my kids with their chores from time to time, but for the most part, they take complete ownership of keeping up on their spaces. It is always my goal to give them systems that are easy for them to maintain on their own, but I definitely didn't do that here. Under this bathroom sink was a mish-mash of random baskets and bins with no designation or reasoning...\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lu1CQAsYLj4/XZyz2HY27iI/AAAAAAABO4g/DkHvo1EcTocP6nd855Co5RTHuXQg5_FMACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"450\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lu1CQAsYLj4/XZyz2HY27iI/AAAAAAABO4g/DkHvo1EcTocP6nd855Co5RTHuXQg5_FMACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_3.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />After I painted his bathroom walls awhile back, I left the can under his sink for touch-ups. There were also some accessories waiting to be used, toiletries, cleaning supplies, a random towel which he uses as a floor mat, travel items... All thrown in there somewhere. Yikes.\n<br />\n<br />The problem I find with most of these stock bathroom cabinets is the lack of storage that is provided. There is plenty of space inside but not an easy way to make the most of it. And with the sink and plumbing, it can be challenging to find the right stacking drawers or bins to take advantage of all the vertical space.\n<br />\n<br />This cabinet is nearing 20 years old and on our list of items to update in the future, but I still wanted to find a quick, inexpensive fix to get the bathroom storage up to par.\n<br />\n<br />The process I take with every organizing project no matter what the size/scale is as follows:\n<br />\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Empty everything out</li>\n <li>Clean the empty space</li>\n <li>Sort through all of the belongings</li>\n <li>Decide what we need in the space vs. what we currently have</li>\n <li>Put everything back&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n<br />So I emptied everything out and was left with some loud liner...\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ayh9Hq7y2mw/XZyz7Gb7HwI/AAAAAAABO4g/y7twNnoCF1Y16vFEBsWpYqRajiNRbKHuwCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"450\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ayh9Hq7y2mw/XZyz7Gb7HwI/AAAAAAABO4g/y7twNnoCF1Y16vFEBsWpYqRajiNRbKHuwCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_8.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I replaced it with something more subtle.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-8axBH-YbBaE/XZyzthWj-AI/AAAAAAABO4k/1ZHX3lpEd5AMI86ZPQh2Zi8uUNOyKYkCQCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_12.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-8axBH-YbBaE/XZyzthWj-AI/AAAAAAABO4k/1ZHX3lpEd5AMI86ZPQh2Zi8uUNOyKYkCQCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_12.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />My ultimate goal was to add a second layer of surface area halfway up the cabinet. Our local Home Depot sells white laminate boards, so we purchased \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/35oA5Ji\" target=\"_blank\">a single 3/4\" thick, 2' x 4' board</a>.\n<br />\n<br />The one board would be enough for us to cut down to use as a shelf and to also add supports for the shelf below (the bathroom cabinet is a 3' wide cabinet).\n<br />\n<br />Because the cabinet has a trim piece that runs down the front center of the door opening, the new shelf couldn't be left as a single piece that runs the entire inside length, it wouldn't be possible to get it into the cabinet. We decided to cut two separate shelves, one for each side, also notching out the plumbing area.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rqs6y4BRxC0/XZyzu2JGJXI/AAAAAAABO4k/TTteDB-QJugblMqGaG9pZ04tLsVGJkQ8gCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_15.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rqs6y4BRxC0/XZyzu2JGJXI/AAAAAAABO4k/TTteDB-QJugblMqGaG9pZ04tLsVGJkQ8gCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_15.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />For the notch, we measured the amount of space clearance needed for the plumbing and used the lid of a container to trace out the curved area. The nice thing about the laminate board is that pencil washes off quite easily after you make your cuts.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-DuuIpkqbp_8/XaP47TyJ0EI/AAAAAAABPJo/syAUfVAEs9wscpodnGXz_0c0bU2lCRc_ACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_17.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-DuuIpkqbp_8/XaP47TyJ0EI/AAAAAAABPJo/syAUfVAEs9wscpodnGXz_0c0bU2lCRc_ACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_17.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I originally thought we would just nail ledger boards around beneath the shelves, but because the front and far side have no support on the outside of the cabinet, Bryan decided to just make some legs to hold the shelves instead.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YwrHiPM5aZw/XZyzvYgDI4I/AAAAAAABO4Y/2mQBmUxW6SsM4Oi7Z2AU5nOTEwRs0UtLgCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_18.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"450\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YwrHiPM5aZw/XZyzvYgDI4I/AAAAAAABO4Y/2mQBmUxW6SsM4Oi7Z2AU5nOTEwRs0UtLgCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_18.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Above you can get an idea of how we dry fit things before finishing off the edges and air nailing everything in place.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bfyYNx3l4e8/XZyzv6JqSMI/AAAAAAABO4Y/ZheBZvjcWEINEHopvB3_JZo2ggF_nbbJwCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_19.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bfyYNx3l4e8/XZyzv6JqSMI/AAAAAAABO4Y/ZheBZvjcWEINEHopvB3_JZo2ggF_nbbJwCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_19.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />There is a small seam where the two boards meet in the middle, but we opted not to caulk it in case we want to easily remove the shelf down the road.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Yc3HjR-eCVI/XZ9jmq5YSfI/AAAAAAABO5A/cuwQoE_klk4T7NZC0Bny6KmrhzYBErFtwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_20.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Yc3HjR-eCVI/XZ9jmq5YSfI/AAAAAAABO5A/cuwQoE_klk4T7NZC0Bny6KmrhzYBErFtwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_20.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Look at that! Double the storage area!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-X5APPK1zmtg/XaPx6kjEUjI/AAAAAAABPJg/QOL51H9WliIQ1NqTneruapcopBwwhw0tACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_21.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-X5APPK1zmtg/XaPx6kjEUjI/AAAAAAABPJg/QOL51H9WliIQ1NqTneruapcopBwwhw0tACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_21.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />To now give my little guy (and guests) some easy organization, I categorized everything into their own pull out drawers and bins.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bwL4c4NpES4/XaPxKaGMTYI/AAAAAAABPJM/-vXqr4ZQP24RS4fsIg43AtHCsX5Muk6PgCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_37.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bwL4c4NpES4/XaPxKaGMTYI/AAAAAAABPJM/-vXqr4ZQP24RS4fsIg43AtHCsX5Muk6PgCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_37.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2IOY7mZ\" target=\"_blank\">These are my absolute favorite drawers for organizing under any sink</a> (bathroom, kitchen, laundry room, etc...), so I grabbed two standard sizes and one wide size.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Va3E_3hms84/XZ9jp6Q_gaI/AAAAAAABO5g/CQM2Y6FdH_0eY8Bel7JBUgNliFHDI8oLQCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_28.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Va3E_3hms84/XZ9jp6Q_gaI/AAAAAAABO5g/CQM2Y6FdH_0eY8Bel7JBUgNliFHDI8oLQCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_28.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I prefer to use drawers&nbsp;instead of stacking lidded bins any time I organize because they ease the taking out/putting things back process. That is especially important when kids are involved.\n<br />\n<br />The top two drawers hold my son's personal care items (toothbrush, toothpaste, floss, hair care, deodorant, etc...)\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jmiz45O1JKQ/XZ9joxhF-cI/AAAAAAABO5U/ugC6FBVTJZ0En8IbMuMhmvgmcION49bzQCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_27.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jmiz45O1JKQ/XZ9joxhF-cI/AAAAAAABO5U/ugC6FBVTJZ0En8IbMuMhmvgmcION49bzQCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_27.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />While the bottom drawer holds smaller sized toiletries for guests or travel, as well as bars of soap and an oil diffuser.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qpTu4ZFF4Ww/XaPxMbo3YyI/AAAAAAABPJY/oAIvs8v8C9Uw3F6TjO5awm0W4aT89Y_cACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_42.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qpTu4ZFF4Ww/XaPxMbo3YyI/AAAAAAABPJY/oAIvs8v8C9Uw3F6TjO5awm0W4aT89Y_cACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_42.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />On the other side, I used two taller bins to wrangle the bulkier items. One has additional personal care items and our son's travel toiletry case. The other has all of the cleaning supplies for the bathroom.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BbrJ5VhcTPE/XZ9jxM0PnQI/AAAAAAABO6s/E1jR_-J1HDA80ZIV9TJsyVJMX0jG3iBbwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_48.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BbrJ5VhcTPE/XZ9jxM0PnQI/AAAAAAABO6s/E1jR_-J1HDA80ZIV9TJsyVJMX0jG3iBbwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_48.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />I love that \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2AXcNfr\" target=\"_blank\">these inexpensive rolling bins</a> have flexible dividers inside that allows them to be easily categorized while also keeping the contents separate and contained.\n<br />\n<br />The upper shelf is the perfect spot for extra towels, and now they can be stored up and away from everything else in the cabinet.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-g1Ts9-kJA24/XaPxM1EurTI/AAAAAAABPJM/FcPW1usIqmgprXo9ZtrLQsFf_6LQSxNmwCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_43.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-g1Ts9-kJA24/XaPxM1EurTI/AAAAAAABPJM/FcPW1usIqmgprXo9ZtrLQsFf_6LQSxNmwCEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_43.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>I had the same question for my husband that you may have, \"Is this setup going to be an issue when we need to change out the faucet?\"\n<br />\n<br />Well, a couple of days after we installed the shelves we did just that without any problems. There was enough clearance surrounding the pipes that we didn't have to pull the shelves out, but we could have easily if necessary.\n<br />\n<br />With that, if we could have done one thing differently, we would have considered the location of the water valves a bit more vs. only measuring for the height of the bins when determining the final height for the new shelf.\n<br />\n<br />Because we all heart a transformation before and after, a reminder of the difference this quick makeover gave us:\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7pdDpb19v2M/XaPxT7X_VdI/AAAAAAABPJQ/AVi93ILjifYV5w0q7M7m3zm98eyPB8moACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"866\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7pdDpb19v2M/XaPxT7X_VdI/AAAAAAABPJQ/AVi93ILjifYV5w0q7M7m3zm98eyPB8moACEwYBhgL/s1600/DIY_Under_Cabinet_Shelving_Bathroom_Sink_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_1.png\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Under Bathroom Sink Double Shelving Storage Solution Organization\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The storage bins are definitely a key component in categorizing and helping to keep this area of our son's bathroom organized, but by adding a second layer of storage space we were able to really maximize how the cabinet is used. The bonus is that I have sourced a few under-the-sink-shelves in the past at various retailers, but they tend to be flimsy or not expansive enough. For less than what most of those ready-made shelves cost, we were able to come up with something out of a single board that is custom and substantial. Double the storage, double the organizational win!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4BPY-HLH1RU/XaP9embXYkI/AAAAAAABPKE/Ixekm7PmvL8gzudVgS1UvElHxgtRs5RxACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Post_Sources.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"59\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4BPY-HLH1RU/XaP9embXYkI/AAAAAAABPKE/Ixekm7PmvL8gzudVgS1UvElHxgtRs5RxACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Post_Sources.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3759793\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(w,i,d,g,e,t){if (!d.getElementById(i)) {element = d.createElement(t);element.id = i;element.src = 'https://widgets.rewardstyle.com' + e;d.body.appendChild(element);} if (typeof w[g] === 'object') { if (d.readyState === 'complete') { w[g].init(); }}}(window, 'shopthepost-script', document, '__stp', '/js/shopthepost.js', 'script');</script>\n  <br />\n  <div class=\"rs-adblock\">\n   <img onerror=\"this.parentNode.innerHTML='Disable your ad blocking software to view this content.'\" src=\"https://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/950b539a8744fa656ed1e3a42ebc6b270ff40ddf/images/search/350.gif\" style=\"height: 15px; width: 15px;\" />\n   <noscript>\n    JavaScript is currently disabled in this browser. 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"The Best of the Best: Practical, Everyday Storage Solutions!","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/07/the-best-of-best-practical-everyday.html","description":"I am back with the final post of a four-post series that I have put together with the best of the IHeart Organizing best. It's been a long time coming to take everything I have learned over the years, whether it is working in my own home or working with others, and compiling it all in a single place here on the web.\n<br />\n<br />The four-part&nbsp;series includes:\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>Gearing Up for Your Next Organizing Project with a FREE Printable Kit!</b>\n<br />\n<br />Need helping getting started or prioritizing where to begin? What is the plan of attack? What is currently working well and what isn't? What storage do you need? Trying to get rid of things, but finding it hard to decide what to keep and what to pass on?\n<br />\n<br />I have put together a great printable kit to help you prioritize, sort, and navigate your way through your next organizing project(s), which includes a total of TEN free printables!\n<br />\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/04/gearing-up-for-your-next-organizing.html\" target=\"_blank\">FIND THAT POST HERE!</a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>My Top Organizing Tips!</b>\n<br />\n<br />Instead of digging through years of my archives to find individual tips, I am going to compile the best of the best in a single, very informational post! It's going to be a whopper and a really great resource for projects of any size.\n<br />\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/04/the-best-of-best-my-top-organizing-tips.html\" target=\"_blank\">FIND THAT POST HERE!</a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>Labeling 101: Quick &amp; Easy Labeling Techniques</b>\n<br />\n<br />I have tried almost every type of label on the market, from vinyl to label makers to stickers and chalk markers, and they all have their place. But what are my tried and true favorites? What do I reach for with almost any project due to time, cost, practicality, and ease? I will be sharing three labeling techniques that haven't failed me yet, and that you won't need any fancy tools to utilize.\n<br />\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/05/labeling-101-quick-easy-labeling.html\" target=\"_blank\">FIND THAT POST HERE!</a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>Practical, Everyday Storage Solutions!</b>\n<br />\n<br />If I have learned anything from raising three boys and organizing along the way, it is that storage can be expensive and that our needs are constantly evolving. Gone are the days where I purchase pretty bins and baskets to decorate with. Although I will always appreciate beautiful storage,&nbsp;it has to be versatile&nbsp;\n<i>and</i>&nbsp;it has to last! With that in mind, there are a few storage products that I have found that continuously work hard for me in a variety of situations, so they end up being the types of products I gravitate toward when working on any new projects. For the final post in the series, I am putting together the ultimate storage source list with tips and products that I have fallen in love with over the years.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />So let's dive in with part four of the four-part&nbsp;series:&nbsp;\n<i>Practical, Everyday Storage Solutions!</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4-23tfNs40s/XTHYz7aLfRI/AAAAAAABOZ8/3YxGLdRzJGwHo1yU5ne3yB_XGAu8J7Q6gCLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Practical%252C%2BEverday%2BStorage%2BSolutions_Header.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"863\" data-original-width=\"575\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4-23tfNs40s/XTHYz7aLfRI/AAAAAAABOZ8/3YxGLdRzJGwHo1yU5ne3yB_XGAu8J7Q6gCLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Practical%252C%2BEverday%2BStorage%2BSolutions_Header.2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<i><br /></i>\n<br />\n<br />As you go through the motions of organizing areas of your home, storage should be the last piece of the organizing puzzle. Storage baskets and organizers aren't always necessary, but they really can be a key component in keeping a simple and tidy space. Here are just a few of the consistent benefits I have seen by utilizing baskets, bins, containers and drawer dividers over the years:\n<br />\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Containers assign items a proper home to return to.</li>\n <li>Containers prevent items from becoming jumbled and messy.</li>\n <li>Containers keep items divided into specific categories.</li>\n <li>Containers allow for easier portability/accessibility.</li>\n <li>Containers offer a place for your eye to rest and ultimately aid in finding items quicker (by eliminating visual clutter).</li>\n</ul>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n A few more container-specific tips I have picked up over the years:\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <ul>\n  <li>Wait until the very end of any organizing project to determine best container types/overall storage needs (after you sort and eliminate you may find you need less storage than you initially thought).</li>\n  <li>Always keep receipts/tags in and on your storage until you have taken it for a test run. If it isn't making your day-to-day life easier after a week or two, head back to the drawing board.</li>\n  <li>Storage is meant to aid and simplify, so if it is complicating things, ditch it.&nbsp;</li>\n  <li>Think long term. Don't select items that are a specific color, are trendy, or only going to be relevant for a specific season of life. Look into products that will stay versatile as your needs evolve. I have learned over the past 15 years the types of storage that have longevity and versatility and what ends up in the donate pile. My general rule is to select products that are neutral in finish/texture; clear, white, linen, and natural/woven materials always win.</li>\n  <li>Storage can be really expensive, but it doesn't have to be! I will never be above sourcing pretty storage solutions and finding a way to DIY or hack things on a budget. Cardboard boxes can be covered in fabric, dividers can be cut from wood, cereal and shoeboxes can be wrapped in paper, modular pieces can be combined to create dream closets... A little creativity goes a long way and sometimes custom solutions are the best way to maximize and get exactly what you need.</li>\n </ul>\n</div>\n<br />It would only be appropriate to start with my number one favorite storage item of all time:\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-reQ_oXJ7Oqw/XSjAvdP4fyI/AAAAAAABOP8/UYNOyv7NcQgHjgjJY1WUHQhO6hxmAsz2gCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"99\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-reQ_oXJ7Oqw/XSjAvdP4fyI/AAAAAAABOP8/UYNOyv7NcQgHjgjJY1WUHQhO6hxmAsz2gCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3660987\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? They come in a variety of widths for your varying needs, yet are extremely uniform. They are translucent so you can see the contents. They are lightweight. They are easy to clean. They have an open-top so everything is easy to put away. They are inexpensive. They can be used to file anything from papers to foods.\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Versatile Ways to Use These Bins:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Bathroom_Cleaner_Organization_3_zpswogwx1fj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Bathroom_Cleaner_Organization_3_zpswogwx1fj.jpg\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Use under the bathroom sink for toiletries, paper products, and cleaning supplies.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>File paperwork and magazines in the home office, or use them to corral miscellaneous gadgets/tech, and vinyl rolls/yarn/craft supplies.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>Because these bins are so easy to clean, they can also be used in the garage for small tools, garden supplies, grilling utensils, small toys/activities, pet supplies, and auto maintenance items.</li>\n</ul>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/Hallway_Closet_IHeart_Organizing_10_zpswqdfltns.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gMeWnfTO7UE/XSjtAQmDGwI/AAAAAAABOQg/8XOVL4kxYXQcp5G3tc8jBB6JqXpc6hnkgCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Lazy_Susan.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; They are especially great in narrow and corner areas when it can be trickier to access items near the back of a cabinet or shelf.\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Versatile Ways to Use Turntables:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Corner_Cabinet_Lazy_Susan_Organization_zpsbrfyakz1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Corner_Cabinet_Lazy_Susan_Organization_zpsbrfyakz1.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Corner cabinets are always awkward to maximize, but we added oversized turntables to two lower shelves and haven't regretted it for a single second. They are so handy and I feel sincere delight every day when I give them a spin and easily grab just what I need. We use them for oils/sauces/spreads and food storage containers, but they would also work well for coffee canisters/mugs, vases/accessories, dishes, and baking canisters. <i>(<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2015/11/organized-kitchen-corner-cabinet-with.html\" target=\"_blank\">see our original DIY tutorial here</a>)</i></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>Use these under kitchen sinks for cleaning and household maintenance products.</li>\n</ul>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Fridge_Lazy_Susan_Organization.2_zps38lfafej.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Fridge_Lazy_Susan_Organization.2_zps38lfafej.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>In the fridge so that items don't fall prey to disappearing on the backs of the shelves. I finally swapped ours to <a href=\"http://bit.ly/30JmzN1\" target=\"_blank\">a version with a lip</a> and it is infinitely better than one without.</li>\n</ul>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/Client_Pantry_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_16_zpsjuhstoea.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/Client_Pantry_Organization_IHeart_Organizing_16_zpsjuhstoea.jpg\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Add these in a variety of shapes/sizes to make the most of awkward and deep pantry/cabinet shelves. Bottles, jars, and cans are most common, but small packages and boxes can also be stored on these handy helpers.</li>\n</ul>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Bathroom_Shelves_Organized_Lazy_Susan_Caddy_zpsdiskbti3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Bathroom_Shelves_Organized_Lazy_Susan_Caddy_zpsdiskbti3.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Add them to bathroom/linen closet shelves for toiletries.</li>\n</ul>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Art_Craft_Cabinet_Organized_Lazy_Susan_zpsqbrvbf2w.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Art_Craft_Cabinet_Organized_Lazy_Susan_zpsqbrvbf2w.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Put them to work in home offices/craft rooms filled with paints, coloring tools, scissors, glue, small notepads, etc...</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>Pop one on top of the washer to hold stain remover, detergent, dryer sheets, lint roller, and a change jar.</li>\n</ul>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uPwS8mAyGOA/XSvryqUEo9I/AAAAAAABOQw/MjpZqmwYrJ8Ur5sHNHUvbWcQB2FDw0KHQCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Food_Storage.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"99\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uPwS8mAyGOA/XSvryqUEo9I/AAAAAAABOQw/MjpZqmwYrJ8Ur5sHNHUvbWcQB2FDw0KHQCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Food_Storage.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3661036\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? Since then, I have really reduced the number of items I actually decant on a weekly basis. I have also since discovered some \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2liQCMb\" target=\"_blank\">comparable containers from Target</a> that seem to do a much better job of locking in the freshness for longer periods in time. So good that I have made the switch to these for our baking ingredients as well as for beans and snacks in our coffee cabinet.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Produce:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/iHeart_Organizing_Fridge_Organization_Storage.5.2_zps2y95qazj.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/iHeart_Organizing_Fridge_Organization_Storage.5.2_zps2y95qazj.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Since my last fridge post, I also swapped out our produce containers after many, many years. A few months ago I spotted \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2lnxlct\" target=\"_blank\">these Prepworks Produce Prokeepers</a>&nbsp;at our local Costco (no longer available) and I instantly appreciated that they were flexible enough to store a large variety of produce types inside of the fridge. They include detailed instructions right on the lids with the best way to get the longest shelf life for everything from lettuce to berries to mushrooms and grapes. These containers have vents on the ends that can be opened or closed depending on the contents, as well as a drip tray that can be used to add or collect moisture. I also appreciate the more compact sizes and that the containers stack and wash nicely.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Leftovers:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />We began using glass food storage containers for produce, meal prep, snacks, and leftovers quite a few years ago, and I continue to heart them just as much today. I look for containers with snapping/locking lids, and they do such a great job maintaining freshness. The biggest perk is that the containers last forever (haven't had one break on us yet). They also wash beautifully each and every time, no more worrying about trapped food smells or red stains. Finally, many glass storage containers can quickly and easily go straight from the fridge to the oven or microwave without dirtying another container for cooking.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Snacking:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/01_iHeart_Organizing_Fridge_Organization_Storage.2_zpspvxbfts8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/01_iHeart_Organizing_Fridge_Organization_Storage.2_zpspvxbfts8.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />We use two types of containers for snack prep each week. And although both are still plastics, they have cut down on our single-use plastic usage significantly. Each week I do a lot of snack prep for our family which includes peppers, cucumbers, berries, grapes, peas, cherry tomatoes, carrots, etc... \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2lnrZhn\" target=\"_blank\">These small reusable bags (8 oz)</a> and \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2lmx4qf\" target=\"_blank\">these stackable containers (20 oz)</a> have both done a great job in getting our snacks through the week while remaining portable for quick grab-and-go moments. A bonus is they are both dishwasher safe, and can also also be used for dry snacks like nuts, granola, pretzels, and crackers.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sx1O_THto1M/XSvslCeo7sI/AAAAAAABOQ4/Y3htbsfF0qQfMs1uVr3IUHC4OloUUbVrQCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Shoe_Boxes.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"99\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sx1O_THto1M/XSvslCeo7sI/AAAAAAABOQ4/Y3htbsfF0qQfMs1uVr3IUHC4OloUUbVrQCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Shoe_Boxes.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3661055\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? They are ideal for corralling and categorizing a variety of smaller items in any space. The lids allow them to stack, which is generally a perk for making the most of vertical shelf space. Just be careful, stackable containers are only beneficial when they aren't being used on a daily basis.\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Versatile Ways to These Containers:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />Shoe boxes work best in cabinets and closets to manage and separate a variety of items. We also like to use them in our garage and storage room on shelves for managing tools and hardware. Here are just a few ways these boxes can work some storage magic:\n<br />\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Shoes</li>\n</ul>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Organized_Toy_Storage_Bins_Shoe_Boxes.2_zpsnnxlvgo7.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; You can stack them, but you don't have to remove anything to access the contents inside. I prefer to spend a little more on storage drawers (vs. shoe boxes) when organizing high traffic areas.\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Bathroom_Stacking_Drawer_Storage_Organization_zps2ctemmax.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BQrbwZ8qiwo/XSvtO5BclsI/AAAAAAABORM/P79QhRRoHz0dIoBD_C8DeD-Do_2bjS0IwCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Drawer_Organizers.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; Reactivate it to view this content.\n   </noscript>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</center>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Why I Love These:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />Drawer dividers are to drawers what bins are to closets and cabinets. They are a really great way to categorize and separate items, while ultimately preventing jumbled and tangled messes. Opening a divided drawer should allow you to quickly see and access exactly what you are looking for, and will also cause a pause-and-think-moment when putting things away. I have tried a few types of organizers over the years, but there are a select few that I continue to come back to time and time again due to their versatility, sizing, and cleanliness.\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Office | Bathroom | Junk Drawers:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/iHeart_Organizing_Junk_Drawer_Organizers_Kitchen_zpsxfbph85t.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/iHeart_Organizing_Junk_Drawer_Organizers_Kitchen_zpsxfbph85t.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_School_Zone_Drawer_zpsyhuhpwbw.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_School_Zone_Drawer_zpsyhuhpwbw.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />I have two favorites for these types of drawers: acrylic and rubber-coated options. Both can easily be removed and washed, both have a variety of size offerings to mix and match and create endless configurations, and both are priced fair due to the longevity and flexibility they offer. Acrylic gives a bonus of seeing through to a pretty liner, but you really can't go wrong with either.\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Kitchen:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/13_iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_Utensil_Drawer_Organizers_2_zpsjfy4eija.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"835\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/13_iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_Utensil_Drawer_Organizers_2_zpsjfy4eija.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Cooking utensils come in a wide variety of sizes, so I like to look for organizers that offer at least a 14\" long option which should accommodate most turners and spoons. We have been known to \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2015/08/four-days-four-drawers-mini-organizing_28.html\" target=\"_blank\">create custom DIY dividers</a> for most of our utensil drawers, but another great option I have been recently using on some projects are the expandable dividers.\n<br />\n<br />\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n <tbody>\n  <tr>\n   <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/14_iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_Utensil_Drawer_Organizers_2_zpsrehfz9bo.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/14_iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_Utensil_Drawer_Organizers_2_zpsrehfz9bo.png\" /></a></td>\n  </tr>\n  <tr>\n   <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><i style=\"font-size: medium; text-align: start;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-small;\">(<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2XS6Xd9\" target=\"_blank\">These bamboo expandable dividers from Target</a>&nbsp;fit IKEA kitchen drawers beautifully.)</span></i></td>\n  </tr>\n </tbody>\n</table>\n<br />These drawer organizers are spring-loaded and can quickly divide drawers in half, thirds, fourths... whatever you like! I have become such a superfan, and although I was skeptical if they were worth the investment, I can officially say that they are.\n<br />\n<br />\n<i><span style=\"font-size: x-small;\"><br /></span></i>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Clothing:</b></span>\n<br />\n<br />Again, two favorite methods for organizing clothing drawers that both work so dang well I couldn't name a favorite from the two.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Organized_Clothing_Drawer_Dividers_2_zpsikan4qkp.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/IHeart_Organizing_Organized_Clothing_Drawer_Dividers_2_zpsikan4qkp.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />One way I tackle clothing drawers it to look for soft-sided boxes, which are the ideal for the filing method while also creating general categories for pajamas, long-sleeves, short sleeves, socks, undergarments, leggings, tanks, etc...\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/DIY_Drawer_Divider_Hack_Cord_Clip_IHeart_Organizing_13_zps97egkqbm.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Favorite%20Storage/550%20px/DIY_Drawer_Divider_Hack_Cord_Clip_IHeart_Organizing_13_zps97egkqbm.jpg\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Another way is to divide from front to back by creating channels to hold folded/filed clothing in place. \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/03/do-it-yourself-quick-and-easy.html\" target=\"_blank\">We have DIY'd this method in the past here</a>, but you can also use the longer spring-loaded options for an immediate solution.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HR4rnF715HI/XSvtd4nBkTI/AAAAAAABORQ/oTxfKQRtV0sTcEbfCSo3a87GpLS2ojRKwCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Document_Boxes.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"99\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HR4rnF715HI/XSvtd4nBkTI/AAAAAAABORQ/oTxfKQRtV0sTcEbfCSo3a87GpLS2ojRKwCLcBGAs/s1600/Shop_Now_Product_Header_Document_Boxes.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3661148\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? They completely conceal the clutter while keeping things accessible in a decorative way. These are especially ideal on open shelves/closets but are flexible enough to work just about anywhere.\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;georgia&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Awards/Ribbons/Metals</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>Memorabilia</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>Tech/Cords</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>Photos</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n <li>Entryway clutter</li>\n</ul>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
