ot.com/-RgoqKuqNx8k/Xc3oUlSKUpI/AAAAAAABPiU/SKnVENN7EPgvjYC5p9oLagy4hLbpZmgnwCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Photo%2BJun%2B24%252C%2B1%2B53%2B10%2BPM.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn78@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-38-498_8f557a8f0c286726.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-f3Xdh2S2hEM/Xc3ocByQyWI/AAAAAAABPiY/5wxHgLg6wIEdPH55Ng6Yivib95gPNU5vACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Post_Sources.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn10@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-31-554_a3e116def8b7652f.webp","https://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/95e6749d13d27110928d1f83136e8419b3042fb3/images/search/350.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn10@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-39-665_58faf2315e4e9c13.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228319},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Charging Cabinet Organization Check-In","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/07/charging-cabinet-organization-check-in.html","description":"One thing you all ask for more of is just a simple update or check-in on past organizing projects, and how they have maintained or held up. I have been thinking a lot about how we tend to blog about our projects instantly as we do them, whether it be DIY or organization, and we may really love something right after it is complete, but find ourselves changing things down the road for various reasons. Knowing that, I would like to be better about either waiting to post about something until we have lived with it for a short while and worked out any kinks, or just be sure to be better about following up on things as they evolve or change over time.\n<br />\n<br />When I posted about \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/04/the-best-of-best-my-top-organizing-tips.html\" target=\"_blank\">my all-time favorite organizing tips</a>, I received a lot of emails about our docking/charging station. It seemed like the perfect opportunity to do another post for anyone newer around here, or for those wondering how it has worked for us over the years.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WRva_q5lcj0/XTt75_o8FnI/AAAAAAABObk/piIMO36D8-8lYfMp32sa1o5X5DANLMfcwCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WRva_q5lcj0/XTt75_o8FnI/AAAAAAABObk/piIMO36D8-8lYfMp32sa1o5X5DANLMfcwCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/02/family-charging-station-cabinet.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">FIND THE ORIGINAL POST HERE</span></a>\n</div>\n<br />We have a cabinet located in a sideboard in our dining area that we dedicate to all things technology and school. I am a really big fan of creating zones in our home dedicated to specific tasks, and because we go through schedules and homework and do school-related projects at our dining table, this cabinet has been so very valuable and handy to us over the years.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />This is one of those projects where I can honestly say, that other than some supplies, not much has changed in what we keep here or how we utilize the original systems in place. That makes this a true thumbs up of a project that has remained extremely useful as our boys have gone through elementary, middle, and now high school.\n<br />\n<br />Before diving into the specifics of the cabinet, a key partner to the setup is the drawer located just above, which I stock with fresh supplies at the beginning of each school year.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-33JL7hjDrSo/XTt77VXIFlI/AAAAAAABOb8/uBXQ8aeU_sQSOos4vOb3WJ_AQeERXDxgQCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_School_Zone_Drawer.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-33JL7hjDrSo/XTt77VXIFlI/AAAAAAABOb8/uBXQ8aeU_sQSOos4vOb3WJ_AQeERXDxgQCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_School_Zone_Drawer.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />This drawer typically contains erasers, paperclips, Post-its, stapler, scissors, pens, rubber bands, color pencils, page flags, a ruler, hole punch, pencils, sharpener, glue, and tape.\n<br />\n<br />These are items that seem to be required to accomplish the majority of their homework and projects.\n<br />\n<br />Now, back to the cabinet...\n<br />\n<br />We built a paper sorting inbox for the kids to manage any necessary school paperwork: newsletters, calendars, details about extracurriculars and athletics, lunch menus, etc... (\n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/02/do-it-yourself-paper-sorting-organizer.html\" target=\"_blank\">find the paper sorter DIY tutorial here</a>.) Once a week I just go through each slot and recycle anything that is no longer relevant. Because it is currently summer break, we only have a few college (!) related materials that we need to keep track of.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VlipccO_ZcU/XTt_NCoItlI/AAAAAAABOcY/SO8z1y764kAmdGMBGbvR2UNlFqXaDEzkwCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.7.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VlipccO_ZcU/XTt_NCoItlI/AAAAAAABOcY/SO8z1y764kAmdGMBGbvR2UNlFqXaDEzkwCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.7.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I received a lot of source questions specifically about the tiered charging station. I love this thing, and would you be surprised to know I just purchased \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2SFDDAU\" target=\"_blank\">an office file organizer</a>? Yep! Which means you really can use it to file paperwork \n<i>and</i> charge your electronics if you wish! All in one very handy spot!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-m6B2C3TCoMw/XTt751itioI/AAAAAAABOcI/IwCQ8wML7sA7py-QaQfW8eHr9CEenJ9BACEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-m6B2C3TCoMw/XTt751itioI/AAAAAAABOcI/IwCQ8wML7sA7py-QaQfW8eHr9CEenJ9BACEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.3.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />There is an outlet in this cabinet that allowed us to feed cords into the sorting tray and run them into each divided compartment through an opening in the back (we used a USB strip to cut down on bulky bricks). The tray is wide enough we can fit 2-3 phones in a single slot.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HO-J9Txloiw/XTt76s6uQjI/AAAAAAABOcI/ZlOW0KszmAAxbLn-dLe-za_affDOVFjqwCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HO-J9Txloiw/XTt76s6uQjI/AAAAAAABOcI/ZlOW0KszmAAxbLn-dLe-za_affDOVFjqwCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.4.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Most importantly, we try to keep bedrooms tech-free at bedtime, so this setup allows the boys to charge their devices in a single spot overnight. The tray is able to accommodate Chromebooks, Bluetooth accessories (keyboard/headphones/battery cells), tablets, and phones. We found that some of the universal cords also work to charge a variety of other small household electronics/devices out of sight as well, which is just a happy bonus.\n<br />\n<br />(I used my label maker to label each tier of the organizer, you can find all of those details in \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/05/labeling-101-quick-easy-labeling.html\" target=\"_blank\">this post here</a>.)\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZTEqCgU2zAc/XTt76-UdNcI/AAAAAAABOcM/-iVxiN-pkHwiC0rEQuwxSzHZ5BNfCuHngCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.5.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZTEqCgU2zAc/XTt76-UdNcI/AAAAAAABOcM/-iVxiN-pkHwiC0rEQuwxSzHZ5BNfCuHngCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.5.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Because we quickly realized that there are times the kids still need a charge during the day or while they are traveling, we store some spare bricks and cords in the cabinet as well.\n<br />\n<br />\n<i><b>Quick Tip:</b> I have used a lot of ties and cord wranglers over the years, and have learned that rubber bands and/or hair ties easily and inexpensively do the trick just as well as anything.</i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--4r8BinP6OM/XTt77ENu3LI/AAAAAAABOcQ/_5pSkxdYcT0Gh4sULdBKPUd4nGXz7SrDQCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.6.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"826\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--4r8BinP6OM/XTt77ENu3LI/AAAAAAABOcQ/_5pSkxdYcT0Gh4sULdBKPUd4nGXz7SrDQCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.6.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />Lastly, we have accrued quite a few random colored pencils and markers over the years, so they all get tossed in some lidded bins that can easily be transported to desks or the table as needed.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-45RrjzZLAlA/XTuFroyuojI/AAAAAAABOck/-JFn76Rcp_svwXx08SYQ77VR4PNpe4XEwCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Sources_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"45\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-45RrjzZLAlA/XTuFroyuojI/AAAAAAABOck/-JFn76Rcp_svwXx08SYQ77VR4PNpe4XEwCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Sources_2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3671053\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? 'http' : 'https';if(!d.getElementById(id)) {e = d.createElement(s);e.id = id;e.src = p + '://' + 'widgets.rewardstyle.com' + '/js/shopthepost.js';d.body.appendChild(e);}if(typeof window.__stp === 'object') if(d.readyState === 'complete') {window.__stp.init();}}(document, 'script', 'shopthepost-script');</script>\n  <br />\n  <div class=\"rs-adblock\">\n   <img onerror=\"this.parentNode.innerHTML='Disable your ad blocking software to view this content.'\" src=\"http://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/9734aaac170c2b18fbcdc9ea2ce5ca5bb99b0dec/images/search/350.gif\" style=\"height: 15px; width: 15px;\" />\n   <noscript>\n    JavaScript is currently disabled in this browser. Reactivate it to view this content.\n   </noscript>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</center>\n<br />\n<br />And that is it, not complicated but really useful. I think the tiered paper organizer works so well due to its overall size and narrow slots, which is something to keep in mind if you are looking for alternative trays/organizers to do a similar task. And if you don't have Chromebooks but are searching for a similar charging option, \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2YlC1NV\" target=\"_blank\">this docking station</a> appears to be something that can hold quite a few tablets/devices as well. Either way, it's always great when you can \"take charge\" of the technology situation!\n<br />\n<br />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 26 Jul 2019 22:00:00 +0000","feedId":5474,"bgimg":"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WRva_q5lcj0/XTt75_o8FnI/AAAAAAABObk/piIMO36D8-8lYfMp32sa1o5X5DANLMfcwCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.2.png","linkMd5":"b977abccbc47af4b15e8092ea79e4ac7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn25@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-29-182_82babf3de2e05da8.webp","destWidth":550,"destHeight":825,"sourceBytes":528915,"destBytes":42788,"author":"IHeart Organizing","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WRva_q5lcj0/XTt75_o8FnI/AAAAAAABObk/piIMO36D8-8lYfMp32sa1o5X5DANLMfcwCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn25@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-29-182_82babf3de2e05da8.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-33JL7hjDrSo/XTt77VXIFlI/AAAAAAABOb8/uBXQ8aeU_sQSOos4vOb3WJ_AQeERXDxgQCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Kitchen_School_Zone_Drawer.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn85@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-39-914_1c9ff8089de6c533.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VlipccO_ZcU/XTt_NCoItlI/AAAAAAABOcY/SO8z1y764kAmdGMBGbvR2UNlFqXaDEzkwCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-46-291_1ba3d4cddbc82605.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-m6B2C3TCoMw/XTt751itioI/AAAAAAABOcI/IwCQ8wML7sA7py-QaQfW8eHr9CEenJ9BACEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn85@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-45-161_fcc3d789f037f485.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HO-J9Txloiw/XTt76s6uQjI/AAAAAAABOcI/ZlOW0KszmAAxbLn-dLe-za_affDOVFjqwCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn37@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-41-237_5c0427a1aeb4ad15.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZTEqCgU2zAc/XTt76-UdNcI/AAAAAAABOcM/-iVxiN-pkHwiC0rEQuwxSzHZ5BNfCuHngCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn26@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-38-527_4ceb10cc0a18833c.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--4r8BinP6OM/XTt77ENu3LI/AAAAAAABOcQ/_5pSkxdYcT0Gh4sULdBKPUd4nGXz7SrDQCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Charging_Cabinet_Kitchen_School_Zone.6.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn38@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-40-176_42ae220fe89c2413.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-45RrjzZLAlA/XTuFroyuojI/AAAAAAABOck/-JFn76Rcp_svwXx08SYQ77VR4PNpe4XEwCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Sources_2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn46@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-47-008_b33f8df3768442ea.webp","http://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/9734aaac170c2b18fbcdc9ea2ce5ca5bb99b0dec/images/search/350.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn82@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-44-361_6a68f836de73deda.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228318},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Homekeeping 101: The Basics","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/08/homekeeping-101-basics.html","description":"With the kids home all summer and a lot of conversations with friends happening about general household chores, I thought I would take some time to focus on the basics. Because just as much as I love a little hack for cleaning shower heads, a great homemade cleaner recipe, or an amazing cleaning checklist, the basics are what keep our house running on a daily basis.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KNhlcH0fhaA/W3MFZ1qLaJI/AAAAAAABM_g/GdFedKri3Zkbrjwm-JFCZAtcbNb2Sg_iACLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Bedroom_Cleaning_Tips_Nightstand_Header.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KNhlcH0fhaA/W3MFZ1qLaJI/AAAAAAABM_g/GdFedKri3Zkbrjwm-JFCZAtcbNb2Sg_iACLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Bedroom_Cleaning_Tips_Nightstand_Header.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />Having the kids home from school all summer is always a quick reality check of how messy the house can get oh-so-quickly, and how important our \"all hands on deck\" mentality is. From beach towels to athletic gear to multiple meals a day and sleepovers galore, things can spiral out of control in the blink of an eye. The following \"basics\" have definitely been our glue, and although some of these tips might seem ridiculously obvious, they are absolutely worth mentioning.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/01_zpspyl9zuqs.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/01_zpspyl9zuqs.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_09_zpsphphutji.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_09_zpsphphutji.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I have talked about this before but here it is again because it is my top tip for quickly maintaining your home: Set yourself up for success.\n<br />\n<br />I recommend storing your household cleaners in the primary areas of your home so they are easy to grab and use. Also, simplify your cleaners down to just what you \n<i>need</i> to reduce confusion for the entire family. Many all-purpose cleaners are just that and can tackle counters, windows, stovetops and even quick floor cleanups. Keep bathroom cleaners under a bathroom sink and kitchen cleaners under the kitchen sink.\n<br />\n<br />The basic cleaning supplies that I have found I can get away with using for 99% of our household chores are:\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li><a href=\"http://bit.ly/2Oze69g\" target=\"_blank\">Duster</a></li>\n <li>All-Purpose Cleaner (I just use a mixture of distilled water, 2-3 drops of dish soap, vinegar, and tea tree oil, and apply it to counters, appliances, glass, and floors)</li>\n <li>A couple cleaning cloths (one for glass, one for surface)</li>\n <li><a href=\"https://amzn.to/2KPz5SW\" target=\"_blank\">Vacuum</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"http://bit.ly/2vK8zWk\" target=\"_blank\">Mop</a></li>\n</ul>\n<div>\n In the bathroom:\n</div>\n<div>\n <ul>\n  <li>Toilet bowl cleaner</li>\n  <li>Toilet brush</li>\n  <li>Surface cleaner &amp; cloths</li>\n  <li>Shower cleaner inside of a <a href=\"https://amzn.to/2P7ND3w\" target=\"_blank\">dispensing scrub brush&nbsp;</a></li>\n </ul>\n</div>\n<br />I have loved and used \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2Oy9RuE\" target=\"_blank\">cleaning caddies</a> for years now, and they are great when I am doing a bigger room-to-room deep cleaning session, but for daily battles, I like that my go-to cleaners are right within an arm's reach of the mess. I also recommend keeping a vacuum and broom on each floor of the home and storing less-used specialty cleaners together and out of the way (I keep mine in our laundry room).\n<br />\n<br />By removing a lot of the extras and keeping it simple, my family asks me fewer questions and are quicker to just grab what they need to get the job done.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/02_zpslksthgwg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/02_zpslksthgwg.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_04_zpsskmoqrge.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_04_zpsskmoqrge.png\" data-original-height=\"495\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Color code the cleaning rags.\n<br />\n<br />We use microfiber cloths for just about everything, and to prevent cross-contaminating the bathroom germs with the kitchen germs, I assigned the two spaces their own cloth colors. Green is used in the kitchen and blue is used in the bathroom (or for other dirtier jobs). I also added a stack of pink for our pets near their feeding station. Easy enough for all of us to remember and the rags just get stored in their designated areas.\n<br />\n<br />At the end of each week, the bathroom rags are washed with my mop heads and bath mats, the pet rags are washed with dog bed covers and their bath towels, and the kitchen rags and dishtowels are washed together. I always wash these items on a sanitary cycle during my Sunday linen wash day.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/03_zpsjd5kc50f.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/03_zpsjd5kc50f.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_02.2_zpsymctbiof.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_02.2_zpsymctbiof.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Baking soda and dish soap can clean just about anything.\n<br />\n<br />Clear dish soap makes a really great stain remover and I use it all of the time on furniture, clothing, rugs, and spills. Because it is clear, I don't have to worry about it damaging colors or materials (I always start with a small drop or two and paired with some water it typically does the trick). Baking soda is a good deodorizing agent and also helps to absorb the spill/stain/wetness.\n<br />\n<br />For those tougher messes (think pots, pans, baking sheets, ovens, etc...), soaking items with baking soda, dish soap and water is a major sanity saver. After cooking I always soak our pots and pans with baking soda and dish soap and by the time I am ready to wash them, they come clean with little to no scrubbing.\n<br />\n<br />Baking soda and dish soap seem to be a powerhouse cleaner when combined, and I wouldn't hesitate to reach for the combo when tackling any major cleaning job around the house, inside or out!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/04_zpsjm2hzvnq.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/04_zpsjm2hzvnq.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_08_zpsokbealp1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_08_zpsokbealp1.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Clean from top to bottom.\n<br />\n<br />This general rule applies to just about any cleaning task; it is always easiest and quickest to work from the top down. Washing glass? Start at the top and make \"S\" motions down to the bottom. Cleaning the kitchen, wash counters and the table first, then vacuum/mop the floor. Bathroom? Clean the mirror and work down to the sink and counter and finish at the base of the toilet. Spraying down the siding outside, start at the top and... you got it! Work your way down.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/05_zpsymme7ma0.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/05_zpsymme7ma0.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_01_zpsuc13arbc.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_01_zpsuc13arbc.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Clean with the grain.\n<br />\n<br />There are times when I actually encourage folks to go against the grain, but that is not the case when it comes to basic homekeeping. Washing items against the grain will bring out imperfections and may cause the surface to appear less clean than it is. It is always best to clean floors, stainless steel, wood furniture, etc... \n<i>with</i> the natural grain of the item. When the cleaner dries, it should blend right in and enhance the beauty, not fight it.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/06_zpsj2umo2jr.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/06_zpsj2umo2jr.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_03.2_zpsloatz2r4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_03.2_zpsloatz2r4.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Dishwashers are not just for dishes!\n<br />\n<br />Did you know that so many other things can be cleaned in a dishwasher? A few examples of things we have washed in our dishwasher are light fixture shades, toothbrushes, sponges, scrub brushes, toys, soap dishes, shower caddies, combs, vases, canisters, baseball caps, drawer organizers, basic tools, vent covers, etc...\n<br />\n<br />Of course, I say this with my \n<i>use with caution</i>&nbsp;warning, the top rack is usually best for anything you worry about. Avoid putting anything too precious in the dishwasher, also avoid washing anything made of wood or with a delicate metal finish. Always rinse items first to prevent clogging up your dishwasher and when in doubt, leave it out.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/07_zpshutw2kfa.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/07_zpshutw2kfa.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_05.3_zpsxi1wmqj6.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_05.3_zpsxi1wmqj6.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Fold/hang clothes straight out of the dryer.\n<br />\n<br />In the past I would get in a habit of taking clothes out of the dryer, tossing them in a basket, and taking them to another room of the house to deal with. Then I would do my best to fold things during a nightly T.V. show, but too many times the contents wouldn't end up put away. And just as I did when I was a kid, my boys would mix dirty with clean or would leave piles on their beds which would then tumble to the floor...\n<br />\n<br />A while back we decided to try something new, so straight out of the dryer the clothes are either immediately folded or put directly on their respective hangers (I just grab the empty hangers out of the closet on my way to the laundry room), and stacked in a portable basket. Same for linens. It only takes a couple of minutes and makes it much easier to put everything away right away. I also have the boys doing this with their personal loads and it has completely cut down on the piles of questionables around the house and in each bedroom. The \n<a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/20401860/\" target=\"_blank\">wire baskets we use</a> are lightweight and portable making it easy to tote around the house and return back to the laundry room (as shown \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/05/laundry-room-update-built-in-wshiplap.html\" target=\"_blank\">here</a>).\n<br />\n<br />Laundry can quickly become a monster if not managed regularly but really isn't all that hard if you just get into a good groove with it. I am not sure why it works so much better for us to just deal with everything right out of the dryer (vs. taking it to the couch or our bedroom to fold), but it has been a huge sanity saver so I call it a very basic win. And while we are on the subject, giving each member of the house their own designated day to do their laundry has also been amazing.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/08_zpsunf4kwqg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/08_zpsunf4kwqg.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_06_zpsvklvogrm.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_06_zpsvklvogrm.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Multi-task whenever possible.\n<br />\n<br />I have gotten into the habit of building some of the basic household cleaning tasks into my routine each day, which makes it much easier to maintain the home in general. For example, I wash the bathroom sink/counter each time I brush my teeth. I scrub down the walls of the shower while actually taking a shower. I quickly wipe up the kitchen counters while making my coffee. I wipe down the inside of the fridge each week when I put away groceries. These very quick add-ins really add up each week.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/09_zpsrmfzwvvg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/09_zpsrmfzwvvg.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_10_zpsg4ifxxuw.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_10_zpsg4ifxxuw.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Make your bed every day.\n<br />\n<br />Maybe I should move this one to the top because it might just be the most impactful. I will admit that I haven't always been a believer in making my bed every day, and never really encouraged the kids to do it either. But after it became such a positive habit, I can't imagine not doing it. It makes a huge difference in quickly pulling our bedroom together, but it also has been really uplifting to my mood. And I love leaving our bedroom door open and catching a glimpse of the tidy bed, which can be exactly what I need when I am having a messy day.\n<br />\n<br />Not buying it? I encourage you to try it for two weeks and check out \n<a href=\"https://www.thespruce.com/reasons-to-make-your-bed-every-day-350511\" target=\"_blank\">this article</a>&nbsp;(or listen to \n<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KgzLzbd-zT4\" target=\"_blank\">this awesome speech</a>). It is a great basic housekeeping \n<i>and</i> life-changing task!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/10_zpsckic1lww.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/10_zpsckic1lww.png\" data-original-height=\"35\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_07.3_zpsjgqfmgtm.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_07.3_zpsjgqfmgtm.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Homekeeping takes some effort.\n<br />\n<br />Dang, if I could teach my kids anything about basic housekeeping, it would be that life is so much easier if you just pick up after yourself right away. And if that just isn't possible, to set aside a few minutes at the end of each day to do so. Too many times we have spent an entire afternoon on a weekend dealing with a week's worth of random piles and messes. I can think of 1,001 other ways I would rather spend a weekend day, and my family agrees.\n<br />\n<br />I know that some people are naturally more tidy than others. That some people can look right past a pile or mess and be completely unphased by it, while others can't focus or relax until that pile is gone. We have both personality types living under our roof and it has always been a give and take and compromise.\n<br />\n<br />There are definitely days when I say, \"the chores can wait\", and the clean freak in me has done a lot of letting go over the years. There is something to be said about soaking up the little moments in life and I know first hand that our time with our kids goes much too quickly. So cheers to playing a card game after dinner instead of stressing out about those puppy nose prints on the patio door.\n<br />\n<br />But the matter of the fact is that the mess will continue to be there until we deal with it, and it only snowballs if we don't.\n<br />\n<br />So we try to find that right balance and do our best to take care of a lot of the basics each day and to pick up after ourselves when we take things out.\n<br />\n<br />We also work together to do a quick pick-up at the end of each day. I leave a \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2Oz7oQu\" target=\"_blank\">flexible basket</a> hung on a hook near the stairs to corral random items that need to be brought down, and it also works great for running through the house and collecting things like electronics, mail, crafts, toiletries, socks, etc... that have been left out throughout the day and need to be put away. We always tidy up the kitchen (run the dishwasher after dinner, quickly sweep or vacuum, wipe down the table/counters)&nbsp;and fluff the sofa pillows before bed. It makes all of the difference just taking 10-15 minutes each evening to start the following day off right.\n<br />\n<br />I wish there was a red \"easy\" button or magic cleaning fairy that would come in and get things done while we sleep, but general homekeeping just takes some work and discipline. We aren't always perfect or on top of every mess, and we still have times when we have to play catch-up and binge clean parts of the home, yard or garage. But we continuously instill in the boys that we are all responsible for \n<i>our</i> home, and always have them help with the basic homekeeping responsibilities.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wN9-Y90QUMA/W3IAMV37qmI/AAAAAAABM_U/02fEJNW-foEFHUMuRCudGOmrlBp7yHx_gCLcBGAs/s1600/Swash.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"20\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wN9-Y90QUMA/W3IAMV37qmI/AAAAAAABM_U/02fEJNW-foEFHUMuRCudGOmrlBp7yHx_gCLcBGAs/s1600/Swash.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />I think this is one of those discussions that could really benefit from your added ideas and advice in the comments below. I hear so often that people are generally overwhelmed with household chores and keeping up with daily duties. People want quick tips, shortcuts, and basic ideas to make homekeeping more manageable and less discouraging. Do you have additional ideas to share? How about small things you have added to your routine that have had a big payoff? Any ah-ha moments that we all could benefit from? Let's chat!\n<br />\n<br />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 14 Aug 2018 09:00:00 +0000","feedId":5474,"bgimg":"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KNhlcH0fhaA/W3MFZ1qLaJI/AAAAAAABM_g/GdFedKri3Zkbrjwm-JFCZAtcbNb2Sg_iACLcBGAs/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Bedroom_Cleaning_Tips_Nightstand_Header.png","linkMd5":"5a546a9f2f012a4d34e2cf9e40c59194","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn94@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-28-883_0883d21c28895580.webp","destWidth":550,"destHeight":825,"sourceBytes":392259,"destBytes":18520,"author":"IHeart
