2/2020/08/24/22-30-32-729_d0d30353f9f8f3c3.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_10_zpsg4ifxxuw.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn82@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-44-534_b3b954bb7b4b8bf0.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Blog%20Images/10_zpsckic1lww.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn17@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-50-804_e2e994c1471a2c44.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Household%20Tasks/IHeart_Organizing_Cleaning_Basics_Tips_07.3_zpsjgqfmgtm.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn94@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-49-558_5b131cdd9101be20.webp","https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wN9-Y90QUMA/W3IAMV37qmI/AAAAAAABM_U/02fEJNW-foEFHUMuRCudGOmrlBp7yHx_gCLcBGAs/s1600/Swash.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn62@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-47-020_2f57f47bcd2fdb25.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228321},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"My Favorite Tips for Organizing a Deep Pantry","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/03/my-favorite-tips-for-organizing-deep.html","description":"<span style=\"background-color: white;\">Kitchens seem to be a very popular request for me lately, and I have been helping a few different folks plan out and organize their cabinets, pantries, and drawers. I have also been compiling a lot of the common questions and themes that have been arising, and hope to do a post in the near future outlining how to get started and tips for creating a solid kitchen storage plan.</span>\n<br />\n<br />But a similar subject worthy of its own post, and a question I receive almost more than any other, is what to do with a deep pantry closet? Or any deep cabinet really. They can be such dark and confusing places and definitely&nbsp;require a little extra thinking and planning.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9TbwkcewCDo/WrIdoIu7iOI/AAAAAAABMHA/0M3WhgdcJ6EwuUlF56RbopiUedI6NEQ5QCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Header.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9TbwkcewCDo/WrIdoIu7iOI/AAAAAAABMHA/0M3WhgdcJ6EwuUlF56RbopiUedI6NEQ5QCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Header.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">One of the kitchens I was recently&nbsp;asked to help with, has a deep pantry closet very reminiscent of</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;</span>\n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2013/02/kitchen-pantry-update-part-3-reveal.html\" style=\"background-color: white; color: #1155cc;\" target=\"_blank\">our previous pantry</a>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">. I vividly remember the days of frustration and trial and error and constant reorganization.</span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">Around the time I was consulting on this project,</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;</span>\n<a href=\"https://rstyle.me/ad/g5b8bzb5y77&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" style=\"background-color: white; color: #1155cc;\" target=\"_blank\">The Container Store</a>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">had reached out to me to see if I would be interested in partnering with them on a kitchen organizing story. Talk about the stars aligning just right. Their supersized kitchen sale is going on now through the end of the month, which means the majority of their very best organizers are on sale for 25% off. If you are going to stock up on your favorite bins or tackle a kitchen organizing project, big or small, now is the time to do it!</span>\n<br />\n<br />I am definitely particular about the brands and sponsors I select to work with, and \n<a href=\"https://rstyle.me/ad/g5b8bzb5y77&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">The Container Store</a> was a no-brainer&nbsp;for many reasons. I have used quite a few of their products around our home over the years, and have yet to be disappointed. In fact, I always feel quite the opposite, especially when I have the chance to use my all-time favorite organizer ever \n<span style=\"font-size: x-small;\">(mentioned&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/07/ten-favorite-products-storage-solutions.html\" target=\"_blank\">here</a>, <a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/01/my-five-favorites-room-by-room.html\" target=\"_blank\">here</a>, and <a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2014/01/my-go-to-organizing-supplies.html\" target=\"_blank\">here</a>)</span>, \n<a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~9NU6c&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">the Multi-Purpose bin</a>.\n<br />\n<br />The before and after photos of this project make my heart sing for a variety of reasons, but this post is much more than that. I really wanted to talk about my favorite tips for tackling a pantry, especially one that is on the deeper side.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wc5Y_9z-QlM/WrFtP0EeXLI/AAAAAAABL8k/Yoo5JNUAmzopsVEnIWi5QRuxsmkdkfRwwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wc5Y_9z-QlM/WrFtP0EeXLI/AAAAAAABL8k/Yoo5JNUAmzopsVEnIWi5QRuxsmkdkfRwwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_3.jpg\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />So let's check out what the pantry looked like at the beginning of this story. Look familiar? In our area, there are so many homes built with similar style pantries; essentially a 2 ft x 2 ft closet with shelves. Is this a nationwide epidemic or just regional to the midwest?\n<br />\n<br />Although these closets seem to be fairly common, how they are used will be different for everyone. This particular closet is used by a husband and a wife, kids have all grown up and moved out, and they now have seven grandkids who love to stop by with their parents for a visit.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Z1sAHRVHVlE/WrFtPmBeEuI/AAAAAAABL8g/V5tEEaGWb3oIZBGnb72Fy97htymH00rdACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Z1sAHRVHVlE/WrFtPmBeEuI/AAAAAAABL8g/V5tEEaGWb3oIZBGnb72Fy97htymH00rdACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_2.jpg\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Their storage needs vary from week-to-week. They will buy in bulk if there are sales, they enjoy hosting during the holidays, and also like to have foods and snacks on hand for their visitors and grandbabies. It is also worth mentioning that they have alternative storage in their kitchen carved out for additional pantry&nbsp;items such as spices, oils, and baking supplies.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;O N E</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />Begin with a \n<i>stocked</i> pantry. Do your&nbsp;grocery shopping for a typical week, and then take note of additional items you may purchase frequently and even some that may only be on rotation on occasion. Compile a list of everything you would like to be sure is accounted for in your pantry project.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;T W O</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />Completely clear out the pantry and any other cabinets in your kitchen that contain food items that probably \n<i>should</i> be in your pantry. Discard any items that are expired, and categorize the remainder into groupings of \"like\" items.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;T H R E E</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />Measure and create a plan! I tend to take this part pretty seriously, and I generally tackle these types of projects with the following goals:\n<br />\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>Maximize the available space</li>\n <li>Store the categorized items based on their frequency of use</li>\n <li>Select products with longevity (this means that it will last many years either in the current space or is versatile enough to be reused in a variety of ways down the road)</li>\n</ul>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n You have seen quite a few of my closet plans in the past; here is the one I had dreamed up for this specific pantry:\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xq89WPig6Ls/WrFtFjgRZ6I/AAAAAAABL8c/udeqLXubGLYG1tb8lYn8svL7dfMyGvNFQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Closet_Proposal.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"868\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xq89WPig6Ls/WrFtFjgRZ6I/AAAAAAABL8c/udeqLXubGLYG1tb8lYn8svL7dfMyGvNFQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Closet_Proposal.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n As with any project, the end result evolved a bit as I began ordering and installing and doing some final assessments. But as you can see above, the plans included drawers, door storage, bins to take up both the width and the height, as well as some room for change and growth.\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n To come up with the closet plans I measured the width and depth of every shelf. They had already installed the shelving with ledger boards and wanted to work with what they had if possible. In these types of closets, adjustable shelving may add a bit more versatility, but it definitely is not necessary. From there, I sourced the products that I thought would make the best use of the shelves from top to bottom and front to back.\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n While planning, I looked at all of the items that they currently had stored in their pantry, and also considered how they ultimately wanted the pantry to function. Could we maximize the floor to ceiling shelves \n <i>and</i> add a door unit, therefore freeing up additional cabinets in their kitchen for other things? You bet!&nbsp;\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;F O U R</span></b>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Let's talk about the beautification process. This is \n <i>NOT</i>&nbsp;a necessary step, but it is something that I like to do. It doesn't make the closet more effective to paint it or paper it, but it does bring a little bit of joy and happiness and can even act as a bit of a motivator to maintain it. I will never tell you that have to install wallpaper and create labels from fancy vinyl lettering if that is not your thing. Those are just the details that I personally enjoy, and that many of my friends and clients also appreciate in the work that I offer (some people like to decorate rooms, I like to decorate hard working cabinets and closets).&nbsp;\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">My plan recommended removing the bottom shelf of the closet,&nbsp;so because we were going to patch and touch up paint anyway, I decided to paint the entire interior of the closet the same color as the adjoining kitchen walls with some of their leftover paint.&nbsp;</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tFvuoObMthE/WrGWLRk_CPI/AAAAAAABL88/JdmrDRt0NwgHbCxVq3-v6Bmv_0IQreYbwCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Paint_Closet.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tFvuoObMthE/WrGWLRk_CPI/AAAAAAABL88/JdmrDRt0NwgHbCxVq3-v6Bmv_0IQreYbwCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Paint_Closet.jpg\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Once it was dry, I also added a peel-and-stick wallpaper between each of the ledger boards for some additional \n <i>wow</i>. The paper is temporary and removes just as easily and quickly as it went in (no residue or commitment necessary).\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tFJTAzGksmk/WrG519OaA6I/AAAAAAABMCU/FS5Bts8Y208-KZXMYNZvjcoNmAnBSZwkwCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Paint_Wallpaper_Closet.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tFJTAzGksmk/WrG519OaA6I/AAAAAAABMCU/FS5Bts8Y208-KZXMYNZvjcoNmAnBSZwkwCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Paint_Wallpaper_Closet.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n As things were coming together, the pantry owner walked by, caught a glimpse, let out a happy shriek and clapped her hands. This is 100% what it is all about for me. I almost cried seeing how happy she was with her new closet coming together.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rmxC_NJPkH4/WrG5p2mebCI/AAAAAAABMDA/fpEIDgoHlYACrlbYhYqFc8LNJRwhroapQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rmxC_NJPkH4/WrG5p2mebCI/AAAAAAABMDA/fpEIDgoHlYACrlbYhYqFc8LNJRwhroapQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_1.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <br />\n <b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;F I V E</span></b>\n <br />\n <br />If you take anything away from this post, it is to add drawers whenever possible. Drawers will take advantage of the area from front to back, and naturally bring the items from the back forward for you (vs. you needing to move things or reach over things). I added drawers to this pantry in a couple of ways; you can be as literal or creative about it as necessary. I do consider some types of bins as drawers, they can serve the same function and bring items from the back, forward.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dROJkkYJz2E/WrG5t-6lW4I/AAAAAAABMC0/ObYEO4MV8qA30UYkNZvwIvyCEJT85XRpwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_19.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dROJkkYJz2E/WrG5t-6lW4I/AAAAAAABMC0/ObYEO4MV8qA30UYkNZvwIvyCEJT85XRpwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_19.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">The most impactful set of drawers was added at the bottom of the closet via <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfIR&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">a narrow elfa drawer unit</a>. Originally, the closet had a single shelf and the floor to hold the items in this area, but now there are five nicely sized drawers, as well as a spot for a step-stool, a place to store grocery sacks, and even a little room to grow! Hello increased functionality <i>and</i> storage! For this particular&nbsp;elfa combination, I picked two of the <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfNx&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">narrow 2-runner drawers</a>, three of the <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfNv&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">narrow 1-runner drawers</a>, then added a <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfLa&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">narrow white melamine topper</a>.</span>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EsLgGql07Sg/WrG5sz_jIQI/AAAAAAABMCc/bCZbXH47TNY5b16VQ4r32JG53AhcnuECACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_18.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EsLgGql07Sg/WrG5sz_jIQI/AAAAAAABMCc/bCZbXH47TNY5b16VQ4r32JG53AhcnuECACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_18.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <i>Bag holder is a <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~9NU6c&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">medium Multi-Purpose bin</a> affixed to the closet wall with screws.</i>\n <br />\n <br />Closets like this can be tricky in terms of drawers because there are a few inches of recessed shelving area on either side of the door, and finding ways to not lose that space requires a little extra thinking. Although I knew we were already gaining storage by adding the elfa drawers, which are slim enough to pull through the narrow door opening, I was even happier that we were still able to add a little extra function on the one side of the drawer unit as well.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-u0nP-_r-alE/WrG5uTONb_I/AAAAAAABMDA/Nq_DtX6XWtsYEm9pqZWay_-OHonM2CpbACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_20.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-u0nP-_r-alE/WrG5uTONb_I/AAAAAAABMDA/Nq_DtX6XWtsYEm9pqZWay_-OHonM2CpbACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_20.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <div style=\"background-color: white;\">\n  I was going to wait until a little later in the post to show how amazing these drawers are, but since we are on the topic, let's take a closer look inside&nbsp;of each one. This&nbsp;elfa&nbsp;combination is small but mighty and comes in at just 21\" deep, 14\" wide and 29\" tall. Looking at those dimensions I was wondering if it really could store as much as I planned and hoped, and it certainly surprised us all.\n </div>\n <div>\n  <br />\n </div>\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">The top drawer was created just for the grandkids. The homeowner mentioned that her grandkids will come over and know right where to look in the fridge for drinks and snacks, and she really wanted to duplicate that concept in the pantry.</span>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2Wdp3FQj-hU/WrG5wZxQSGI/AAAAAAABMCk/syLsQXeX_LYeDIjjZeAKOIMGqhmBhH3vQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_23.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2Wdp3FQj-hU/WrG5wZxQSGI/AAAAAAABMCk/syLsQXeX_LYeDIjjZeAKOIMGqhmBhH3vQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_23.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">The</span>\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;</span>\n <span class=\"gmail-gr_ gmail-gr_23372 gmail-gr-alert gmail-gr_spell gmail-gr_inline_cards gmail-gr_run_anim gmail-ContextualSpelling\" id=\"gmail-23372\" style=\"animation-duration: 0.4s; animation-fill-mode: forwards; animation-timing-function: ease; background-color: white; background-repeat: no-repeat; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; color: inherit; display: inline; font-size: inherit;\">elfa</span>\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;</span>\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">drawers are easily organized with</span>\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;</span>\n <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfLI&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" style=\"background-color: white; color: #1155cc;\" target=\"_blank\">fitted and divided clear trays</a>\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">, so I added them to the top two drawers to do just that. Very convenient! I am pretty sure the snack drawer was the homeowner's favorite, her reaction was priceless!</span>\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span> \n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vxz0pnqc3Hk/WrG5wmfjmWI/AAAAAAABMC8/6fUK74Rk5ZsH4k-GA9d3i4lAF5eG1KrZgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_24.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vxz0pnqc3Hk/WrG5wmfjmWI/AAAAAAABMC8/6fUK74Rk5ZsH4k-GA9d3i4lAF5eG1KrZgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_24.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <div style=\"background-color: white;\">\n  The next drawer was one of my personal favs, just because I love quick and easy entertaining that also feels a bit special. I always recommend putting together a small spot in your kitchen to store some basics such as napkins, candles, dishes, party decor, notecards, etc...\n </div>\n <div style=\"background-color: white;\">\n  <br />\n </div>\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ieSAGSZ-sPk/WrG5wuGJFlI/AAAAAAABMC0/K3eMrYCLjvkquogXAnD2puoYessqkBBrgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_25.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ieSAGSZ-sPk/WrG5wuGJFlI/AAAAAAABMC0/K3eMrYCLjvkquogXAnD2puoYessqkBBrgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_25.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />These slim drawers are also nicely sized for food storage bags and wraps.\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mltADjlObUs/WrG5xdMKAQI/AAAAAAABMC0/jvBBJjFCwpkhW5eVRhrHo1rWcK7deF3BwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_26.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mltADjlObUs/WrG5xdMKAQI/AAAAAAABMC0/jvBBJjFCwpkhW5eVRhrHo1rWcK7deF3BwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_26.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">While a deeper drawer conceals large bags of popcorn and chips.</span>\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RWUcpeDDKq4/WrG5x_SHznI/AAAAAAABMDA/yZc-NxUVcqo4utkyHoIS0Xkwv-Gz-sQGQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_28.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RWUcpeDDKq4/WrG5x_SHznI/AAAAAAABMDA/yZc-NxUVcqo4utkyHoIS0Xkwv-Gz-sQGQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_28.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />Last but not least, the bottom drawer now holds their produce, which was previously being stored in some buckets on the floor. I lined the drawer with a couple of basic bins to catch any juices or onion flaking.\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <i><b>Quick Tip:</b> Anytime I post about storing veggies, I do caution that keeping onions and potatoes together may increase their spoiling time. If you are only purchasing what you need for a week or two of meal planning, they are probably fine to be stored together (we have done this for years and never had any issues). But if you want to keep your potatoes for longer periods of time, they can be stored inside of an open box or paper bag in a cool, dark place (away from the onions).</i>\n <br />\n <br />Moving along...\n <br />\n <br />As I mentioned above, I also used a few bins as drawers; specifically, \n <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfVH&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">these small clear Linus Handled Bins</a> for a shorter shelf and my favorite \n <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~9NU6c&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">Multi-Use helpers</a> for some lighter weight cracker, snack, and pouch wrangling.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lQBkGCK1UPg/WrG5zqJDUfI/AAAAAAABMCs/wUI0UGCyd9oeVu3jX4agKAR2M3Lx-wR2gCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_8.2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"446\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lQBkGCK1UPg/WrG5zqJDUfI/AAAAAAABMCs/wUI0UGCyd9oeVu3jX4agKAR2M3Lx-wR2gCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_8.2.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />Previously, there was no finding anything on the back of that shorter shelf without moving a variety of items out of the way first, but now the bins easily bring the smaller items out of hiding.\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <i><b>Quick Tip:</b> Most often times product packaging and boxes can create added bulk in your pantry, and you may find that quickly removing the box and storing the contents in a bin or drawer will give you twice the space. I like to keep a small vessel of clips in our pantry so we can remove crackers and cereal from the boxes and clip them closed to keep them fresh between uses. There are times when boxes may actually Tetris stack nicely, but I encourage you to give it a try. You just may be surprised about the space you gain.</i>\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;S I X</span></b>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-U7AL0cbsvd0/WrG5zIppfmI/AAAAAAABMCk/9Wj3UBuOj4gFQH8G9ZVYdGNG5M1YI-dXQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_5.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-U7AL0cbsvd0/WrG5zIppfmI/AAAAAAABMCk/9Wj3UBuOj4gFQH8G9ZVYdGNG5M1YI-dXQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_5.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <br />Tier your storage and your shelves!\n <br />\n <br />In the initial plans, I included a shelf/tier of some sort for the back of the shelf that held all of their canisters and containers, but once we cleaned everything out, that wasn't exactly necessary. I still placed the taller items near the back, and the shorter items in front, but there was enough space left to create a path that would allow some easier access to all of the boxes and containers with little disruption to the setup.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Ac32tSJC76o/WrG5syWCbqI/AAAAAAABMCw/DAGTxQepuj4rv4mkqL0PmI3lbFphmI2awCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_17.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Ac32tSJC76o/WrG5syWCbqI/AAAAAAABMCw/DAGTxQepuj4rv4mkqL0PmI3lbFphmI2awCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_17.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <i><b><br /></b></i> \n <i><b>Quick Tip:</b> Place your everyday food and containers near the front, and store your overflow items near the back. In this case, extra boxes of cereal are placed behind the cereal containers, and extra boxes of grains and noodles were stored behind the pasta/rice section in another <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~9NU6c&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">Multi-Purpose bin</a>.</i>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TP8_pWi7bOM/WrG5sL3X8TI/AAAAAAABMCg/DD4VOL6kH3IWLyzFXDVThmIk7UZL1-epQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_16.2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"446\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TP8_pWi7bOM/WrG5sL3X8TI/AAAAAAABMCg/DD4VOL6kH3IWLyzFXDVThmIk7UZL1-epQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_16.2.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GzE6qC9cKLw/WrMhr3LYxtI/AAAAAAABMHY/cKu6xaRS0jIkytGH1Uy25jBogEbbuJWpACLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_14.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GzE6qC9cKLw/WrMhr3LYxtI/AAAAAAABMHY/cKu6xaRS0jIkytGH1Uy25jBogEbbuJWpACLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_14.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">This closet was installed with a few full-length shelves throughout, as well as a couple of shorter shelves that were set further back. I appreciated this so much because it added an additional row of storage without impacting the overall accessibility of the other items in the closet (especially when the drawer-like bins were added).</span>\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;S E V E N</span></b>\n <br />\n <br />Maximize that vertical space and use the door or walls of the closet.\n <br />\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">Although the door and walls are narrow, it doesn't mean some narrow baskets or shelves can't be added to increase the usable storage area. I initially considered spice racks on the recessed areas of the walls, but with all of the storage we were able to add to the door, we didn't end up needing the spice racks after all.</span>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6skseP285I0/WrG5p3rWqdI/AAAAAAABMDA/yCQk43OsbJkXyOCE099xLifv6OH3fmQPwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_10.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6skseP285I0/WrG5p3rWqdI/AAAAAAABMDA/yCQk43OsbJkXyOCE099xLifv6OH3fmQPwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_10.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />I have used the \n <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfV7&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">narrow elfa door rack</a> in our own home for storage in \n <a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/01/organized-linen-closet.html\" target=\"_blank\">our hallway closet</a>, I can't rave about the system enough. It is sturdy, versatile, easy to install, and won't do any damage to the actual door. Not to mention, the baskets come in a variety of sizes and can be mixed and matched to fit the space beautifully.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FTW07Nnl7S0/WrG5rPIS5SI/AAAAAAABMCk/Zbh4sR8Kx6USJ95AJRTg6j4jF4eba5hswCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_12.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FTW07Nnl7S0/WrG5rPIS5SI/AAAAAAABMCk/Zbh4sR8Kx6USJ95AJRTg6j4jF4eba5hswCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_12.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />The mesh baskets come in two widths (I went with the narrow), and a couple of different heights and depths. The shorter baskets can hold everything from cans to jars to small packets, while the deeper options are great for boxed foods, tall packages, and pouches.\n <br />\n <br />The organizer is mounted with two over/under the door hooks that are tightened into place. When the door is closed, the baskets live inside the door jam area, not at all intruding into the actual closet.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0pCLyI1qCEM/WrHPY7Q3LCI/AAAAAAABMDM/TPqy5pvYY6slcLyTBizX12ecIiEGME78wCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_13.2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"446\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0pCLyI1qCEM/WrHPY7Q3LCI/AAAAAAABMDM/TPqy5pvYY6slcLyTBizX12ecIiEGME78wCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_13.2.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <i><b><br /></b></i> \n <i><b>Quick Tip:</b> A few additional ideas for using these door baskets in a pantry could be for vitamins/medications, spice jars/packets, bottled water/drinks, cleaning supplies, meal planning supplies, and baking ingredients...&nbsp;</i>\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;E I G H T</span></b>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dU8fQ5Bipto/WrG5z5xesuI/AAAAAAABMCs/ZWo2GDeIYAoZVhv4VNt27ZDlttu8OOzoACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_9.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dU8fQ5Bipto/WrG5z5xesuI/AAAAAAABMCs/ZWo2GDeIYAoZVhv4VNt27ZDlttu8OOzoACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_9.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <div style=\"background-color: white;\">\n  A turntable is always a good idea. I especially love them in corner cabinets, but they can also make use of awkward nooks and open shelves in deeper pantries. They are known for corralling heavier jars and cans or categorizing cabinet contents, and a quick spin swiftly brings items from the back to the front. They are available in a variety of sizes and some are even&nbsp;\n  <span class=\"gmail-gr_ gmail-gr_24824 gmail-gr-alert gmail-gr_spell gmail-gr_inline_cards gmail-gr_run_anim gmail-ContextualSpelling gmail-ins-del\" id=\"gmail-24824\" style=\"animation-duration: 0.4s; animation-fill-mode: forwards; animation-timing-function: ease; background-repeat: no-repeat; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; color: inherit; display: inline; font-size: inherit;\">tiered</span>&nbsp;to make better use of available height. (Remember&nbsp;\n  <a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2017/06/before-after-organized-client-pantry.html\" style=\"color: #1155cc;\">this pantry project I worked on</a>? Turntables galore!)\n </div>\n <div style=\"background-color: white;\">\n  <br />\n </div>\n <div style=\"background-color: white;\">\n  <i>In this situation, a tiered shelf may have used the space a bit better due to the available height, and it is definitely an option to easily swap things out down the road if necessary.&nbsp;<a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfTG&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" style=\"color: #1155cc;\" target=\"_blank\">This lazy susan</a>&nbsp;can always be reused under the kitchen sink for cleaners, in the fridge for condiments or near the stove for oils, salt, pepper and cooking sauces.</i>\n </div>\n <div style=\"background-color: white;\">\n  <i><br /></i>\n </div>\n <br />\n <b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;N I N E</span></b>\n <br />\n <br />Categorize and store items based on how they are used.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wStffz5ongI/WrG5yrDVkPI/AAAAAAABMCg/bZFXy7b_yZs7ZvpfRVaOPIlJ-yYy2AgzACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wStffz5ongI/WrG5yrDVkPI/AAAAAAABMCg/bZFXy7b_yZs7ZvpfRVaOPIlJ-yYy2AgzACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_4.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />Originally we planned on storing small appliances up on the upper shelves, but thanks to this closet project, we were actually able to keep them in another location and save the homeowners from having to pull down heavy items from an upper shelf. That said, paper products now have plenty of room on the top shelf, as do some \n <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfJd&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">white stacking Nordic baskets</a> filled with disposable dishware and ingredients used for on-the-spot snack and treat making with the grandkids.\n <br />\n <br />The items stored on the upper shelf should generally be things that you have on hand for convenience or special occasions or larger items that you purchased in bulk at membership-only warehouse stores. Pulling out a stepstool to reach that upper shelf each day will become cumbersome over time and the goal is to streamline your daily processes.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4BTF-k5SanM/WrG5zHNGxoI/AAAAAAABMC0/hKQBzq0HsaYqjSk3bJ_DnqZfNgNHFQbigCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4BTF-k5SanM/WrG5zHNGxoI/AAAAAAABMC0/hKQBzq0HsaYqjSk3bJ_DnqZfNgNHFQbigCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_6.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">By placing some of the awkwardly shaped items into baskets, it visually cleared up the available space and made it much easier to bring it all down to the counter in one swooping motion.</span>\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span> \n <span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span> \n <i><b>Quick Tip:</b> Speaking of making things as easy as possible, stacking bins and baskets are absolutely fantastic. Buuuuut, they are not really a great option for everyday items and accessibility. Do you want to have to remove a basket just to open a lid and access another basket? No, you don't. Especially not on the daily as that would get old pretty quickly. Stacking baskets are really wonderful for maximizing height, I just recommend you think about how often you will need to get to the actual contents inside of the bins/baskets, and also consider using stacking options that have open fronts for the items used more frequently.</i>\n <br />\n <i><br /></i> \n <i><br /></i> \n <b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">T I P&nbsp; &nbsp;N U M B E R&nbsp; &nbsp;T E N</span></b>\n <br />\n <br />The last step I take in any organizing project is to label everything so everyone in the house can be on the same page and take part in keeping it somewhat tidy. And also so that concealed items are quickly identified and easy to locate.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xcu7tBVy2hw/WrG5uoY5L6I/AAAAAAABMC8/lo8M7FdB86Y9D4XNa0MlVHOy53OKUXMQgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_21.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xcu7tBVy2hw/WrG5uoY5L6I/AAAAAAABMC8/lo8M7FdB86Y9D4XNa0MlVHOy53OKUXMQgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_21.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />How much to label is always a debate, and there are times I have felt the need to label my kids' backpacks, pencils, foreheads, and toothbrushes. When there multiple small kids involved, everything is easily mixed and lost and confused. Also, getting the entire fam clan on board with putting things back where they belong, even in seemingly obvious situations, can be a bit of a challenge.\n <br />\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">So, while some people are strong Team Label people (I am right there with you),&nbsp;there are also times when it is necessary to pick your battles. For example, if you have clear containers and can see the contents, do you need to label them? Especially if it contains items that may change time and time again based on your meal planning and supply levels? Probably not. However, if you have clear containers and one has flour and one has powdered sugar and one has gluten-free&nbsp;flour and another has baking powder, labels are extremely helpful in identifying products that look the same but definitely are not. Labeling is also important in the pantry when allergies are involved.</span>\n <br />\n <br />In this closet, I labeled any bin or basket that was not clear or see-through, and nothing more (I used \n <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfTv&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">these label holders with the elfa drawers</a> and \n <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/~anfT4&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">these label holders on the white stacking baskets</a>). The small clear drawer-like bins can be used for a variety of snacks and mini-packages, the larger multi-purpose bins can hold a mixture of pouches and boxes, the airtight food canisters can store cereals and pasta as needed (while offering the owners a quick visual inventory of the contents), and the door baskets can serve endless functions as groceries rotate through week after week.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rmxC_NJPkH4/WrG5p2mebCI/AAAAAAABMDA/fpEIDgoHlYACrlbYhYqFc8LNJRwhroapQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rmxC_NJPkH4/WrG5p2mebCI/AAAAAAABMDA/fpEIDgoHlYACrlbYhYqFc8LNJRwhroapQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_1.jpg\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <br />\n <span style=\"background-color: white;\">One of my bonus tips is something I always recommend when working on these types of projects, and that is to leave a little white space. Life changes, needs evolve, and it is almost always inevitable that something won't be taken into consideration during the initial planning phase. Having extra space allows for some flexibility down the road, and also allows your space, and yourself, to breath a little easier. It is always good to maximize your space, yes, but you may find that with the right products and systems, that you actually have more space than you initially imagined. I loved walking away from this project confident that the homeowners will continue to have room to grow and play with this closet, and that their overall usable space more than doubled with the help of these particular tips.</span>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <span style=\"color: #999999;\">__________</span>\n </div>\n <br />How about a few before and after photos to see what a difference these changes made:\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-U_6VIWMmVms/WrHqyr2JKFI/AAAAAAABMDc/xdc0nnewSc8HqyRzUZW6bqNRYyToS08YgCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"473\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-U_6VIWMmVms/WrHqyr2JKFI/AAAAAAABMDc/xdc0nnewSc8HqyRzUZW6bqNRYyToS08YgCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_1.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Tj4PAZeLWFI/WrHqyk5Xj4I/AAAAAAABMDg/QX4_GvIFOKUmX4__o3SQNE-cVpPK0j9PwCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"473\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Tj4PAZeLWFI/WrHqyk5Xj4I/AAAAAAABMDg/QX4_GvIFOKUmX4__o3SQNE-cVpPK0j9PwCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_2.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />I love it so much that I sort of wish I could pick it up and transplant it into our own home! Never did I think I would say that about this type of closet or setup again. And if you adore it too, the majority of these tips should be simple to translate and work in your own pantry, even if you are a renter! The product is all very versatile and removable, right down to the peel-and-stick wallpaper.\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-F8wGtnDz7IM/WrHs8J_KlgI/AAAAAAABMGs/mxt_-6AP2tc4fTFva9dn1h00T6mUcZZGwCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"28\" data-original-width=\"500\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-F8wGtnDz7IM/WrHs8J_KlgI/AAAAAAABMGs/mxt_-6AP2tc4fTFva9dn1h00T6mUcZZGwCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <center> \n  <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3070475\">\n   <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? Many of the products shown in this post are on sale through April 1st, and you can save 25% off&nbsp;of so many great kitchen organizers and storage containers.&nbsp;</i>\n <br />\n <i><br /></i> \n <i>I can't thank <a href=\"https://rstyle.me/ad/g5b8bzb5y77&amp;cid=SM:blogger:pd:link:IHeartOrganizing\" target=\"_blank\">The Container Store</a> enough for partnering with me on this tremendously fun and functional pantry project. Although they provided a portion of the product, all ideas, thoughts, and tips are my own. blog.&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: &quot;roboto&quot; , &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: ization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn1@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-43-966_60a08bd06eabbb33.webp","https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0pCLyI1qCEM/WrHPY7Q3LCI/AAAAAAABMDM/TPqy5pvYY6slcLyTBizX12ecIiEGME78wCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_13.2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn82@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-47-239_4173d01829aec268.webp","https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dU8fQ5Bipto/WrG5z5xesuI/AAAAAAABMCs/ZWo2GDeIYAoZVhv4VNt27ZDlttu8OOzoACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn42@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-34-671_ea4493d1e2e25f71.webp","https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wStffz5ongI/WrG5yrDVkPI/AAAAAAABMCg/bZFXy7b_yZs7ZvpfRVaOPIlJ-yYy2AgzACEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-32-362_8ec876e5ac5ae2a6.webp","https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4BTF-k5SanM/WrG5zHNGxoI/AAAAAAABMC0/hKQBzq0HsaYqjSk3bJ_DnqZfNgNHFQbigCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn57@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-50-304_d789541fc30a0df8.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xcu7tBVy2hw/WrG5uoY5L6I/AAAAAAABMC8/lo8M7FdB86Y9D4XNa0MlVHOy53OKUXMQgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_21.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn30@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-31-613_c01e12ffdda6a767.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-U_6VIWMmVms/WrHqyr2JKFI/AAAAAAABMDc/xdc0nnewSc8HqyRzUZW6bqNRYyToS08YgCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn46@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-47-612_baf74b39e5723cde.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Tj4PAZeLWFI/WrHqyk5Xj4I/AAAAAAABMDg/QX4_GvIFOKUmX4__o3SQNE-cVpPK0j9PwCLcBGAs/s1600/Deep_Pantry_Organization_Tips_Maximize_IHeart_Organizing_Before_After_2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn22@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-42-219_005327d3a0b83cfd.webp","https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-F8wGtnDz7IM/WrHs8J_KlgI/AAAAAAABMGs/mxt_-6AP2tc4fTFva9dn1h00T6mUcZZGwCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn2@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-35-947_7b6e99e688207053.webp","http://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/495993f3c3f9f1a620d46e4202915221efb2d9c5/images/search/350.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn54@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-43-264_4daf697c176576d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228322},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Save Your Scents: How to Make the Most of Your Candles (and use them as storage!)","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/01/save-your-scents-how-to-make-most-of.html","description":"Candles are one of my favorite ways to add ambiance and warmth to our home. I really appreciate how they can change the entire mood of a space just through scent. What I don't love is wasting my candles, whether it be the wax or the actual vessel that it comes in.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_Header_zpswxqidwyw.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_Header_zpswxqidwyw.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />Over the years I have learned to look for candles that are not only delightful in scent, but also come in a pretty jar. The jars they come in can always be upcycled and used as vases or storage around the home. More on that in a minute...\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />And candles are not always cheap. I try to purchase the majority of my candles inexpensively (\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2Ulgtzx\" target=\"_blank\">Marshalls/HomeGoods/TJ Maxx</a>, \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2DzsFqB\" target=\"_blank\">Michaels</a>, \n<a href=\"https://www.tuesdaymorning.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Tuesday Morning</a>, and \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2UjF1sK\" target=\"_blank\">Target</a>), but some of my favorite scents are typically found at \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2DyU9g2\" target=\"_blank\">Anthropologie</a> and local boutiques. I don't mind paying a little more for a really great quality candle, but it is ridiculously frustrating when the wick burns down before all of the wax is used. I might be doing something wrong, but so often the wick will be out and 1/3 of the candle wax is still in the jar!\n<br />\n<br />All of the wax has to come out from the jar before it can be reused. I have tried a few methods to remove the wax over the years and recently heard that freezing the candle was a really quick and easy way to do this. So I gave it a try...\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_15_zpscp5aouan.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"How to remove candle wax from vessel through freezing\" border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_15_zpscp5aouan.png\" data-original-height=\"702\" data-original-width=\"585\" title=\"Freeze Candle Wax\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />It actually worked pretty well! I left a candle in the freezer overnight and just chipped the wax out with a spoon. But look at all that wax! That seems like a lot of waste!\n<br />\n<br />So I went back to the method that I have typically used in the past, which is to heat the candle up on the stove in a pot of water. The water doesn't have to be boiling hot, just warm enough to melt all of the wax within the holder to a liquid (I remove the&nbsp;wick prior to warming up the wax on the stove, but it can be done after as well).\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_16_zpswdnqmyip.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"How to remove candle wax from vessel through melting on the stove\" border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_16_zpswdnqmyip.png\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" title=\"Melt Candle Wax\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Now to save that wax! I recently had four candles leftover from Christmas and quickly realized that there was a lot of wax remaining in each of the containers once the wick burned down completely. I use to just pour the hot wax into the trash and reuse the container... but I decided to come up with a way to stretch that wax out going forward.\n<br />\n<br />Years ago I had a plug-in warmer that would heat wax as an alternative to lighting candles. They were all the rage back then, and I remember having packs of wax molds in different scents stocked in our junk drawer. So off to the craft store I went in search of some sort of mold. In the baking aisle I came across a plethora of silicone options which are typically used for candies and small treats. PERFECT!\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>(Don't forget that most craft stores offer great coupons/discounts on a single item purchase!)</i>\n<br />\n<br />Now, when I melt the candle wax, I just pour it into \n<a href=\"https://www.joann.com/wilton-easy-flex-silicone-bite-size-daisy-molds/8633752.html\" target=\"_blank\">my special mold</a>! Below you can see how many wax melts I was able to create from four burned down candles. I can't get over how much wax I was able to save! \n<i>(<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2TgcpQS\" target=\"_blank\">Similar mold can also be found on Amazon here.</a>)</i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_17_zpsaepc1smf.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_17_zpsaepc1smf.png\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />It only takes a few minutes for the wax to naturally harden back up, and then they just pop right out of the silicone.\n<br />\n<br />\n<i><b>Quick Tip:</b> Pouring the wax out of the different candle holders can be a little messy, I recommend placing wax or parchment paper under the mold to catch any drips. Also, the candle holders can be really hot from the melting process, so use caution!! I found wearing a winter glove gave me control to pour without burning my fingers.</i>\n<br />\n<br />Right after the wax is poured, I grab a paper towel to clean out the rest of the contents of the jar and quickly wash with hot water and dish soap.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />The different candles were a variety of scents so I store the wax molds seperately in canning jars, back into their original vessel, or in&nbsp;\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2UhzG4Z\" target=\"_blank\">these wax sandwich pouches</a>&nbsp;until I am ready to melt them in the warmer.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_10_zpsrzdmt1cw.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_10_zpsrzdmt1cw.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I noticed that they still sell plug-in candle/wax warmers at many home and craft stores, although, I prefer something a bit more discreet and mobile, so I just use a basic&nbsp;\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2DA71CG\" target=\"_blank\">butter warmer</a> for now. It was less expensive and I can move it around my home without plugging it in. It may seem like a bit of an odd choice, but I sort of love it. And YAY for extending the life of my favorite candles scents, I can't believe I was going to dump all of that wax away!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_08_zps9p1301rl.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"734\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_08_zps9p1301rl.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_03_zpsfejltffl.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_03_zpsfejltffl.jpg\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Now that the wax is out of the holders, here are a variety of ways to reuse all of those pretty vessels around the house.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_01_zps9ouyulu7.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_01_zps9ouyulu7.png\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Above I placed two on our bookshelves! One is working as a vase while the other tucks away a dice game that our family enjoys playing.\n<br />\n<br />\n<i><b>Quick Tip:</b> <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2DxGN3B\" target=\"_blank\">This gold hammered candle</a> is a true bargain, especially considering the container itself is so fantastic (especially if you line the bottom with a piece of felt).&nbsp;</i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_02_zpsf3udpckn.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_02_zpsf3udpckn.png\" data-original-height=\"686\" data-original-width=\"585\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I find candle holders are most useful in the bathroom. Above you can see one being used for holding cotton swabs, but they also work as toothbrush holders, floss pick holders, hairbrush and comb holders, etc...\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_11_zpsobemlev9.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_11_zpsobemlev9.png\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Another bathroom scenario, hair ties and bobby pins are hidden away while keeping the nearby counter clutter free!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_12_zpsfp44mbag.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"600\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_12_zpsfp44mbag.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />One of the first candle holders that I ever upcycled was used for makeup brushes, and they were the perfect match!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_04_zpswch8vocf.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_04_zpswch8vocf.png\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Let's talk office supply storage for a second! Candle vessels are perfect for corralling paperclips, rubber bands, washi tape, small craft supplies, pushpins, charger cords... The possibilities are pretty endless.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_06_zps7ukband0.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_06_zps7ukband0.png\" data-original-height=\"442\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />It is always a bonus when the holder has a nice lid to really hide the contents and to act as a true container.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_14_zpsqpccn6af.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_14_zpsqpccn6af.png\" data-original-height=\"500\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />In the bedroom on a nightstand or dresser, candle jars are wonderful as a change jar or jewelry holder. Or toss your lip balm, medication, hand lotion, earplugs, etc... inside and keep your bedside table nice and tidy.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-wDqp7BUY_7g/XEt_nlMQoMI/AAAAAAABNpI/R8ryodBW13ALhGynKdpmePQ3SS6XFjlFwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_13.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-wDqp7BUY_7g/XEt_nlMQoMI/AAAAAAABNpI/R8ryodBW13ALhGynKdpmePQ3SS6XFjlFwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_13.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />How about in the laundry room? They work well to keep track of pocket treasures, clothespins, safety pins, and buttons.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\">__________</span>\n</div>\n<br />That's how I use these charming candle vessels around our home, but I bet you all could come up with even more creative examples. I know that this isn't a new fad, but it's always a great reminder to upcycle and reuse when we can.\n<br />\n<br />One last quick thing! I recently found&nbsp;\n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2S6q7IN\" target=\"_blank\">these candle warmers</a>, but can't personally speak to how well they work. I imagine that they actually melt the wax of a candle more evenly and allow you to use the entire candle without lighting the wick at all (or needing to make molds). That would definitely be another great way to get the most of the candle before reusing the jar. Just wanted to try and offer up all of the options I can find.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<i>And it goes without saying but I will anyway, it is always important to be careful with candles in general. Both plug-in options and the use of any flame should always remain monitored.&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: &quot;roboto&quot; , &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\">♥</span></i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 26 Jan 2019 01:33:00
