"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_02_zpsf3udpckn.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn58@2020_3/2020/08/24/22-30-46-311_1478500b485743ee.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_11_zpsobemlev9.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn54@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-48-740_b30fd09773b294e3.webp","https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_12_zpsfp44mbag.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn54@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-47-076_8fccb669dc76fb5f.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_04_zpswch8vocf.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-35-101_ec9b4dfeff9e65ed.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_06_zps7ukband0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn97@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-37-807_a86b95dc14d1696f.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Candles/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_14_zpsqpccn6af.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn74@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-41-170_ae5e4a200a93f9b0.webp","https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-wDqp7BUY_7g/XEt_nlMQoMI/AAAAAAABNpI/R8ryodBW13ALhGynKdpmePQ3SS6XFjlFwCEwYBhgL/s1600/Candle_Jar_Upcycle_Storage_IHeart_Organizing_13.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn6@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-48-053_68615973902a02e6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228319},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Let's Chat! School Lunches and a Free Printable!","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/09/lets-chat-school-lunches-and-free.html","description":"We are officially a couple of weeks into the new school season, and with that, all of us are re-finding our&nbsp;routines and putting a few systems into place that correlate&nbsp;with this busy season of life.\n<br />\n<br />This year I have a senior in high school (!), a freshman, and a 6th grader. By now, we have done the back-to-school organizing and routine changes quite a&nbsp;few times, and most things continue to get easier and easier. \n<i>LOVE</i> that! And over the years, I have shared quite a few of the things we do to prep, but this year I realized I haven't really posted about school lunches. So today is the day because they are a huge part of our daily life!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_Header_zpsywdqnk2w.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_Header_zpsywdqnk2w.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />A few things I want to mention right off of the bat; lunch and food is a personal parenting decision that I never judge and hope that we can definitely keep this conversation helpful and encouraging. There have been times that I have felt bad that I wasn't making bear&nbsp;shaped sandwiches for my boys, and I definitely have my kids eat school-prepared lunches as well. That \n<i>shouldn't</i> make me feel bad and I know that now. We all do the best we can for our kids, period. I know that some people truly enjoy making art out of food, that some kids are vegetarian,&nbsp;have food allergies, only eat organic, or don't do sugar. This post isn't about that, it's just a few really quick and simple tips for how I handle the lunch prep/making process around here. So let's dive in.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-oO5rPEFqPwk/XD-V-Ze2U5I/AAAAAAABNk0/H7AUFs6bmEEMB1NsO2fxaYqnVDJZj-F-QCLcBGAs/s1600/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_13.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"514\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-oO5rPEFqPwk/XD-V-Ze2U5I/AAAAAAABNk0/H7AUFs6bmEEMB1NsO2fxaYqnVDJZj-F-QCLcBGAs/s1600/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_13.2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #da602f;\">TIP #1</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />The first thing I did this year is sit down with my boys and figure out what each of them enjoys most. My biggest problems leading into this year have been over-purchasing foods, trying to over-cater to their specific taste buds, then ending up in a hamster wheel of packing the same things on repeat with very little variety.\n<br />\n<br />So, I sat with the boys and asked them what their favorite foods are, and wrote down all of the items that they could all agree on. We took some time to look for quick ideas online together to come up with 15-20 different lunch options as well as a variety of quick and tasty sides.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_04.6_zpsgxih2lwu.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_04.6_zpsgxih2lwu.png\" data-original-height=\"507\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />You know me, I couldn't miss an opportunity to whip up a free printable for you all, and I am SO glad I did. I made it editable so that we could type in all of our lunch ideas (which are broken down into categories: main course, fruits/veggies, sides/desserts), and then print it off and keep it inside of our pantry with our shopping/meal planning items. You can also just save it filled in digitally and access it from your phone or computer.\n<br />\n<br />\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n <tbody>\n  <tr>\n   <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-E8vfkzjg3_8/W6MFnq4qiEI/AAAAAAABNGE/1z_hiYG5cnEedNhopkhOBAju8qzrI_cxwCLcBGAs/s1600/School_Lunch_Printable_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"464\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-E8vfkzjg3_8/W6MFnq4qiEI/AAAAAAABNGE/1z_hiYG5cnEedNhopkhOBAju8qzrI_cxwCLcBGAs/s1600/School_Lunch_Printable_2.png\" /></a></td>\n  </tr>\n  <tr>\n   <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/ayadmqd81q7i9ud4hc4x2lwz4zc0bsmd\" target=\"_blank\">CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD THE FREE &amp; FILLABLE SCHOOL LUNCH PLANNING PRINTABLE</a></td>\n  </tr>\n </tbody>\n</table>\n<br />\n<br />\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n <tbody>\n  <tr>\n   <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cClyCnYpCIk/W6MFnM_pSlI/AAAAAAABNGY/zbtog07yMicQMm0S9Kp-ZH6yefK77MmfgCEwYBhgL/s1600/School_Lunch_Printable.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"464\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cClyCnYpCIk/W6MFnM_pSlI/AAAAAAABNGY/zbtog07yMicQMm0S9Kp-ZH6yefK77MmfgCEwYBhgL/s1600/School_Lunch_Printable.png\" /></a></td>\n  </tr>\n  <tr>\n   <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/uqw1mf0sir22yjg90ienr9ntgm3f50p7\" style=\"font-size: 12.8px;\" target=\"_blank\">CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD THE FREE &amp; FILLABLE SCHOOL LUNCH PLANNING PRINTABLE</a></td>\n  </tr>\n </tbody>\n</table>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />\n<br />Now when I am grocery shopping/meal planning for the week, I can glance at their list and be sure to stock up accordingly. This list has items they will all eat, so I can now quickly put together lunch ideas without over purchasing food while offering some variety from week to week.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #da602f;\">TIP #2</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />Keep it simple! One of the primary&nbsp;goals is to be speedy about lunch making. Whether in the morning or the night before, I don't want to have to invest much time in putting&nbsp;everything together. And really, the best case scenario is that I give the boys the tools they need to be able to do everything themselves.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_12_zpsjfgcfwaj.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_12_zpsjfgcfwaj.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />So, that might mean giving into some pre-packaged items or creating my own quick snack packs that we can all just grab-n-go. Typically I portion off crackers, popcorn, fruits, veggies, protein bites, etc... Whenever I can, I select fruits and veggies that I know I will get the longest life from (I have found that grapes, carrots, celery, cucumbers, pea pods, oranges, peppers, melon, and apples will typically stay fresh throughout the course of the week without concern of spoiling, and are easy to portion out). \n<b>This is HUGELY important and probably my biggest tip.</b>\n<br />\n<br />I will also purchase individual meat snacks, cheeses, nuts, yogurts, granola, etc... if the price is right for the time I am willing to invest. If I have more time on a given week, I might opt to purchase in bulk and create those portions myself.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #da602f;\">TIP #3</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />OK, so basically the first step was to select the simple sides that can easily be tossed into a lunch, and next, I like&nbsp;to do a little prep. Again, I am putting groceries away anyway, why not just put them away in individual grab-n-go packages to make the entire week go smoother?\n<br />\n<br />Aside from the fast fruits and veggies mentioned above, we all really love berries as well. So, while putting groceries away and doing my weekly meal prep I will soak/rinse them in a bowl of water and vinegar for a couple of minutes. They seem to last longest if I do a quick soak and then let them air dry before refrigerating. This is one more step, but if I&nbsp;multitask&nbsp;during other meal prep, then it isn't too bad and I know I will prolong the freshness for a few extra days. I do this with all berries, not just strawberries.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_05_zpsvlokymgl.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_05_zpsvlokymgl.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Also fresh from the grocery store, I will cook up chicken to create grilled chicken strips that I will put in wraps, tacos, on salad, etc... And every couple of weeks I will freeze sandwiches in a few varieties in bulk.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_06_zpsthzrrovc.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_06_zpsthzrrovc.png\" data-original-height=\"436\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I recently switched to \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2p3n2ce\" target=\"_blank\">these wax paper bags</a> because they are compostable and keep the sandwiches fresh in the freezer. I will make a few loaves of bread worth of sandwiches at a time (I will also use rolls/croissants with meats/cheeses, etc...) and I find they work best if I don't use spreads other than peanut butter and jelly directly on the bread. I will put together a few sandwich varieties to select from, and just label the sandwich type on the wax paper bag.\n<br />\n<br />The bulk sandwiches go into freezer zipper bags (which I just keep reusing) and into the freezer until a school morning when they are transferred directly to the lunchbox and they are ready to eat by lunch.\n<br />\n<br />All of the pre-prepped snacks and sides are put together in a section of the fridge that the boy's love to grab from.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_02.5%20copy_zpswtylsi6s.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_02.5%20copy_zpswtylsi6s.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_02.4%20copy_zpsfafpoqoc.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_02.4%20copy_zpsfafpoqoc.png\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #da602f;\">TIP #4</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />If you have the space for it, I recommend storing all lunch related containers together. That way everything is quick and easy to pick from during the lunch making sessions.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_03_zpsejdqapbp.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_03_zpsejdqapbp.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />We have a nice deep drawer in our pantry and it holds all of the lunch boxes/bags, containers, water bottles, thermos, reusable bags, etc.... It has become a pretty popular drawer!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #da602f;\">TIP #5</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />Tip five isn't as much of a tip as it is just some of our favorite lunch products.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mlDBVcSXk3s/WyqSq_SXvGI/AAAAAAABM1g/titwzQEk7XwvJ9Yskkgd4Z2irwz0U-QSgCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"28\" data-original-width=\"500\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mlDBVcSXk3s/WyqSq_SXvGI/AAAAAAABM1g/titwzQEk7XwvJ9Yskkgd4Z2irwz0U-QSgCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<center> \n <div class=\"boutique-widget\" data-widget-id=\"751396\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? 'http' : 'https';if(!d.getElementById(id)) {e = d.createElement(s);e.id = id;e.src = p + '://' + 'widgets.rewardstyle.com' + '/js/boutique.js';d.body.appendChild(e);}if(typeof window.__boutique === 'object') if(d.readyState === 'complete') {window.__boutique.init();}}(document, 'script', 'boutique-script');</script>\n  <br />\n  <div class=\"rs-adblock\">\n   <img onerror=\"this.parentNode.innerHTML='Disable your ad blocking software to view this content.'\" src=\"http://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/3e74e522264e075112a228d54d41f19611e1eb60/images/search/350.gif\" style=\"height: 15px; width: 15px;\" />\n   <noscript>\n    JavaScript is currently disabled in this browser. Reactivate it to view this content.\n   </noscript>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</center>\n<br />\n<br />We have done bento-type containers and boxes in the past, but now that the boys are bigger, they have outgrown many of those. We prefer containers that will hold a full-size sandwich or wrap without having to turn it into bite-sized finger food.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_09_zpsdovdbug4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_09_zpsdovdbug4.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2NEQtfn\" target=\"_blank\">These sandwich boxes</a> are our new favorite and I appreciate that they are dishwasher safe! They can hold the main course as well as two adequately sized side items. They are also really handy for sending snacks to school to get the boys by between classes and their extracurricular activities.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_11_zpslp6psfgg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_11_zpslp6psfgg.png\" data-original-height=\"459\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />With all of the fruits/veggies/sides, and my quest to eliminate our use of plastic sandwich bags, I invested in some reusable options and so far I have been really happy with them.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_07_zpsei7el6wh.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_07_zpsei7el6wh.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I went with both \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2xbKaJ6\" target=\"_blank\">the snack</a> and \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2xdFWRw\" target=\"_blank\">sandwich sizes</a> and they are great for keeping a variety of snacks ready to go and fresh in the fridge, and the rest stay on hand for the dry goods. They can be washed in the dishwasher, but I usually just wash them out with \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2xqAiwl\" target=\"_blank\">this dish brush</a> in an attempt to prolong their number of uses even more.\n<br />\n<br />Above you can also see \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2xCXuH0\" target=\"_blank\">the containers</a> I am smitten with for dressings and condiments. They are typically used for baby food storage, but they are completely leak proof and durable and reusable so we give them major thumbs up for lunch boxes.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_08_zpsundaxs7v.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_08_zpsundaxs7v.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2pmAyYA\" target=\"_blank\">An insulated food jar</a> is also high on our list because it allows us to really expand on what we send to school. We can quickly heat up items in the morning, pop them in the insulated Thermos and everything stays nice and warm until lunchtime (think leftovers, rice, pasta, soup, etc...).\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_10_zpsz56zc4ud.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_10_zpsz56zc4ud.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />An insulated Thermos can also keep items cold, but we don't find ourselves using it for that purpose as often (but love that we can if we would like to). We do have \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2plVsXR\" target=\"_blank\">these ice packs</a> on constant rotation to help with keeping items fresh and cool for the few hours they are packed up.\n<br />\n<br />As you can see in the lunch drawer above, we also have a few airtight snap containers that work well for bulkier items and salads (\n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2xASOBm\" target=\"_blank\">similar</a>). In general, I looked for containers and products that can be reused, are durable, and are dishwasher safe, all of which keep our day-to-day process running quickly and smoothly.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_01_zpsqawrs39e.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_01_zpsqawrs39e.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />Finally, \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2x9tnq4\" target=\"_blank\">these fridge bins</a>&nbsp;(\n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2xy1sAt\" target=\"_blank\">similar</a>) rank so high on our list, they are wonderful for corralling all of the individual servings of our lunch and snack sides and act like a deep drawer in the fridge.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wN9-Y90QUMA/W3IAMV37qmI/AAAAAAABM_U/02fEJNW-foEFHUMuRCudGOmrlBp7yHx_gCLcBGAs/s1600/Swash.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"20\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wN9-Y90QUMA/W3IAMV37qmI/AAAAAAABM_U/02fEJNW-foEFHUMuRCudGOmrlBp7yHx_gCLcBGAs/s1600/Swash.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />If you are looking for a couple of easy peasy ideas, here are the lunches we currently have on our list that all of our boys are willing to eat and are pretty simple to assemble or prep at the beginning of the week:\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #a0d3c8;\">M A I N&nbsp; C O U R S E S</span></b>\n<br />\n<br />Grilled Chicken, Ham &amp; Cheese Croissant, Hard Boiled Eggs, Turkey Apple Sausage, Pepperoni/Cheese/Tomatoes, Soup &amp; Crackers, Lunch Meat Wrap, Pasta Salad, Quesadilla, Peanut Butter &amp; Jelly, Chicken Taco, Spaghetti/Pasta, Sub Sandwich, Salad, BLT Pita Pocket, Bagel Sandwich, Rice Cake w/Peanut Butter\n<br />\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #0090a1;\">F R U I T S / V E G G I E S</span>&nbsp;</b>\n<br />\n<br />Pickles, Clementines, Grapes, Peppers, Applesauce, Melon, Peaches, Pears, Apple Slices, Strawberries, Raspberries/Blackberries, Carrots, Pea Pods, Celery, Cucumbers, Bananas, Side Salad\n<br />\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: #0b3977;\">S I D E S</span>&nbsp;</b>\n<br />\n<br />Almonds/Nuts, Cheese Sticks, Pretzels, Peanut/Almond Butters, Crackers, Yogurt, Rice, Taco Chips w/Salsa or Guacamole, Pita Chips, Veggie Straws, Granola, Cottage Cheese, Fruit Strips/Snacks, Popcorn, Cookies, Trail Mix, Beef Sticks\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_13.3_zps9c0yeht8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_13.3_zps9c0yeht8.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i>And because you all educate me just as much as I try to share what is working for us, I would love to hear more lunch ideas that are a hit in your households. It could be a quick meal, a quick tip, a favorite product, a helpful website/app, anything! School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_07_zpsei7el6wh.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn22@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-31-664_28bdbd3247aca610.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_08_zpsundaxs7v.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-36-234_334a7b84ae7abdd3.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_10_zpsz56zc4ud.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn25@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-46-967_a14b78faebfaae1d.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_01_zpsqawrs39e.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn70@2020_6/2020/08/24/22-30-49-855_4925fa8cb84175d3.webp","https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wN9-Y90QUMA/W3IAMV37qmI/AAAAAAABM_U/02fEJNW-foEFHUMuRCudGOmrlBp7yHx_gCLcBGAs/s1600/Swash.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn62@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-47-020_2f57f47bcd2fdb25.webp","http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/School%20Lunches/Organized_Fridge_School_Lunches_Snacks_IHeart_Organizing_13.3_zps9c0yeht8.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn21@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-30-34-893_dd6619b23289d5a5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228320},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"Our Laundry Room Today","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/09/our-laundry-room-today.html","description":"First, I want to thank you for all of the great feedback on the \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/08/before-after-organized-nightstand-drawer.html\" target=\"_blank\">sweet and simple nightstand drawer before | after post</a>. I am excited that those smaller projects are just as fun for you as they are for me! I have a few more small scale organizing projects up my sleeves that I can't wait to tackle and share.\n<br />\n<br />Today, I wanted to give you an update on our laundry room!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0xZas8EoEyo/XYporZy5KPI/AAAAAAABOxI/_UuksD6BJwsJw4ZXfAdqFyc5CRvJuZsQACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0xZas8EoEyo/XYporZy5KPI/AAAAAAABOxI/_UuksD6BJwsJw4ZXfAdqFyc5CRvJuZsQACNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_8.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2017/02/laundry-room-check-in-tile-and.html\" target=\"_blank\">In my last laundry room update</a> a few years ago, I excitedly shared a peel-and-stick wallpaper that I had just installed. Shortly after that, a funny thing happened. I was so in love with it when I found it, but then I became stuck. I attempted to source finishing touches for the room and it all seemed to compete with the paper. Just because I loved the colors and design of the wallpaper, doesn't mean it was right.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-54N0RxkL0O8/XX-_ezjc0XI/AAAAAAABOsM/y3XgsFpF5WYzVX6b3RJZ7DfXdopiaIYOgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Save_Peel_Stick_Wallpaper.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"How to Save Peel and Stick Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"780\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-54N0RxkL0O8/XX-_ezjc0XI/AAAAAAABOsM/y3XgsFpF5WYzVX6b3RJZ7DfXdopiaIYOgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Save_Peel_Stick_Wallpaper.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />But I waited on it. I lived with it for awhile and really tried to make it work and be sure I wasn't acting impulsively. I felt that guilt we all do when we invest in something and don't want to be wasteful. I refused to remove the paper until I could find a way to save it to reuse or pass on. Peel-and-stick paper usually comes packaged on a glossy paper backing, and after some digging, I found \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/31kUaxL\" target=\"_blank\">a wide freezer paper that is plastic coated</a>. Turns out the freezer paper is the perfect way to take down the adhesive paper from the wall, roll it up, and save it to be reused in another way. In fact, our laundry room paper has already been repurposed in my niece's bedroom lining a bookcase and we all couldn't be happier about that.\n<br />\n<br />So with that, let's look at where our laundry room is today. It has truly become a room that I look forward to going to and gives me this warm and fuzzy happy feeling.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cpPOHS_-6Us/XX-_VxJPqYI/AAAAAAABOr8/vtTW-SUHCu042b5o3BgxCQgGI-eRqj9qwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cpPOHS_-6Us/XX-_VxJPqYI/AAAAAAABOr8/vtTW-SUHCu042b5o3BgxCQgGI-eRqj9qwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_2.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>After some searching, I came across a Farrow and Ball Lotus wallpaper on \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2ZYApyv\" target=\"_blank\">eBay</a> for a \n<i>really</i> great price. Two full rolls for $100 less than the typical cost of one single roll. And being that I was only doing one wall, two rolls would be plenty. I pulled the trigger because it just felt so much more in line with my ultimate vision for the room. The last paper was colorful with an extremely busy pattern. I still wanted pattern and color but now knew that a tonal option would probably give me a similar effect without overwhelming me this time. It would still offer visual interest, but wouldn't compete with all of the other elements in the room.\n<br />\n<br />We installed the new wallpaper about five months ago now and I still get butterflies every time I walk into the room. It feels so much more refined and timeless while still offering something interesting and beautiful. \n<i>(We followed this wallpaper installation tutorial <a href=\"https://youtu.be/aU-SIDFlFGc\" target=\"_blank\">here</a>.)</i>\n<br />\n<br />After that, things very slowly started to fall into place. And although the rest of the changes we made were not big ones, they were still impactful.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ez8CPe0KqAg/XYAAzlBbbvI/AAAAAAABOvE/cfoZuiWNNFo0KK6q-BkAh5oayggZuFBrgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_9.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ez8CPe0KqAg/XYAAzlBbbvI/AAAAAAABOvE/cfoZuiWNNFo0KK6q-BkAh5oayggZuFBrgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_9.2.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />For example, I realized that the open glass doors of the paint cabinet were visually competing with the open glass cabinet doors over the sink. Having multiple door styles in the room really created a weird imbalance, especially because the space is small and windowless. I initially tried to add a frosting to the inside of the glass, which helped, but eventually just primed and painted them so that the cabinet could just sort of fade away and hide the clutter behind the doors (I wouldn't normally do something like that on a nice piece of furniture, but \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2014/10/diy-storage-cabinet.html\" target=\"_blank\">this cabinet was DIY'd by us years ago</a> and serves the purpose of storing all of our paint supplies, so it was a nice fast fix in this instance). There is a lot of white in this space which is good being that there are no windows, but I have been keeping my eyes open at thrift stores and on FB Marketplace for an interesting old cabinet to bring in another layer of character.\n<br />\n<br />When we first \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2014/02/built-in-laundry-sortingfolding-station.html\" target=\"_blank\">DIY'd our built-in wall</a>, we partnered with Home Depot to come up with some custom storage for our laundry room. We have never stopped loving the storage that the entire wall offers; we use it for cleaning supplies, beach gear, seasonal items, sewing supplies, laundry hanging, and now even for feeding our pups. We modified it a while back to \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/05/laundry-room-update-built-in-wshiplap.html\" target=\"_blank\">add some decorative shiplap backing</a>&nbsp;and laundry baskets, which gave it a fresher look. Five plus years in it had become clear that we could have initially used a better method for making the cabinet doors. The doors we originally constructed were quite heavy, built from MDF, hung with external hinges, and weren't perfectly square. So this summer we built all new doors!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--4kg3yARvHw/XX-_Teb4BTI/AAAAAAABOr0/d_CFF5jXyF4YQMLYgVi1YYjYjjAFUs2fQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_11.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--4kg3yARvHw/XX-_Teb4BTI/AAAAAAABOr0/d_CFF5jXyF4YQMLYgVi1YYjYjjAFUs2fQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_11.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />The new doors are infinitely better. They cleaned up the look of our built-in and the panels are now truly inset (I plan to share how we built&nbsp;them soon). We also installed concealed hinges which makes such a wonderful difference. At that same time, the entire unit received a fresh coat of paint, trim, caulk, a new acrylic hanging rod, and a built-in feeding station. Yes, yes, and yes!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hmXyQoQPu5M/XX-_UDqinUI/AAAAAAABOr0/H3gM0GXeS-kSbH54eBVeuFBrEJ2TjqLtQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_15.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hmXyQoQPu5M/XX-_UDqinUI/AAAAAAABOr0/H3gM0GXeS-kSbH54eBVeuFBrEJ2TjqLtQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_15.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Isn't that hanging rod lovely? I have been so inspired by my friends \n<a href=\"http://www.astoriedstyle.com/?s=acrylic\" target=\"_blank\">Grace from A Storied Style</a> and \n<a href=\"https://huntedinterior.com/?s=acrylic\" target=\"_blank\">Kristin from The Hunted Interior</a>, and their use of acrylic for hanging rods, handles, window hardware, etc.., that I had to find a place to do the same. I found \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/301unhy\" target=\"_blank\">an inexpensive piece of acrylic on Amazon</a>, as well as \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2ZZLdxf\" target=\"_blank\">the mounting hardware</a>. We added three total brackets to be sure the rod could hold the weight of our clothes, and so far so great!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZpqROdgHEbc/XX-_Yqg5MvI/AAAAAAABOsM/RuaxYm4m5_YIPr1ARvMuCDYxUfrttZq9wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_28.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZpqROdgHEbc/XX-_Yqg5MvI/AAAAAAABOsM/RuaxYm4m5_YIPr1ARvMuCDYxUfrttZq9wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_28.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The counter is a piece of butcher block that is extremely solid and ties to the floating shelf above the washer and dryer.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-56Dw5bO1OV4/XX-_a1kyoOI/AAAAAAABOr4/xSc_2k2_-gMCKz4kC8o87vmUi2oxXrk7wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_35.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-56Dw5bO1OV4/XX-_a1kyoOI/AAAAAAABOr4/xSc_2k2_-gMCKz4kC8o87vmUi2oxXrk7wCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_35.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />For the pup feeding area, we researched the best eating height for our dogs and installed a pull-out shelf that we cut to insert their bowl inside (we used a basic white laminate shelf paired with \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/302ePJn\" target=\"_blank\">these drawer slides</a>). The bowl is just floating in there so it can easily be removed and washed at the nearby sink after feedings.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hxrWb49NFCc/XX-_bVElzGI/AAAAAAABOsA/dnVFT_XH2iY-3h3QlXrBxaccstLwaacAQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_36.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hxrWb49NFCc/XX-_bVElzGI/AAAAAAABOsA/dnVFT_XH2iY-3h3QlXrBxaccstLwaacAQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_36.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Originally I wanted to store their food in the drawer below, but pet food really should be stored in its original packaging, or an airtight container that can be easily cleaned between refilling. So now the drawer just holds all of their supplies, which also works out really great! Their food is sealed in a rolling bin in the tall cleaning cabinet.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o36pviDKayE/XX-_VDnysjI/AAAAAAABOsI/CaImPD_zg601D5B7VzsPE23SPpvqdCLdACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_17.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o36pviDKayE/XX-_VDnysjI/AAAAAAABOsI/CaImPD_zg601D5B7VzsPE23SPpvqdCLdACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_17.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The wire baskets continue to function really well for our family. We use them when the clothes come out of the dryer to bring the folded/hanging clothes back to our rooms to be put away. The larger woven basket is for linens for delicate wash items.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-K9tFiwMqXzQ/XX-_VtYGFOI/AAAAAAABOsE/wOlWcd-ZWwkgiz1Ncn9Y9uqimpIcrYzQQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_19.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-K9tFiwMqXzQ/XX-_VtYGFOI/AAAAAAABOsE/wOlWcd-ZWwkgiz1Ncn9Y9uqimpIcrYzQQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_19.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />As we continue around the room, I added a pair of \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2ZUMF3a\" target=\"_blank\">really pretty brass hooks</a> to hold towels and beach/summer gear. I use hand towels all over this room for cleaning the feeding area, drying the bowls after washings, wiping down the washer door, and of course for general hand drying. Multiple hooks are a must!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-h40gBn_3_9c/XX-_ZSzsx_I/AAAAAAABOsM/qSID5RLjP0A7EnKD19zSR8iB0OeWRd6RwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_30.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-h40gBn_3_9c/XX-_ZSzsx_I/AAAAAAABOsM/qSID5RLjP0A7EnKD19zSR8iB0OeWRd6RwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_30.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The art above the hooks is \n<a href=\"https://juniperprintshop.com/products/riverside-1\" target=\"_blank\">a print from Juniper print shop</a>; the colors are so great and it reminds me of many scenic drives that we have taken over the years.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4TuDnh5aJEA/XX-_We06_uI/AAAAAAABOsA/PkIO682Xv7UXjF4NcAivbpsiATyojCwbQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_20.png\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4TuDnh5aJEA/XX-_We06_uI/AAAAAAABOsA/PkIO682Xv7UXjF4NcAivbpsiATyojCwbQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_20.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The room is all white so that the wallpaper can be the star. But the back of the door was begging for something, so it received a coat of Benjamin Moore's Newburg Green. It is a stunner of a color and I want to use it again and again. I also added an \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2ZOTmDR\" target=\"_blank\">over-the-door organizer</a> for the iron and ironing board. We still need to change all of the hinges to black throughout the entire lower level.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2c-ABpO35To/XX-_W6PVknI/AAAAAAABOr8/ou7yqGxueY0phQYwe-uIor9A-8jL0JZqgCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_21.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2c-ABpO35To/XX-_W6PVknI/AAAAAAABOr8/ou7yqGxueY0phQYwe-uIor9A-8jL0JZqgCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_21.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Our washer and dryer are Maytag and they have been workhorses for us for over ten years now. As a family of five, we do laundry every single day so we couldn't be happier about the amount of use we have gotten out them so far. \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/10/laundry-room-update-lowering-hookups.html\" target=\"_blank\">We lowered our hookups and built them in a few years ago</a> and it was one of the best things we could have done. The folding counter has been such a game-changer to my laundry routine; I absolutely love all of the space there is to spread out and fold piles of towels or to layout my sweaters to air dry. Being that the units are now built-in, I am a little nervous for the day the washer/dryer goes out and we have to upgrade. I will be sure to share what that process looks like should that happen down the road (no jinxing it!).\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BbOsEuS4D_w/XYFIS68SFVI/AAAAAAABOvo/DVD9GLPBCrMapMzhJMx0rT5yfXWXuFNlgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_7.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BbOsEuS4D_w/XYFIS68SFVI/AAAAAAABOvo/DVD9GLPBCrMapMzhJMx0rT5yfXWXuFNlgCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_7.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The counter we selected is holding up great, no bowing or wear and tear from the daily use. Of course, I would have loved to have installed solid surface counters, but these were so much more budget-friendly and serve us perfectly well.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fp17gtARucA/XX-_WxFFtII/AAAAAAABOr4/CQ0lVMk7WqkcvGOrIxEvt_SOtr6FDaMGgCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_22.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fp17gtARucA/XX-_WxFFtII/AAAAAAABOr4/CQ0lVMk7WqkcvGOrIxEvt_SOtr6FDaMGgCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_22.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Laundry detergent and whitener are stored in \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2ZXCIBS\" target=\"_blank\">lidded glass canisters</a>...\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-RvUn6hjrk3Y/XX-_W10y-1I/AAAAAAABOsI/QmL2bHY3OBAz5cuMrjsDTkvw2orgUSCqQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_23.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-RvUn6hjrk3Y/XX-_W10y-1I/AAAAAAABOsI/QmL2bHY3OBAz5cuMrjsDTkvw2orgUSCqQCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_23.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />While the smaller essentials such as dryer balls, delicate wash, stain remover, and a lint brush, are all stored in \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/31mpHz9\" target=\"_blank\">a handy wire basket</a>.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tjmxkqLcIJ8/XX-_bmRPI3I/AAAAAAABOsI/ikeQ0Rv6S2gAga-Yl2gEoOAE0uZz2XJMACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tjmxkqLcIJ8/XX-_bmRPI3I/AAAAAAABOsI/ikeQ0Rv6S2gAga-Yl2gEoOAE0uZz2XJMACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_4.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I continue to be a superfan of \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2ZVpFRo\" target=\"_blank\">the deep stainless sink</a>; it has been used for dish washings, mop bucket fillings, stain soakings, and paint supply cleanings. It cleans up so nicely and is everything I could ask for.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-A6oa5NrsaUA/XX-_X3LhUfI/AAAAAAABOsE/DzGMFMrhiLEKQ7SMPe-Q_kRtSSZRp2yLwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_25.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-A6oa5NrsaUA/XX-_X3LhUfI/AAAAAAABOsE/DzGMFMrhiLEKQ7SMPe-Q_kRtSSZRp2yLwCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_25.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />As far as \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/31t88hf\" target=\"_blank\">the faucet</a> goes, although there is a pull-down nozzle, there is very little spraying power so that will probably get swapped out at some point. The faucet itself is of high quality and a really beautiful option.\n<br />\n<br />\n<i>Sidenote: Aren't those flowers absolutely beautiful? They are the prettiest colors and I clipped them straight from our yard. #staysummerforever&nbsp;</i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-D4rXi_2-JFE/XX-_b1MV8JI/AAAAAAABOr8/TaVowdCMnaQ6Yi6GY2qgBMKoIxYZkQ8tACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_5.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-D4rXi_2-JFE/XX-_b1MV8JI/AAAAAAABOr8/TaVowdCMnaQ6Yi6GY2qgBMKoIxYZkQ8tACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_5.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I shared \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2017/01/organizing-under-laundry-room-sink-diy.html\" target=\"_blank\">the organization of the sink cabinet here</a>, and how we installed \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2016/11/laundry-room-update-toetally-fantastic.html\" target=\"_blank\">a decorative toe kick here</a>. That decorative toe kick still makes my heart race; little details are so important.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3ews2fZsJV4/XX-_aRaDcpI/AAAAAAABOr8/DVrc38aDTW45_AKCN-cxAZqPm8hm2r4kgCEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_33.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The cabinet above the sink holds all of our frequently used home maintenance items; lightbulbs, extra paper products, \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2017/04/a-surprising-solution-for-smaller.html\" target=\"_blank\">sewing boxes</a>, puppy linens, stain remover, etc...\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QI-0I6JVoRo/XX-_ZJlHuSI/AAAAAAABOsE/nIQA5tCxMhAPqZdOfkiuEYenD_Uv0O6aACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img alt=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QI-0I6JVoRo/XX-_ZJlHuSI/AAAAAAABOsE/nIQA5tCxMhAPqZdOfkiuEYenD_Uv0O6aACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Laundry_Room_Wallpaper_Update_3.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" title=\"IHeart Organizing Laundry Room Storage Organization Wallpaper \" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Last but not least, how sweet is that little wooden rail of hooks? That is another DIY and I will share that tutorial soon as well. It was incredibly easy and inexpensive and it turned out to be one of my favorite accessories in the entire space.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>Bit by bit, one project at a time, our laundry room has evolved and changed so much over the years. This room is used multiple times per day so it is nice to have it fully functioning and feeling more complete. Chores are definitely more enjoyable when you are feeling good in your surroundings!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-H0OJ4av3G7o/XX_-B_-F-_I/AAAAAAABOu4/EuQQEi1Xz_8JihTElqj7lW1Qe2jMvJbywCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Post_Sources_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"45\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-H0OJ4av3G7o/XX_-B_-F-_I/AAAAAAABOu4/EuQQEi1Xz_8JihTElqj7lW1Qe2jMvJbywCNcBGAsYHQ/s1600/Post_Sources_2.png\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<center>\n <div class=\"boutique-widget\" data-widget-id=\"869671\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(w,i,d,g,e,t){if (!d.getElementById(i)) {element = d.createElement(t);element.id = i;element.src = 'https://widgets.rewardstyle.com' + e;d.body.appendChild(element);} if (typeof w[g] === 'object') { if (d.readyState === 'complete') { w[g].init(); }}}(window, 'boutique-script', document, '__boutique', '/js/boutique.js', 'script');</script>\n  <br />\n  <div class=\"rs-adblock\">\n   <img onerror=\"this.parentNode.innerHTML='Disable your ad blocking software to view this content.'\" src=\"https://assets.rewardstyle.com/production/a035083db2c3d76fd9a395fa848f89a543df7b3a/images/search/350.gif\" style=\"height: auto; max-height: 80%; max-width: 80%; width: auto;\" />\n   <noscript>\n    JavaScript is currently disabled in this browser.
