Kit!","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/04/gearing-up-for-your-next-organizing.html","description":"Hello, hello! I am excited to be dropping in with a small series I have been putting together for you all, which includes my all-time favorite organizing tips, tricks, advice, and products! It's been a long time coming to take everything I have learned over the years, whether it is working in my own home or working with others, and compiling it all in a single place here on the web.\n<br />\n<br />The four-part&nbsp;series will include:\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>Gearing Up for Your Next Organizing Project with a FREE Printable Kit!</b>\n<br />\n<br />Need helping getting started or prioritizing where to begin? What is the plan of attack? What is currently working well and what isn't? What storage do you need? Trying to get rid of things, but finding it hard to decide what to keep and what to pass on?\n<br />\n<br />I have put together a great printable kit to help you prioritize, sort, and navigate your way through your next organizing project(s), which includes a total of TEN free printables!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>My Top Organizing Tips!</b>\n<br />\n<br />Instead of digging through years of my archives to find individual tips, I am going to compile the best of the best in a single, very informational post! It's going to be a whopper and a really great resource for projects of any size.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>Labeling 101: Quick &amp; Easy Labeling Techniques</b>\n<br />\n<br />I have tried almost every type of label on the market, from vinyl to label makers to stickers and chalk markers, and they all have their place. But what are my tried and true favorites? What do I reach for with almost any project due to time, cost, practicality, and ease? I will be sharing three labeling techniques that haven't failed me yet, and that you won't need any fancy tools to utilize.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b>Practical, Everyday Storage Solutions!</b>\n<br />\n<br />If I have learned anything from raising three boys and organizing along the way, it is that storage can be expensive and that our needs are constantly evolving. Gone are the days where I purchase pretty bins and baskets to decorate with. Although I will always appreciate beautiful storage,&nbsp;it has to be versatile \n<i>and</i> it has to last! With that in mind, there are a few storage products that I have found that continuously work hard for me in a variety of situations, so they end up being the types of products I gravitate toward when working on any new projects. For the final post in the series, I am putting together the ultimate storage source list with tips and products that I have fallen in love with over the years.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />So let's dive in with the first of the four-part&nbsp;series: \n<i>Gearing Up for Your Next Organizing Project with a Free Printable Kit!</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mXNTaFXZmFQ/XKOcgpuH_TI/AAAAAAABN44/QLkPfQX9hqkG_4euoEfhrxxwvRbvakCHACLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Sorting_Boxes_Printable_Signs.Header.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"878\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mXNTaFXZmFQ/XKOcgpuH_TI/AAAAAAABN44/QLkPfQX9hqkG_4euoEfhrxxwvRbvakCHACLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Sorting_Boxes_Printable_Signs.Header.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />Today I have for&nbsp;you all \n<b>TEN</b> free printables!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />Now, you don't have to use all of these printables for a single organizing project. They all serve different purposes and can be helpful to guide and encourage in a variety of ways. They really emulate my thought process when working on projects of any scale, and serve as really wonderful tools to keep organizing projects organized!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2LEyFb9S2cw/XMBnWq_RrYI/AAAAAAABN-Q/miTk2ZA7q-kXkL6jASkEqzQYrfWi_7RZQCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Clutter_Clearing_Printable_Kit_02.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"500\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2LEyFb9S2cw/XMBnWq_RrYI/AAAAAAABN-Q/miTk2ZA7q-kXkL6jASkEqzQYrfWi_7RZQCLcBGAs/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Clutter_Clearing_Printable_Kit_02.2.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />Below you will find a link to each printable as well as a brief explanation on how to utilize each one.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\">____________________</span>\n</div>\n<br />\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n <tbody>\n  <tr>\n   <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b8Nj_wC_5sg/XMBnZfvji5I/AAAAAAABN_o/huYKdX-3Akc831ttLO7rFgCrUZY6mJvtQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Daily_Schedule.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"757\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b8Nj_wC_5sg/XMBnZfvji5I/AAAAAAABN_o/huYKdX-3Akc831ttLO7rFgCrUZY6mJvtQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Daily_Schedule.png\" /></a></td>\n  </tr>\n  <tr>\n   <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/xxhpi5imueg3757mm1c91hsx2lnf2u6c\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Daily Schedule printable</a><br />\n    <div>\n     <br />\n    </div></td>\n  </tr>\n </tbody>\n</table>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>The Daily Schedule printable is typically my key to prioritization when I am feeling overwhelmed and not quite sure where to begin. It also really helps me when I need to reconsider how I am using the hours throughout my day.\n<br />\n<br />It can be really eye-opening to spend a single day and track how your time is being utilized. It may shed light as to how much time is being wasted on social media, or simply bring attention to parts of the day that are just too chaotic.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n <br />\n <div>\n  <br />\n </div>\n</div>\n<i>From sun up to sun down, track the tasks you are doing throughout the day, as well as the specific details about what is working and what is not. Tasks could include exercising, making kid's lunches, getting ready in the morning, homework hour, dinner, clean-up, bill paying, etc... Are you noticing that certain times of the day cause you frustration? Do some tasks take longer than they should? Are there ways to streamline specific tasks so they are more manageable? This is a really great way to get a&nbsp;visual of a typical day and provide some insight on what tasks could use some organizational attention.</i>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />____________________</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br /></span>\n <br />\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TcelIhXRPe8/XMBneVUd-OI/AAAAAAABN_w/z24RZWE0Up0iPXu9D95sSq2wJLfOAQrewCEwYBhgL/s1600/Top_Five.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"464\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TcelIhXRPe8/XMBneVUd-OI/AAAAAAABN_w/z24RZWE0Up0iPXu9D95sSq2wJLfOAQrewCEwYBhgL/s1600/Top_Five.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\">\n     <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n      <tbody>\n       <tr>\n        <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"font-size: 12.8px;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/3gdt15odyak1jdqhtsjjasljhd3unqrm\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Top 5 Organizing Projects printable</a><br />\n         <div>\n          <br />\n         </div></td>\n       </tr>\n      </tbody>\n     </table></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n</div>My biggest tip when trying to figure out where to begin and prioritizing your projects is to focus on your day-to-day routine FIRST. The storage room can wait, it is important to get your days running smoothly before you can invest time on the outlying projects.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i>Looking at your day and tasks listed in the first printable, select the top five areas of your day that could use improvement. It is extremely important to factor in what those specific tasks are costing you in terms of time, money, and sanity.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>For example, if you are finding that you are unhappy with the process of lunch making for yourself or your kids each day, you can probably equate it to costing you money in wasted food or eating&nbsp;lunches out, and costing you time in the act of preparing the lunches each day. The solution may be creating a list of favorite lunch items, setting up a lunch making station in the pantry and fridge, and spending time making lunches in bulk on a Sunday afternoon.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />Prioritize your projects by the highest cost to the least (cost equating to time, money, and sanity). List out the problem as well as possible solutions. This printable is a great way to encourage brainstorming and to give yourself a starting point.</i>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />____________________</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o6vGOYp8TjU/XMBnbcXrdyI/AAAAAAABN_8/aGe88yFJLWQmjxyst5WKhmuYoy5JV_vbACEwYBhgL/s1600/Home_Zones.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"464\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o6vGOYp8TjU/XMBnbcXrdyI/AAAAAAABN_8/aGe88yFJLWQmjxyst5WKhmuYoy5JV_vbACEwYBhgL/s1600/Home_Zones.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/t7wvyf9azrufq8aa2qa0aztu7pfym9c5\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Home Zones printable</a><br />\n     <div>\n      <br />\n     </div></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n</div>Homes work best when they are set up into functioning \"zones\". That means categorizing specific closets, drawers, nooks, etc... into a specific zone and then detailing out what items make the most sense to be stored there.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i>In the first field, list a specific location or zone in your home. For example, an entryway closet. Then, give that location a general category in terms of how it should function. An entryway closet would generally function as a place to store outerwear and shoes, but may also act as a hub for cleaning and pet supplies.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>In the belongings field, list out the specific items that should be stored in that zone so that they match up with the working category. This is a very eye-opening exercise and really ensures that items are only being stored where they make the most sense vs. being scattered in multiple locations throughout the house.</i>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />____________________</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br /></span>\n <br />\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MggNbJCXP54/XMBncx-wClI/AAAAAAABN_w/yrIOrQ867mI5XyirlhRYdwkN2_SjXQcjACEwYBhgL/s1600/Project_Plan.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"757\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MggNbJCXP54/XMBncx-wClI/AAAAAAABN_w/yrIOrQ867mI5XyirlhRYdwkN2_SjXQcjACEwYBhgL/s1600/Project_Plan.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\">\n     <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n      <tbody>\n       <tr>\n        <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"font-size: 12.8px;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/rxnwfhvzecyw5nrzb7om0m17ity753yv\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Project Planner printable</a><br />\n         <div>\n          <br />\n         </div></td>\n       </tr>\n      </tbody>\n     </table></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n</div>Now that you have a specific project in mind, it's time to plan it out! This may not apply to smaller organizing tasks, such as a single drawer or your handbag, but it really comes in handy for those larger scale projects.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n <br />\n <div>\n  <br />\n </div>\n</div>\n<i>Utilize the top portion of the form to recognize and detail the specifics of what was already working, as well as what needs to be addressed by the end of the project.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>The bottom portion of the form is helpful for keeping track of specific steps or tasks to get from start to finish, as well as any products or supplies that need to be purchased along the way.</i>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />____________________</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br /></span>\n <br />\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xXbHngWHvHg/XMBniYogW9I/AAAAAAABN_8/2jIz-Z8TjMAMtReP6PuzSEvx7czDw2bogCEwYBhgL/s1600/Sketch_It.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"757\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xXbHngWHvHg/XMBniYogW9I/AAAAAAABN_8/2jIz-Z8TjMAMtReP6PuzSEvx7czDw2bogCEwYBhgL/s1600/Sketch_It.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/vx459jmcucagl12ntimfc8zm7nu2hc6g\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Sketch It printable</a><br />\n     <div>\n      <br />\n     </div></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n <br />\n</div>Sometimes it can be helpful to draw your drawer or closet to scale. I have been known to sketch out closets, pantries, and drawers ahead of time to be sure all of my storage needs fit and make sense. This exercise allows me to maximize the area that I am organizing and helps me to visualize the end goal.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n <br />\n <div>\n  <br />\n </div>\n</div>\n<i>Assign a specific measurement to each square and sketch up a general plan for your project. Grid out drawer organizers or design a full closet installation. The graphing area is useful for creating the outlines of bins and baskets to ensure that you get a nice fit and make the most of the available space.</i>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />____________________</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br /></span>\n <br />\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o_I8E2OrqFQ/XMBnd1ZAKiI/AAAAAAABN_0/hnABx7Ss6x8PJfaCpyjjsYRnRh0Gch2NACEwYBhgL/s1600/Storage_Planning.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"464\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o_I8E2OrqFQ/XMBnd1ZAKiI/AAAAAAABN_0/hnABx7Ss6x8PJfaCpyjjsYRnRh0Gch2NACEwYBhgL/s1600/Storage_Planning.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/paussmbrm41wrau4frrlh3x8fx5fm13e\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Storage Planning printable</a><br />\n     <div>\n      <br />\n     </div></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n <br />\n</div>Do you have a really large project that requires a lot of new storage? You can keep track of it all with this helpful storage printable!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <div style=\"text-align: start;\">\n  <br />\n </div>\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n  <br />\n  <div>\n   <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\"><br /></span></b>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div>\n<i>Larger closets and whole room makeovers require a variety of storage options for various belongings and item types. This printable allows you to keep track of the different categories, assign the ideal container, source the storage from a variety of locations, and most importantly, keep track of all of the dimensions.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>For example, you are organizing a walk-in closet. Item categories might be handbags, jewelry, dress shoes, sweaters, etc... Storage types would then be shelf dividers for the handbags, drawer organizers for the jewelry, shoe boxes for the dress shoes, and canvas boxes for the sweaters. In the form fields, keep track of the sources, quantities for each, and total available space/dimensions for each container type. In the end, you will have yourself a very thought-out shopping list to work from.</i>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />____________________</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vX7LfN_ngu0/XMBnd2BTGjI/AAAAAAABN_8/xvenRK-tvaYvtGylieWP3AjYrZLOCghxACEwYBhgL/s1600/Sorting_Signs.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"464\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vX7LfN_ngu0/XMBnd2BTGjI/AAAAAAABN_8/xvenRK-tvaYvtGylieWP3AjYrZLOCghxACEwYBhgL/s1600/Sorting_Signs.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/iqhn6oumj52acnp41tr2ih4qipg6n3bw\" style=\"font-size: 12.8px;\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Sorting Signs printable</a></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n <br />\n</div>After you have done all of the planning, it is time to empty the space and start your sorting!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WziEjH889wc/XMBnVk2OJxI/AAAAAAABN_4/_Kq9o-R1e2wBzqqV8xZg_GxrcelBMrvFACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sorting_Signs_Printable.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"600\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WziEjH889wc/XMBnVk2OJxI/AAAAAAABN_4/_Kq9o-R1e2wBzqqV8xZg_GxrcelBMrvFACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sorting_Signs_Printable.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n <br />\n <div>\n  <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\"><br /></span></b>\n </div>\n</div>\n<i>Download, print, and cut the sorting signs, then score some bonus points for running them through a laminator to get multiple uses out of them. Clip or tape the signs to cardboard boxes, bins, laundry baskets, or garbage bags to keep your piles separate and clearly labeled.&nbsp;</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>Four sorting signs are included:</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i><b>Move It!&nbsp;&nbsp;</b>Items that need to be moved to another area of the house.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i><b>Give It!</b>&nbsp; Items that are heading to a donation facility, friend, or family member.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i><b>Toss It!&nbsp;&nbsp;</b>Items that no longer serve you (or anyone else) due to quality/function.</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i><b>Sell It!&nbsp;&nbsp;</b>Items that need to be listed on Craigslist, Facebook, eBay, etc... or added to a yard sale pile.</i>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br class=\"Apple-interchange-newline\" />____________________</span>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--nX8b7x8zpM/XMBnZ3a8-LI/AAAAAAABN_4/Cq5CBeWPQLwtcxeooZC5xvn5USQ7-lEwgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Donation_Tracker.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"464\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--nX8b7x8zpM/XMBnZ3a8-LI/AAAAAAABN_4/Cq5CBeWPQLwtcxeooZC5xvn5USQ7-lEwgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Donation_Tracker.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/ubxx0xj8gzk0txejdd72gkrpt1tkt8az\" style=\"font-size: 12.8px;\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Donation Tracker printable</a></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Now that you are in the sorting mode, keep track of the items being donated for your tax records.\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n  <br />\n  <div>\n   <br />\n  </div>\n </div>\n <i>Make note of the donated item description and condition, as well as the organization that the item is being donated to. There are a variety of resources online to help you determine the appropriate value of the item, like <a href=\"https://www.amazinggoodwill.com/hubfs/docs/Donation_Value_Guide_-100115.pdf\" target=\"_blank\">this one</a> and <a href=\"https://www.bankrate.com/finance/taxes/valuation-guide-for-donated-goods.aspx\" target=\"_blank\">this one</a>. Clip the receipts that you receive from the charity at the time of the donation to the printable, and file it away with your tax documents.</i>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <span style=\"color: #999999;\">____________________</span>\n </div>\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <span style=\"color: #999999;\"><br /></span>\n  <br />\n  <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n   <tbody>\n    <tr>\n     <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0gaqsn1vKJ4/XMBnZSvczQI/AAAAAAABN_0/6SFT5B0TRZI8TlobJMvmlkwPXdklqeNtACEwYBhgL/s1600/Clutter_Clearing_Questions.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"757\" data-original-width=\"585\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0gaqsn1vKJ4/XMBnZSvczQI/AAAAAAABN_0/6SFT5B0TRZI8TlobJMvmlkwPXdklqeNtACEwYBhgL/s1600/Clutter_Clearing_Questions.png\" /></a></td>\n    </tr>\n    <tr>\n     <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/myqsgutdtx3x5v2m60j5grxywyb0fs3j\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Clutter Clearing printable</a><br />\n      <div>\n       <br />\n      </div></td>\n    </tr>\n   </tbody>\n  </table>\n </div>\n</div>\n<div>\n Right now the trend when sorting your belongings is to ask each item if it truly \"Sparks Joy\". While I agree that when you are sorting and touching each item, you probably get a gut sense of whether you should keep or discard the item, there are times when you need some extra nudging and guidance to make a decision that you are comfortable with.\n <br />\n <br />\n <div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n  <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Huo4pV4qQcQ/XMBnXP-ENWI/AAAAAAABN_k/TgiibEvNcCIv0Y5heyWylzfnnhudc2RCQCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Clutter_Clearing_Printable_Kit_03.2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"571\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Huo4pV4qQcQ/XMBnXP-ENWI/AAAAAAABN_k/TgiibEvNcCIv0Y5heyWylzfnnhudc2RCQCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Clutter_Clearing_Printable_Kit_03.2.png\" /></a>\n </div>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n  <br />\n  <div>\n   <br />\n  </div>\n </div>\n <i>I recommend printing (and laminating) this document and attaching it to a clipboard to keep nearby while sorting your belongings. If you find yourself holding something that is leaving you&nbsp;conflicted, use this printable to ask yourself a series of questions. A lot of times we continue to hold on to items out of guilt, maybe because we spent too much money on it or because we received the item as a gift. Many belongings hold sentimental value, but could possibly live on by taking a photo of it or scanning it in digitally. Other times it may come down to the amount of space you have vs. the number of items you would like to keep. Belongings can cost you in space, special storage requirements, ongoing maintenance, etc, and these questions will help you reassess that reality.</i>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <span style=\"color: #999999;\">____________________</span>\n </div>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<div>\n <table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center;\">\n  <tbody>\n   <tr>\n    <td style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9TzG6FiEomE/XJ6ULGe5cdI/AAAAAAABN3g/ltDHET1ME8IvTRxx32SEcYglhWLY10xvwCLcBGAs/s1600/Habit_Tracker_Portrait.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"776\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9TzG6FiEomE/XJ6ULGe5cdI/AAAAAAABN3g/ltDHET1ME8IvTRxx32SEcYglhWLY10xvwCLcBGAs/s1600/Habit_Tracker_Portrait.png\" /></a></td>\n   </tr>\n   <tr>\n    <td class=\"tr-caption\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://app.box.com/s/2t3d951e5gvgyckujwcpbld2lpsjwrqw\" style=\"font-size: 12.8px;\" target=\"_blank\">click HERE to download your FREE copy of the Clutter Clearing printable</a></td>\n   </tr>\n  </tbody>\n </table>\n <br />\n <br />Organization and habits go hand-in-hand. The act of organizing and adding storage will get you halfway, your habits are what complete the process. In fact, good habits are \n <b>the most important part of living a more organized life</b>. Whether it be encouraging your&nbsp;child to take his/her backpack to their room each day or reminding yourself to go to bed with an empty kitchen sink each night, creating a habit makes it easier and easier to get things accomplished each day and guides you in slowly changing things for the better over time.\n <br />\n <br />\n <br />\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\">H O W&nbsp; &nbsp;T O&nbsp; &nbsp;U S E&nbsp; &nbsp;T H I S&nbsp; &nbsp;P R I N T A B L E :</span></b>\n  <br />\n  <div>\n   <b><span style=\"color: #223a5d;\"><br /></span></b>\n  </div>\n </div>\n <i>Use the fields down the left-hand side to add the good habits you are trying to create. There are enough fields to do this as a family or to track multiple personal habits throughout your own day. To the right, there are 30 boxes to check. You can either start at the beginning of the month or start halfway through and set a goal to check as many boxes possible. I have heard that it takes 21 consecutive days for a habit to be formed, so by day 30 you should really be on your way to making a small difference in your life.</i>\n <br />\n <br />\n <div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n  <span style=\"color: #999999;\">____________________</span>\n </div>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />All of the free printables shared in this post are designed to be downloaded via the links provided. d2BTGjI/AAAAAAABN_8/xvenRK-tvaYvtGylieWP3AjYrZLOCghxACEwYBhgL/s1600/Sorting_Signs.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn61@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-46-286_a582c5b90b64a672.webp","https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WziEjH889wc/XMBnVk2OJxI/AAAAAAABN_4/_Kq9o-R1e2wBzqqV8xZg_GxrcelBMrvFACEwYBhgL/s1600/IHeart_Organizing_Sorting_Signs_Printable.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn89@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-47-560_425bc16dc54a122b.webp","https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--nX8b7x8zpM/XMBnZ3a8-LI/AAAAAAABN_4/Cq5CBeWPQLwtcxeooZC5xvn5USQ7-lEwgCEwYBhgL/s1600/Donation_Tracker.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn77@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-36-700_78f0c94c7bbc3eb8.webp","https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0gaqsn1vKJ4/XMBnZSvczQI/AAAAAAABN_0/6SFT5B0TRZI8TlobJMvmlkwPXdklqeNtACEwYBhgL/s1600/Clutter_Clearing_Questions.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn85@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-50-728_2bc61c6dd1bb8200.webp","https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Huo4pV4qQcQ/XMBnXP-ENWI/AAAAAAABN_k/TgiibEvNcCIv0Y5heyWylzfnnhudc2RCQCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Clutter_Clearing_Printable_Kit_03.2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn13@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-30-45-072_8bd4ca680b5f47f9.webp","https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9TzG6FiEomE/XJ6ULGe5cdI/AAAAAAABN3g/ltDHET1ME8IvTRxx32SEcYglhWLY10xvwCLcBGAs/s1600/Habit_Tracker_Portrait.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn74@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-44-350_961c0548281cf698.webp","https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jVRfO7uVsu0/XMBnfruQufI/AAAAAAABN_4/4K_R4cp3zSQ_GCGZO31tBZ9kq1Sm9MFzwCEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Printables_Kit_Portrait_Pages.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn42@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-30-38-674_579b3dfcac34fbc4.webp","https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QquRmMYebuM/XMBnehgYD9I/AAAAAAABN_0/tT46uqLy2W8ctA96laXWg7-4us5lMrNNACEwYBhgL/s1600/iHeart_Organizing_Printables_Kit_Horizontal_Pages.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn42@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-30-46-697_f4237e2af75999ea.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598308228320},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"An Organized Gifting Caddy","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/01/an-organized-gifting-caddy.html","description":"First, THANK YOU! I sincerely appreciate all of your encouraging comments on \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2019/01/catching-up-and-hello-to-2019.html\" target=\"_blank\">my last post</a>, as well as the abundance of emails and messages I received. This community really amazes me, and I adore that we all bond over a passion for our homes and organization! It sounds like many of you are on a quest to simplify and reduce home clutter with me this year, which keeps me awake at night with excitement! Let's do this 2019!\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_HEADER_zpsumzvw5k9.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"484\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_HEADER_zpsumzvw5k9.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />I have always been a bit of a sentimentalist, and I really love giving gifts to friends and family throughout the year. Just as much as I find joy in the process of looking for something thoughtful to give, I also really enjoy the process of wrapping it all up! I have absolutely nothing against a gift box or bag, but sometimes it just feels a little more special to add a ribbon, embellishment, a handwritten note, an ornament, monogrammed&nbsp;tag, etc... And those extra touches don't have to take much time, but they really go along way.\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<a name=\"more\"></a>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />Five years ago I put together \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2013/12/diy-gift-wrap-organization-station.html\" target=\"_blank\">the ultimate gift wrapping station</a>. It had extra of everything from twine, bows, bags, boxes, tissue and quite a few rolls of gift wrap. It was epic and went viral and I don't regret the project for a second. It served me quite well over the years, and it has taken me a long time to work my way through a lot of the supplies and cards. But it was a bit much. And over the years as the nearby counter became cluttered with toys and Lego builds, I would gather my supplies and take them to my office or the kitchen table to do my wrapping. In my quest to reduce and simplify this year, I decided that it was time to downsize this part of my life in a way that takes up less space and offers some portability.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_04.2_zpspbcxk4jn.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"444\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_04.2_zpspbcxk4jn.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I actually put all of this together last month before Christmas, and it couldn't have worked out better. And because I can still use it year-round for anniversaries, birthdays, and \n<i>just-because</i> days, I decided I would share the&nbsp;tote-tastic&nbsp;idea with you!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/IKEA_KUGGIS_zps5sdvtvrg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"300\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/IKEA_KUGGIS_zps5sdvtvrg.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I began with \n<a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/10280203/\" target=\"_blank\">the large KUGGIS&nbsp;bin</a> found at IKEA. I have used smaller versions of these bins and I absolutely LOVE them. They really have become one of my \"go-to\" storage items as of late. However, this is my first time using this particular size, and I was ridiculously eager to try out the addition of \n<a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/00280208/\" target=\"_blank\">the divided organizing tray</a> that tucks away nicely inside.\n<br />\n<br />The top tray is really great for smaller embellishments and cards. It can also fit a smaller address book (if you are old-school like me and still use one of those during the holidays).\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_16.2_zps9rnu9ymk.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"533\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_16.2_zps9rnu9ymk.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />If I am at a stationery store and spot a nice greeting card, I pick them up so I can be prepared ahead of time for special dates or for those celebrations that come up last minute. The larger areas of the tray are a really wonderful size to fit all of those greeting cards, thank you notes and envelopes.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_16.3_zpsk5d6n8zq.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"600\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_16.3_zpsk5d6n8zq.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I also like to add tags, ornaments, bows, etc... and the smaller divided areas are a nice way to divide out the tapes, twine, and gift toppers. I also keep a few gift cards on hand to hand out randomly when the mood strikes (I just put a small amount on each and will give them to strangers or kind employees&nbsp;as a random act of kindness).\n<br />\n<br />There is more magic happening below the tray, which is completely removable.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_20_zps2u8bb06i.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_20_zps2u8bb06i.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The nice thing about this bin is the amount of space/storage to keep everything all together. The base of the bin is a nice size for gift bags, boxes and larger sheets of tissue. I found some food storage containers at the dollar store to add a little extra division for the bows, tissue and smaller ribbon spools. They are light-weight and inexpensive and couldn't have worked out better.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_08_zpszbve5vvl.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_08_zpszbve5vvl.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I used&nbsp;\n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2TTJSR8\" target=\"_blank\">a small tension rod</a>&nbsp;for my larger spools of ribbon, placed at the outer edge of the bin. It is easy to be removed if I need to swap out a roll but stays in place for grabbing a quick bit to add to a package.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_21.2_zpsgt4rqzuu.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"533\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_21.2_zpsgt4rqzuu.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i>I use a small piece of masking/painters tape on each spool to keep the ribbon from loosening inside of the bin in-between uses.</i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8cGqaoamVow/XD4N67fN2VI/AAAAAAABNkA/_RSXfrTm3fkQcqwxE0prUW1lf8qdPzQfACEwYBhgL/s1600/Webp.net-gifmaker%2B%25283%2529.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"393\" data-original-width=\"590\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8cGqaoamVow/XD4N67fN2VI/AAAAAAABNkA/_RSXfrTm3fkQcqwxE0prUW1lf8qdPzQfACEwYBhgL/s1600/Webp.net-gifmaker%2B%25283%2529.gif\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Above you can see the entire bin in action and how everything stacks in a compact and portable tote.\n<br />\n<br />I have also really condensed my gift wrap rolls down; I find it best to actually only purchase solid craft, black or a simple stripe/dot gift wrap that can be versatile year round. That allows the ribbon and toppers to shine and also keeps the number of rolls that I have to store to a minimum. I currently just keep them in a corner of my office closet until I can finish up with a little refresh of that space in the near future.\n<br />\n<br />I also looked into an under-bed bin that would allow me to store the rolls and cards/embellishments together, however, our bed frame doesn't allow for most of those bin sizes. But they are another great option for doing something similar. Here are a couple of those options:\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<center>\n <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3442477\">\n  <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ? Reactivate it to view this content.\n   </noscript>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</center>\n<br />\n<br />I was able to condense my large bookcase of packaging and gift wrap items down into a mobile gift wrap station and it couldn't have worked better this past Christmas.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_17_20_zps07zqxfc4.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"813\" data-original-width=\"600\" src=\"https://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Gifting%20Caddy/Organized_Gift_Wrap_Storage_Bin_Kit_IHeart_Organizing_17_20_zps07zqxfc4.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />Also, I am totally sold on the amount of storage and functionality this KUGGIS bin offers! I have also seen the tray insert used inside of a drawer as a divider for tech and office gear and it was brilliant. So tell me, have you tried these bins and if so, how do you put them to use around your home?\n<br />\n<br />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 15 Jan 2019 22:27:00
