06:30:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:30:28","title":"An Organized Teen Boy Closet","link":"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/06/an-organized-teen-boy-closet.html","description":"Our son's closet came together even better than I could have imagined! I love every last detail, and the best part is that all it took was some simple DIY and a few off-the-shelf organizers to create a whole lot of storage.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_9_zpsiyp9ybgf.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_9_zpsiyp9ybgf.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>Our almost 14-year-old son currently has the smallest room in the house. But we don't want it to feel that way so we have been making a lot of changes to open it up and add smart storage.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/DIY_Wall_Shelf_EKBY_Hack_17_zpsw66bcdao.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/DIY_Wall_Shelf_EKBY_Hack_17_zpsw66bcdao.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I think two different actions accomplished that feeling of openness we were after; painting the walls a solid light blue-gray (almost white color - Sherwin William's Nebulous White) and widening the closet opening to create more storage that will ultimately live behind a closed door (see that post \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/02/teen-boys-closet-how-to-patch-walls.html\" target=\"_blank\">here</a>).\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Blank_Slate_Room_Update_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_02_zpse4kzcujk.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Blank_Slate_Room_Update_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_02_zpse4kzcujk.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />And a quick reminder of the closet the day before we cleared it out for a makeover:\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Boy_Bedroom_Closet_Makeover_Phase_1_IHeart_Organizing_1_zpshs9hh7ro.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Boy_Bedroom_Closet_Makeover_Phase_1_IHeart_Organizing_1_zpshs9hh7ro.png\" data-original-height=\"733\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>\n<br />And here it is today!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_9.2_zpsd73yndwe.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_9.2_zpsd73yndwe.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Although \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2012/06/conquering-clothing-clutter-kids-closet.html\" target=\"_blank\">the last make-shift closet system</a> served us well for quite some time, the biggest problem we all had is that our son had outgrown the bins and they were literally bursting at the seams. He needed some actual drawers and to keep his bedroom floor area nice and open, we wanted to add those drawers inside of the closet. I also wanted to be sure he had a place for his shoes off of the floor and that we made the most of the 8 feet of vertical space, so after looking at a variety of options, I decided on the \n<a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/70214564/\" target=\"_blank\">IKEA PAX wardrobe frame</a> (measuring in at 29 1/2\" wide x 22 7/8\" deep x 79 1/4\" tall). This unit offers more than enough space and I appreciate that there is plenty of room for him as he continues to grow.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_8.2_zpskt8jemgi.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_8.2_zpskt8jemgi.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />This kiddo is the beneficiary of a lot of hand-me-down items. Not only does he have an older brother that has always taken pretty good care of his belongings, but we have a few friends with older boys that like to pass on their clothes as well. We try to limit the number of clothing items we keep in general, but it is also nice to have some options. The updated closet not only provides adequate storage for his current wardrobe, but also for the plethora of hand-me-downs waiting for when he goes through another growth spurt.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_2.2_zpskh1curxf.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_2.2_zpskh1curxf.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />So let's talk about the hand-me-downs for a minute. We have three boys so we do our best to preserve and reuse clothes as much as possible. They grow at different rates and are always different sizes, so there are times we need to store those extra clothes that they just haven't grown into yet. Twice a year we do a quick closet purge and inventory and rotate out their closets (spring and fall). I prefer to keep their hand-me-downs stored on the top shelf of their closets, and in this room, \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2LpAXT0\" target=\"_blank\">these medium Elfa drawers</a> were the perfect solution. Did you know that although they are meant to be used with the Elfa drawer system, they can also be used as stackable bins? Mind. Blown. I love that they are frosted and sturdy and come with slim lids that clip in. They are a really great size and by using two, we were able to easily fit them on top of the IKEA tower in our son's closet.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_7_zps1qapdjpt.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_7_zps1qapdjpt.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />These two bins hold 10+ pairs of jeans in a variety of sizes, as well as dress shirts/pants, shorts, sweats, t-shirts, etc... I found that I had plenty of room to roll and stack the items inside.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_4_zpsv9vunut8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_4_zpsv9vunut8.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />To keep track of the contents, I created and printed out a quick inventory tracker that I filled out and tucked under the lid. I am able to see through the lid just enough that this worked out perfectly, but the sheet could also slide into a clear plastic sleeve on top of a solid bin as well.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_1_zpsqppok2nc.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_1_zpsqppok2nc.png\" data-original-height=\"714\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />You can also download the trackers for free if you would like!\n<br />\n<br />\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"tr-caption-container\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_6_zpsfwfmexss.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Now, back to his current clothing...\n<br />\n<br />Remember how we \n<a href=\"http://www.iheartorganizing.com/2018/03/do-it-yourself-quick-and-easy.html\" target=\"_blank\">DIY'd the easiest custom drawer dividers ever</a>? I can't rave about them enough! They worked out so well in these drawers and offered us a lot of flexibility.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_27_zpsyp3ewd7y.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_27_zpsyp3ewd7y.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I divided the top drawer into three slots; one for pajamas, one for socks, and another for underwear.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_14_zpslkmmiyn6.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_14_zpslkmmiyn6.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i><b>Quick Tip:</b> I typically purchase a different type of sock for each boy, one to two packages of white and one package of black. This makes it easy to identify which socks belong to which boy, and also allows them to just toss their socks into their drawer with no matching necessary. In the past, I have also used colored Sharpies to mark the bottoms which helped in identifying and quickly sorting all of their socks after washes (or when they are laying all over the house).</i>\n<br />\n<br />The next drawer down divides his bulky hooded sweatshirts and shorts.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_15_zpsogbxu97e.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_15_zpsogbxu97e.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Then his short sleeved t-shirts, sweatpants and sweatshirts, and long sleeve t-shirts are divided into three narrower sections.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_16_zpsgudirrzi.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_16_zpsgudirrzi.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"></div>The following drawer is all of his athletic wear, swim and extra space for future sports uniforms.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_18_zpspjvutcap.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_18_zpspjvutcap.png\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />The bottom drawer has plenty of room for sheets and seasonal bedding.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_19_zpssvemkija.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_19_zpssvemkija.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />And the smaller pull-out at the bottom holds his shoes.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_20_zpsmowyfyhc.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_20_zpsmowyfyhc.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />You may have also noticed that I added some labels to the top of each drawer, which can be seen when the drawer is both closed and open. I used \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2sJKyfN\" target=\"_blank\">this label maker</a> with clear tape.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_28_zpshnagzmrp.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_28_zpshnagzmrp.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_17_zpsb1y9wcge.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_17_zpsb1y9wcge.png\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Our son prefers to fold his clothes vs. hanging them, and this folding method was so quick and easy for him to learn. He basically files his clothes so that everything is visible and compact.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8yBJY4NGfpk/WxatayM_CVI/AAAAAAABMgI/EvrL7XzNpDo09rhqVeauabbKzT5BDoi5gCEwYBhgL/s1600/Shirt_Folding_Steps_IHeart_Organizing_Gif.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8yBJY4NGfpk/WxatayM_CVI/AAAAAAABMgI/EvrL7XzNpDo09rhqVeauabbKzT5BDoi5gCEwYBhgL/s1600/Shirt_Folding_Steps_IHeart_Organizing_Gif.gif\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />Four easy steps, the shirts can be folded in just a few seconds each.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Shirt_Folding_Steps_IHeart_Organizing_zpsfcietxzh.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Shirt_Folding_Steps_IHeart_Organizing_zpsfcietxzh.png\" data-original-height=\"891\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i>1. Shirt face down</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>2. Fold in both sleeves</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>3. Fold bottom up to the top (in half)</i>\n<br />\n<i><br /></i> \n<i>4. Repeat and fold the bottom up again (in half)</i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />Everything else is just rolled or folded to best fit in each divided section.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_22_zps0jqjfvsh.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_22_zps0jqjfvsh.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />For the clothes that he does hang (essentially anything a little dressier with a collar or buttons), we installed \n<a href=\"https://www.homedepot.com/p/Everbilt-72-in-x-1-5-16-in-Heavy-Duty-Oak-Closet-Pole-HD-0015-6OK/205561104\" target=\"_blank\">a solid oak closet rod</a> which I stained a warm wood tone. And as always, I recommend doubling up on the rods whenever possible.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_12_zpseqkzq7r0.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_12_zpseqkzq7r0.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />And used \n<a href=\"https://www.homedepot.com/p/Everbilt-1-5-16-in-Heavy-Duty-Bronze-Closet-Pole-Sockets-2-Pack-EH-WSTHDUS-338/300262688\" target=\"_blank\">black closet rod sockets</a> to compliment the other black hardware in the closet.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_26_zpszcwoenya.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_26_zpszcwoenya.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />We also added two solid white shelves above each rod to offer a little extra storage if needed. We recessed them back a bit so that we could place the hand-me-down bins up top without any issue.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_11_zpsktskjme8.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_11_zpsktskjme8.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />And \n<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2Jmg7DD\" target=\"_blank\">these slim, no-slip hangers</a> have been really great for the price.\n<br />\n<br />Both the drawers and the shelves in the tower are quite deep, almost two feet in fact. This is great for the drawers, he has plenty of spare space to continue to grow. The shelves, of course, prove to be a little more difficult to utilize. But, the top shelf holds some heavier throw blankets that we use for sleepovers/guests, the next shelf holds a couple of \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2LnNOVL\" target=\"_blank\">light-weight woven baskets</a> to conceal his everyday clutter (nerf guns, tech gadgets, etc...), and the lower shelf has a few \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2LqRxC5\" target=\"_blank\">document boxes</a> for memorabilia and arts &amp; crafts.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_24_zpsksmo6nut.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_24_zpsksmo6nut.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />I also added a small \"valet\" type \n<a href=\"http://bit.ly/2JrAiTZ\" target=\"_blank\">tray</a> to hold his daily items and act as a drop zone.\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_13_zpszjnh7ckm.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_13_zpszjnh7ckm.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />It's funny that this was one of his favorite details, I guess it made him feel a bit more \"adult\" to have a place for his wallet, change, watch, sunglasses, and deodorant.\n<br />\n<br />And that completes the closet tour!\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_8_zpsowzyrzvf.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_8_zpsowzyrzvf.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<br />With our boy entering high-school this coming fall, this closet project came at the perfect time! The previous closet functioned so well for so long when the boys were much smaller, but this is definitely an upgrade fit for a teenager.\n<br />\n<br />A few more notes:\n<br />\n<br />\n<ul>\n <li>I love that the IKEA tower is versatile and customizable. We added the <a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/20246360/\" target=\"_blank\">pull-out shoe tray</a>, five <a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/90246352/\" target=\"_blank\">large clothing drawers</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/00277989/\" target=\"_blank\">three shelves</a> to put together this configuration.</li>\n <li>I added <a href=\"http://bit.ly/2LrvhrZ\" target=\"_blank\">this hardware</a> to the drawers, which I sprayed in a flat black finish.</li>\n <li>All of the drawers are soft close! So nice!</li>\n <li><a href=\"http://bit.ly/2BqbSFX\" target=\"_blank\">This is the paper</a> I used to line the back of the tower (I just adhered it to the back panel with double-sided carpet tape before tacking it to the back of the frame).</li>\n <li>Although we designed this closet for a teen boy, it is versatile enough to work for anyone of any age! Always a bonus.</li>\n <li>We plan to add a sliding door next to conceal everything, which almost makes me sad because I love how it turned out so much! But also, teenage boy.</li>\n <li>I considered adding a small step stool under his pants, but the boy is officially as tall as me and has no problem reaching his everyday items. Sigh....</li>\n</ul>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n This install has also sold us on updating our own closet with the PAX system down the road. It was so easy and versatile and the quality is really great. Not to mention, I love that there are so many ways to customize it to make it look unique, even though it is off-the-shelf at IKEA (they are not sponsoring me by the way, just my honest thoughts).\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_23_zpsj5nvcgvq.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Kid_Closet_Organization_Teen_Boy_IHeart_Organizing_23_zpsj5nvcgvq.png\" data-original-height=\"825\" data-original-width=\"550\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n Let's end the post with a fun before and after to see how much was gained by removing the wing wall and installing a fully functional closet system.\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Bedroom_Closet_Organization_Before_After_IHeart_Organizing_zpstwz1kquo.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad14/iheartorganizing/Post%20Images/Bedroom_Closet_Organization_Before_After_IHeart_Organizing_zpstwz1kquo.png\" data-original-height=\"432\" data-original-width=\"600\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n For reference, I rounded up all of the closet sources below.\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-igD3nUEg_7g/Wxbj92mtndI/AAAAAAABMkY/hmj8LwplSxwFZ6Bkb7aDyJnoI-KXiPnfQCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"28\" data-original-width=\"500\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-igD3nUEg_7g/Wxbj92mtndI/AAAAAAABMkY/hmj8LwplSxwFZ6Bkb7aDyJnoI-KXiPnfQCLcBGAs/s1600/Post_Product_Sources.png\" /></a>\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n</div>\n<div>\n <br />\n <center> \n  <div class=\"shopthepost-widget\" data-widget-id=\"3160981\">\n   <script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(d,s,id){var e, p = /^http:/.test(d.location) ?
